DONA TULLPI PARA UN COLEGIO ENTERO DE HUANCAYO-PERÚ ¡Estás haciendo un gran esfuerzo para ayudarnos a dar descubrir a los pequeños genios escondidos alrededor del mundo! ¡Nosotros y los 70 niños de la Escuela Fe y Alegría 66 en Huancayo, que impactarás directamente, siempre te recordarán! ¡Gracias por ayudarlos a descubrir la alegría de aprender matemáticas! En recompensa, como un individuo o empresa, ¡serás parte de los kits entregados a estos niños! ¡Y recibirás un agradecimiento ultra-especial!

¿Cómo obtener tu recompensa?

Hay dos modalidades de pago: usando tu tarjeta de débito/crédito o a través de PayPal.

Primero escoge la recompensa que quieres. Y da click sobre ella. 


Esto te llevará a una página en donde tendrás que ingresar tus datos.

¿Cómo pagar con tu tarjeta de débito/crédito?

Llena tu nombre y correo electrónico. Luego, si tu recompensa lo requiere, se te pedirá la dirección a donde será enviada. SI eres de Perú y no sabes tu código postal puedes consultarla en esta web. 

Luego necesitaras los datos de tu tarjeta.

- Nombre en la tarjeta: es el nombre del dueño de la tarjeta. En algunas tarjetas este aparece en la parte frontal de la tarjeta en otras no.

- Número de la tarjeta: es el número de 16 dígitos que aparece en la cara frontal de tu tarjeta.

- Fecha de expiración: es la fecha que aparece en la parte frontal de tu tarjeta en el formato MM/AA.

- Código de seguridad: es el número de 3 dígitos que aparece en la parte trasera de la tarjeta.

- Código postal: es el código postal en el que se realizará la facturación. El código sea el mismo que has introducido en la parte anterior.  Si no conoces tu código postal puedes buscarlo aquí.


Para makers y hackers

Los planos en CAD de la base y el reflector estarán disponibles para todos, así que podrás hacer tus propios diseños del kit, agregándole tu toque personal.

Nuestra tecnología está construida para trabajar en Unity, la herramienta más popular para desarrollo de videojuegos, con disponibilidad para realizar complicaciones en Android y iOS. Si eliges el kit de desarrollador tendrás acceso temprano al SDK para jugar y ¡desarrollar nuevas experiencias y juegos utilizando nuestra tecnología!

Somos un equipo apasionado que cree que la educación es la herramienta más poderosa y transformadora. Reunimos experiencia en visión de computadora, pedagogía, interacción humano-computadora y diseño.

               

Adolfo Valdivieso (Tecnología): Yo le enseño a las computadoras a reconocer y rastrear tapas de botellas, desarrollo los videojuegos y ese tipo de cosas.

Evelyn Gómez (Operaciones):  Yo hago que las cosas suceden cueste lo que cueste.

Félix Valdivieso (Pedagogía): Estos chicos necesitan supervisión de un adulto.

Gerardo Hurtado (Arte & Diseño): Yo hago que cada parte de Tullpi le saque una sonrisa a los niños. 


Una de las cosas que hemos aprendido en el proceso es que si estás construyendo algo para los niños, tienes que probar ¡todo! los niños siempre piensan fuera de la caja. ¿No me creen? Vean estas fotos…

Y es por esto que nunca dejamos de probar y aprender de los niños, para poder capaces de crear la experiencia adecuada para ellos.

Durante nuestras primeras entrevistas con padres y profesores, descubrimos que las mejores prácticas en matemática tienen un rasgo en común: la transformación de objetos simples (como alimentos, carros de juguete…) o actividades cotidianas (como el almuerzo, la compra de los alimentos…) en espacios ricos de aprendizaje. Esto, combinado con las preguntas adecuadas y paciencia dan los mejores resultados.

Creemos que hay una gran oportunidad para crear experiencias de aprendizaje impresionantes y significativas, con sólo poner un poco de magia en este tipo de elementos. Y esta es la ruta que queremos explorar. Hoy en día usamos tapitas de botellas pero mañana será...

Siempre hay retos, pero nuestra promesa es que creceremos hasta alcanzarlos. Haremos todo lo que esté en nuestras manos para entregar nuestras recompensas a tiempo o antes.

Nostros estamos comprometidos con mantener informados a todos los nuestros contribuyentes. Nuestra promesa de entrega será desafiada en todo momento por las complejidades conocidas de fabricación, producción, envío, y mucho más.

Por lo tanto, en caso de que surjan problemas inesperados, haremos nuestro mayor esfuerzo por minimizar el impacto sobre ustedes, quienes nos apoyan, y nos dedicaremos a proveerles la mejor experiencia.

Si tienes alguna pregunta o duda, no dudes en escribirme a adolfo@tullpi.com


¡Muchísimas gracias!




Preguntas frecuentes

- ¿Si se me pierde una tapita, cómo la reemplazo?

Tullpi funciona con cualquier tapita de botella de plástico de tamaño regular (30mm), es por eso que puedes reemplazar estas tapitas con alguna otra que encuentres en casa y decidas reciclar. ¡No hay problema!

- ¿Para qué sirve el tablero en el kit donado?

Las tablets que son donadas, a los colegios públicos dentro de Maba, tienen la cámara en una esquina y no en el centro, como el iPad, es por ello que para jugar es necesario delimitar campo de juego y así se les haga más fácil a los niños saber dónde pueden poner la tapita y hacer que el  juego funcione de la forma adecuada.

- ¿En qué idiomas está la aplicación?

La aplicación está desarrollada en español e inglés. 

- ¿Funciona para Android?

La aplicación de Tullpi ha sido desarrollada para sistema operativo Android y iOs. Sin embargo, nuestro juego cuenta además con un kit físico, en esta primera producción éste ha sido diseñado para el iPad. Nuestro próximo diseño será para una Tablet Android, y junto a la comunidad de esta campaña decidiremos para cuál lo haremos.

- ¿Para qué iPads funciona?

Actualmente Tullpi funciona con el iPad 2, 3, 4, iPad air 1, 2, iPad mini 2, 4.

- ¿Por qué tapitas?

En colegios donde no pueden permitirse el comprar el material convencional usado para aprender matemáticas (porque es costoso), les piden a los padres coleccionar tapitas de botella, lo cual es una solución genial, las tapas de botella son fáciles de manipular y vienen en diferentes colores, lo cual se aprovecha para identificar cada color con un concepto distinto, así las tapas azules se asocian a las unidades, las rojas a las decenas y las verdes a las centenas.

- ¿Qué juegos tendrá Tullpi?

Tullpi viene con nuestro primer juego FIRST, una colección de juegos educativos de matemática, éste contiene 6 juegos que desarrollan el contenido que un niño aprende en su primer año de educación escolar: Contar, Sumas 1, Sumas 2, Restas, Sistema numérico, Doble y Mitad.

En este tiempo de desarrollo lo que aprendimos fue que absolutamente todo debe ser diseñado en base a lo que el usuario quiere y requiere, así que el desarrollo de nuestros nuevos juegos será en base a lo que ustedes, nuestros primeros usuarios, nos digan que quieren o necesitan.

- ¿Sólo se puede jugar con tapitas?

Nuestro primer juego, FIRST, está diseñado para que funcione solo con tapitas, sin embargo seguiremos creando nuevos juegos y éstos podrían funcionar con elementos que pueden sorprendernos incluso a nosotros.

- ¿Quién dona las tablets?

Para jugar Tullpi es necesario tener una Tablet, entonces es necesario que los colegios públicos a los que donamos Tullpi cuenten con tablets para usar en clase. Por ello, nosotros trabajamos en conjunto con el Proyecto Maba (www.proyectomaba.org), nuestro aliado estratégico, ellos implementan el uso de tablets como recurso para el aprendizaje en colegios de zonas vulnerables/rurales de Perú y nosotros donamos los kits para jugar Tullpi.



English Version

 

We created Tullpi because we see children frustrated with the conventional ways of learning math.

Tullpi transforms math into a constant experiment, creating an intuitive connection between abstract numbers and objects in the real world. Children use simple bottle caps to solve mathematical challenges with their own hands.

Tullpi offers you a kit that transforms your iPad into a play/learn station. And for each kit purchased, we implement one in a public school in a vulnerable area.

From the ages of 4 to 7, children are facing what is most likely the biggest challenge of their cognitive development: the transition from understanding the world through their senses (called concrete thinking) to represent reality through symbols, concepts and models (called abstract thinking). At this stage children require the use of tangible elements to be able to process information and constantly test their ideas.

That is why the best education programs around the world focus on the use of tangible elements to help children to overcome this challenge.

We took it to another level.

Tullpi creates a bridge between the world the child naturally understands and these new challenging concepts.



With Tullpi, your child learns to count, sum, subtract, what are units, tens, hundreds, to find the double and a half, while he/she wins stars and conquers planets. In summary, everything kids have to learn in the first year of school, but making it fun!


In schools where they could not afford to buy the conventional equipment used for math education (because they are kind of expensive), they asked parents to collect bottle caps. It is a great solution because bottle caps are easy to manipulate, they have different colors.

The reflector has a small inclined mirror inside, that should be placed on the tablet (as shown below). This way, the frontal camera will capture the area of the table in front of the tablet, detecting the position and color of the bottle caps.

In the image below, you can see what is the role of the reflector and how the bottle cap detection works.

We are from Peru and our country ranks last in math education, as shown in the graph below. This is why we felt something had to be done.

But the sad thing about this result is it is strongly tied to the socioeconomic class, which means that there is a huge gap between the quality of the education a few people can get and the deficient or inexistent education that the rest receive.

This scenario is present in many other countries, especially in Latin-america.

For each kit purchased, we implement one in a school in a vulnerable or rural area.

Around the world, there are many initiatives to bring tablet-based educative content such as Xprize Global Learning Challenge or Curious Learning to allow kids in vulnerable and rural areas achieve basic levels of literacy and numeracy. Thanks to the decreasing price of tablets, we believe this is an opportunity to make a real impact.

We invested a lot of effort to make our games work well even in low budget tablets with the intention of being able to implement Tullpi in programs for math education improvement. Most of them use these kinds of tablets.

What is Maba?

Maba Project is a non for profit initiative that has partnered with Curious Learning (Global Literacy Project) with the intention of improving math and science levels in the most vulnerable schools in Peru. They implement tablets, a connection to fast internet, give access to countless digital educational content and train teachers.


They started last year with seven schools achieving extraordinary results (an increase up to 12% percent in math competences). These results have accelerated their growth, causing them to expand to 14 schools this year.

The challenge

Tullpi will be implemented in their 7 initial schools, for all the kids in the first year of primary school. That is around 700 kids! This is just our first challenge. And for this we need your help!

The base and reflector are made out of laser cutted plywood.

This kit was specially designed for the tablet used in this schools. And because the camera is placed on a side of the tablet (instead of being on the middle) and it's opening angle is very narrow, the tablet have to be placed higher and we included a board that helps the kid to place the bottle caps on the right place and have a better sense of their playing field.

The donated kits go to the schools in a twelve pack box. This helps reduce the space used inside the classroom and facilitates the delivery process during class. Imagine how hard would be to handle 28 to 32 boxes for each teacher.


For makers and hackers

The CAD files of the base and reflector will be available, so you can make your own designs and add a personal touch.

Our technology is built to work with Unity, the most popular game development engine. If you get a developer kit you will have early access to the SDK to start playing and developing new experiences and games using our technology.

We are a team that believes education is the most empowering and transformative tool. We gather experience in computer vision, pedagogy, human computer interaction and design.

                 

Adolfo Valdivieso (Technology): I teach computers to recognize and track bottle caps, develop video-games and that kind of stuff.

Evelyn Gómez (Operations): I make things happen whatever it takes.

Félix Valdivieso (Pedagogy): These guys needed some adult supervision.

Gerardo Hurtado (Art & Design): I make sure that every single part of Tullpi brings a smile in the kid's face.


One of the things we learned in the process is that if you are building something for kids, you have to test everything as kids always think outside the box. Don’t believe me? Check this pictures…

In our early interviews with parents and teachers, we found that the best practices in math had a common trait: transforming simple objects (such as food, car toys or so) or everyday activities (buying groceries, cleaning the house, etc.) into rich learning spaces. This combined with asking the right questions and patience gave them the best results.

We believe there is a great opportunity to create awesome and significant learning experiences, just by putting a little bit of magic into these kinds of elements. And this is the route we want to explore. Today we use bottle caps but tomorrow will be…

There are always challenges, but our promise is that we'll rise to meet them. We'll do everything in our power to ship our rewards on time or earlier.

We are committed to keep our backers informed. Our promise to deliver will be challenged at all times by the known complexities of manufacturing, production, shipping, and more.

Therefore, in the event that unexpected issues arise, we will do our biggest effort to minimize the impact on our backers and dedicate ourselves to providing the best experience.

If you have any question or doubt, don’t hesitate to write me to adolfo@tullpi.com



Thank you very much!!!




FAQs

- If I lose a bottle cap how can I replace it?

Tullpi works with any plastic bottle cap of regular size (30 mm), which is why you can replace these caps with some other you find at home and decide to recycle. No problem!

- What is the board in the kit donated?

The tablets that are donated to public schools (part of Maba), have the camera in a corner and not in the center, like the iPad, which is why is necessary to define the play field and in that way make easier for children to know where they can put the cap and make the game to function properly.

-What languages is the application?

The application is developed initially in Spanish and English.

- Does the app work for android?

The application of Tullpi has been developed for Android and iOs operating system. However, our game also has a physical kit, in this first batch our kit has been designed for iPad. Our next kit design will be for ANDROID Tablet, and the community from this campaign will help us decide which one will be.

- Which iPad models does it work with?

Currently Tullpi works with the iPad 2, 3, 4, iPad air 1, 2, iPad mini 2, 4.

- Why bottle caps?

In schools where they cannot afford to buy the conventional material used to learn math (because it is quite expensive), ask parents to collect bottle caps, which is an awesome solution, bottle caps are easy to handle and come in different colors!, which is used to identify each color with a different concept, and blue caps are associated with the units, the red ones with tens and green ones to the hundreds.

- What games does Tullpi have?

Tullpi comes with our FIRST game, a collection of 6 educational math games which develop the content that children learn in their first year of school: Counting, Sumas 1 Sumas 2 Subtraction, Number System, Double and Half.

This time of creation what we learned is that absolutely everything must be designed based on what the user wants and needs, so the development of our new games will be based on what you, our first users, tell us you would love to play.

- You can only play with bottle caps?

Our first game, FIRST, is designed to work only with caps, however continue to create new games and they could work with elements that can surprise even us.

- Who bring the tablets to schools?

To play Tullpi you need a tablet, then it is necessary that public schools that have donated Tullpi with tablets for use in class. Therefore, we work together with the Maba Project (www.proyectomaba.org), our strategic partner, they implement the use of tablets as a resource for learning in schools vulnerable / rural areas of Peru and we donate the kits to play Tullpi.

Este escenario está también presente en varios otros países, sobretodo en Latinoamérica.



	Por cada kit comprado, nosotros implementamos otro en un colegio de un área rural o vulnerable.


	Alrededor del mundo, existen diversas iniciativas, tales como Xprize Global Learning Challenge o Curious Learning, que buscan llevar tablets, con contenido educativo, que permitan a los niños de zonas vulnerables y rurales lograr los niveles básicos de literatura y aritmética. Gracias al precio decreciente de las tablets, creemos que es  una oportunidad para crear un impacto real.


	Nos hemos esforzado mucho en hacer que nuestros juegos funcionen de manera correcta incluso en tablets de bajo presupuesto y sin conexión a internet, con la intención de ser capaces de implementar Tullpi junto a programas enfocados en mejorar el aprendizaje de las matemáticas mediante el uso de tecnologías de información.

¿Qué es Maba?

	Maba es una iniciativa educativa sin fines de lucro, que en asociación con Curious Learning (Global Literacy Project), busca mejorar los niveles de aprendizaje de matemáticas y ciencias en los colegios más vulnerables del país a través de la donación de tablets, la implementación de una conexión a internet veloz y el acceso irrestricto a un sin número de contenidos educativos digitales. 



	Ellos empezaron el año pasado con siete colegios, logrando resultados extraordinarios (un incremento de hasta 12% en competencias matemáticas). Estos resultados aceleraron su crecimiento, haciendo que este año se expanda a 14 colegios.

El reto

	Tullpi será implementado en los primeros 7 colegios de Maba, para todos los niños de primer grado de primaria, ¡alrededor de 700 niños! Este es solo nuestro primer reto y para lograrlo ¡Necesitamos de su ayuda!Aquí puedes ver donde se encuentra ubicados los colegios.





La base y el reflector están fabricados en triplay cortado en laser.

Este kit fue especialmente diseñado para la tablet que es utilizada en estas escuelas. Debido a que la cámara de la tablet se encuentra localizada a un lado (en lugar del centro) y su ángulo de apertura es muy angosto, la tablet tiene que ser colocada a una mayor altura e incluimos un tablero que ayuda al niño a colocar las tapas en el lugar correcto y tener una mejor idea de su area de juego.

	Los kits donados van al colegio en cajas de 12 kits (twelve pack), esto es para facilitar el manejo de éstos a los profesores y optimizar espacio.


Por tu generosa colaboración podrás recibir geniales recompensas:


5$ 
		

THANKS! + DIY KIT

		¡Muchísimas gracias!  Obtendrás acceso libre al app para iPad y los planos e instrucciones para que puedas construir tu propio kit. ¡También serás parte de la sección de contribuyentes en nuestra web!
	


15$ 
		

DONATE ONE FOR A CHILD IN PERU

		Darás la oportunidad de aprender matemática jugando con Tullpi a un niño de un colegio público de un área vulnerable de Perú (del proyecto Maba), ¡GRACIAS POR TU AYUDA! 


20$ 
		USD + Envío

EARTHKEEPER'S KIT 50% OFF

		¡AHORRA 50%! Si quieres salvar a la madre Tierra, ¡este es el kit hecho para ti! OBTIENES EL KIT BÁSICO DE TULLPI PARA IPAD Y DONAS UN KIT COMPLETO. Tú coleccionas las tapitas de botellas y nosotros te enviamos el Kit básico: Base + Reflector + Acceso total al app + Stickers.
	


25$ 
		USD + Envío

FULL KIT 50% OFF

		AHORRA 50%! OBTIENES UN KIT COMPLETO DE TULLPI PARA IPAD Y DONAS UNO  a un niño en un colegio público de una zona vulnerable de Perú. Éste incluye todo lo que tu niño/a necesita para empezar a jugar y aprender: Base + Reflector + Acceso total al app + Tapas de botella + Stickers.




45$ 
		

DONATE 3 KITS

		DONA 3 KITS COMPLETOS
		Darás la oportunidad a tres niños de un colegio público de un área vulnerable de Perú (del proyecto Maba) de aprender matemática jugando, POR TU APOYO OBTENDRÁS UNA DE NUESTROS GENIALES POLOS además de un agradecimiento muy especial.
	


70$ 
		USD + Envío

DOUBLE FULL KIT 30% OFF

		AHORRA 30%! OBTENDRÁS 2 KITS COMPLETOS DE TULLPI Y DONARÁS OTROS DOS  a niños de un colegio público de un área vulnerable en Perú.
		¿Mejores amigos? ¿Primos? ¿Hermanos? ¿Sobrinos? ¡Tienes otro kit!
		Cada kit incluye todo lo que tu niño/a necesita para empezar a jugar y aprender: Base + reflector + acceso total al app + tapas de botella + Stickers
	


90$ 
		

DONATE 6 KITS

		DONA 6 KITS COMPLETOS
		Darás la oportunidad a seis niños de un colegio público de un área vulnerable de Perú (del proyecto Maba) de aprender matemática jugando, POR TU APOYO OBTENDRÁS UNA DE NUESTROS GENIALES POLOS además de un agradecimiento muy especial.
	


180$ 
		

DONATE A FULL 12-PACK

		Darás la oportunidad a 12 niños de un colegio público de un área vulnerable de Perú (del proyecto Maba) de aprender matemática jugando, esto significa que una de las cajas de kits en los colegios estará ahí ¡gracias a ti! POR TU APOYO OBTENDRÁS UNA DE NUESTROS GENIALES POLOS además de un agradecimiento muy especial.
	


400$ 
		

SPONSOR A CLASSROOM

		DONA TULLPI PARA UN SALÓN COMPLETO
		¡Auspiciar un salón es algo súper especial! ¡Ni nosotros ni los +30niños que impactarás directamente ayudándolos a descubrir la alegría de aprender matemáticas! ¡Jamás te olvidaremos! ¡En recompensa, como individuo o empresa, serás parte de los kits que entregaremos a estos niños!
	


1000$ 
		USD + Envío

SPONSOR A SCHOOL

		DONA TULLPI PARA UN COLEGIO ENTERO DE HUANCAYO-PERÚ

		¡Estás haciendo un gran esfuerzo para ayudarnos a dar descubrir a los pequeños genios escondidos alrededor del mundo!
		¡Nosotros y los 70 niños de la Escuela Fe y Alegría 66 en Huancayo, que impactarás directamente, siempre te recordarán! ¡Gracias por ayudarlos a descubrir la alegría de aprender matemáticas! En recompensa, como un individuo o empresa, ¡serás parte de los kits entregados a estos niños! ¡Y recibirás un agradecimiento ultra-especial!
	

¿Cómo obtener tu recompensa?
Hay dos modalidades de pago: usando tu tarjeta de débito/crédito o a través de PayPal.
Primero escoge la recompensa que quieres. Y da click sobre ella. 



Esto te llevará a una página en donde tendrás que ingresar tus datos.


¿Cómo pagar con tu tarjeta de débito/crédito?
Llena tu nombre y correo electrónico. Luego, si tu recompensa lo requiere, se te pedirá la dirección a donde será enviada. SI eres de Perú y no sabes tu código postal puedes consultarla en esta web. 
Luego necesitaras los datos de tu tarjeta.


- Nombre en la tarjeta: es el nombre del dueño de la tarjeta. En algunas tarjetas este aparece en la parte frontal de la tarjeta en otras no.
- Número de la tarjeta: es el número de 16 dígitos que aparece en la cara frontal de tu tarjeta.
- Fecha de expiración: es la fecha que aparece en la parte frontal de tu tarjeta en el formato MM/AA.
- Código de seguridad: es el número de 3 dígitos que aparece en la parte trasera de la tarjeta.
- Código postal: es el código postal en el que se realizará la facturación. El código sea el mismo que has introducido en la parte anterior.  Si no conoces tu código postal puedes buscarlo aquí.





Para makers y hackers

	Los planos en CAD de la base y el reflector estarán disponibles para todos, así que podrás hacer tus propios diseños del kit, agregándole tu toque personal. 


	Nuestra tecnología está construida para trabajar en Unity, la herramienta más popular para desarrollo de videojuegos, con disponibilidad para realizar complicaciones en Android y iOS. Si eliges el kit de desarrollador tendrás acceso temprano al SDK para jugar y ¡desarrollar nuevas experiencias y juegos utilizando nuestra tecnología! 




	Somos un equipo apasionado que cree que la educación es la herramienta más poderosa y transformadora. Reunimos experiencia en visión de computadora, pedagogía, interacción humano-computadora y diseño.



               

Adolfo Valdivieso (Tecnología): Yo le enseño a las computadoras a reconocer y rastrear tapas de botellas, desarrollo los videojuegos y ese tipo de cosas.
Evelyn Gómez (Operaciones):  Yo hago que las cosas suceden cueste lo que cueste.
Félix Valdivieso (Pedagogía): Estos chicos necesitan supervisión de un adulto.
Gerardo Hurtado (Arte & Diseño): Yo hago que cada parte de Tullpi le saque una sonrisa a los niños. 





	Una de las cosas que hemos aprendido en el proceso es que si estás construyendo algo para los niños, tienes que probar ¡todo! los niños siempre piensan fuera de la caja. ¿No me creen? Vean estas fotos…






Y es por esto que nunca dejamos de probar y aprender de los niños, para poder capaces de crear la experiencia adecuada para ellos.




	Durante nuestras primeras entrevistas con padres y profesores, descubrimos que las mejores prácticas en matemática tienen un rasgo en común: la transformación de objetos simples (como alimentos, carros de juguete…) o actividades cotidianas (como el almuerzo, la compra de los alimentos…) en espacios ricos de aprendizaje. Esto, combinado con las preguntas adecuadas y paciencia dan los mejores resultados. 




	Creemos que hay una gran oportunidad para crear experiencias de aprendizaje impresionantes y significativas, con sólo poner un poco de magia en este tipo de elementos. Y esta es la ruta que queremos explorar. Hoy en día usamos tapitas de botellas pero mañana será...



	Siempre hay retos, pero nuestra promesa es que creceremos hasta alcanzarlos. Haremos todo lo que esté en nuestras manos para entregar nuestras recompensas a tiempo o antes.


	Nostros estamos comprometidos con mantener informados a todos los nuestros contribuyentes. Nuestra promesa de entrega será desafiada en todo momento por las complejidades conocidas de fabricación, producción, envío, y mucho más.


	Por lo tanto, en caso de que surjan problemas inesperados, haremos nuestro mayor esfuerzo por minimizar el impacto sobre ustedes, quienes nos apoyan, y nos dedicaremos a proveerles la mejor experiencia.


	Si tienes alguna pregunta o duda, no dudes en escribirme a adolfo@tullpi.com






	¡Muchísimas gracias!





Preguntas frecuentes
- ¿Si se me pierde una tapita, cómo la reemplazo?
Tullpi funciona con cualquier tapita de botella de plástico de tamaño regular (30mm), es por eso que puedes reemplazar estas tapitas con alguna otra que encuentres en casa y decidas reciclar. ¡No hay problema!
- ¿Para qué sirve el tablero en el kit donado?
Las tablets que son donadas, a los colegios públicos dentro de Maba, tienen la cámara en una esquina y no en el centro, como el iPad, es por ello que para jugar es necesario delimitar campo de juego y así se les haga más fácil a los niños saber dónde pueden poner la tapita y hacer que el  juego funcione de la forma adecuada.
- ¿En qué idiomas está la aplicación?
La aplicación está desarrollada en español e inglés. 
- ¿Funciona para Android?
La aplicación de Tullpi ha sido desarrollada para sistema operativo Android y iOs. Sin embargo, nuestro juego cuenta además con un kit físico, en esta primera producción éste ha sido diseñado para el iPad. Nuestro próximo diseño será para una Tablet Android, y junto a la comunidad de esta campaña decidiremos para cuál lo haremos.
- ¿Para qué iPads funciona?
Actualmente Tullpi funciona con el iPad 2, 3, 4, iPad air 1, 2, iPad mini 2, 4.
- ¿Por qué tapitas?
En colegios donde no pueden permitirse el comprar el material convencional usado para aprender matemáticas (porque es costoso), les piden a los padres coleccionar tapitas de botella, lo cual es una solución genial, las tapas de botella son fáciles de manipular y vienen en diferentes colores, lo cual se aprovecha para identificar cada color con un concepto distinto, así las tapas azules se asocian a las unidades, las rojas a las decenas y las verdes a las centenas.
- ¿Qué juegos tendrá Tullpi?
Tullpi viene con nuestro primer juego FIRST, una colección de juegos educativos de matemática, éste contiene 6 juegos que desarrollan el contenido que un niño aprende en su primer año de educación escolar: Contar, Sumas 1, Sumas 2, Restas, Sistema numérico, Doble y Mitad.
En este tiempo de desarrollo lo que aprendimos fue que absolutamente todo debe ser diseñado en base a lo que el usuario quiere y requiere, así que el desarrollo de nuestros nuevos juegos será en base a lo que ustedes, nuestros primeros usuarios, nos digan que quieren o necesitan.
- ¿Sólo se puede jugar con tapitas?
Nuestro primer juego, FIRST, está diseñado para que funcione solo con tapitas, sin embargo seguiremos creando nuevos juegos y éstos podrían funcionar con elementos que pueden sorprendernos incluso a nosotros.
- ¿Quién dona las tablets?
Para jugar Tullpi es necesario tener una Tablet, entonces es necesario que los colegios públicos a los que donamos Tullpi cuenten con tablets para usar en clase. Por ello, nosotros trabajamos en conjunto con el Proyecto Maba (www.proyectomaba.org), nuestro aliado estratégico, ellos implementan el uso de tablets como recurso para el aprendizaje en colegios de zonas vulnerables/rurales de Perú y nosotros donamos los kits para jugar Tullpi.




English Version

 


	We created Tullpi because we see children frustrated with the conventional ways of learning math. 


	Tullpi transforms math into a constant experiment, creating an intuitive connection between abstract numbers and objects in the real world. Children use simple bottle caps to solve mathematical challenges with their own hands.


	Tullpi offers you a kit that transforms your iPad into a play/learn station. And for each kit purchased, we implement one in a public school in a vulnerable area.





	From the ages of 4 to 7, children are facing what is most likely the biggest challenge of their cognitive development: the transition from understanding the world through their senses (called concrete thinking) to represent reality through symbols, concepts and models (called abstract thinking). At this stage children require the use of tangible elements to be able to process information and constantly test their ideas.




	That is why the best education programs around the world focus on the use of tangible elements to help children to overcome this challenge. 


	We took it to another level.


	Tullpi creates a bridge between the world the child naturally understands and these new challenging concepts. 





	With Tullpi, your child learns to count, sum, subtract, what are units, tens, hundreds, to find the double and a half, while he/she wins stars and conquers planets. In summary, everything kids have to learn in the first year of school, but making it fun!




	In schools where they could not afford to buy the conventional equipment used for math education (because they are kind of expensive), they asked parents to collect bottle caps. It is a great solution because bottle caps are easy to manipulate, they have different colors.







	The reflector has a small inclined mirror inside, that should be placed on the tablet (as shown below). This way, the frontal camera will capture the area of the table in front of the tablet, detecting the position and color of the bottle caps.





In the image below, you can see what is the role of the reflector and how the bottle cap detection works.










	We are from Peru and our country ranks last in math education, as shown in the graph below. This is why we felt something had to be done. 




	But the sad thing about this result is it is strongly tied to the socioeconomic class, which means that there is a huge gap between the quality of the education a few people can get and the deficient or inexistent education that the rest receive. 


This scenario is present in many other countries, especially in Latin-america.



For each kit purchased, we implement one in a school in a vulnerable or rural area.


	Around the world, there are many initiatives to bring tablet-based educative content such as Xprize Global Learning Challenge or Curious Learning to allow kids in vulnerable and rural areas achieve basic levels of literacy and numeracy. Thanks to the decreasing price of tablets, we believe this is an opportunity  to make a real impact.


	We invested a lot of effort to make our games work well even in low budget tablets with the intention of being able to implement Tullpi in programs for math education improvement. Most of them use these kinds of tablets.

What is Maba?

	Maba Project is a non for profit initiative that has partnered with Curious Learning (Global Literacy Project) with the intention of improving math and science  levels in the most vulnerable schools in Peru.  They implement tablets, a connection to fast internet, give access to countless digital educational content and train teachers. 




	They started last year with seven schools achieving extraordinary results (an increase up to 12% percent in math competences). These results have accelerated their growth, causing them to expand to 14 schools this year.
The challenge

	Tullpi will be implemented in their 7 initial schools, for all the kids in the first year of primary school. That is around 700 kids!   This is just our first challenge. And for this we need your help!



The base and reflector are made out of laser cutted plywood.
This kit was specially designed for the tablet used in this schools. And because the camera is placed on a side of the tablet (instead of being on the middle) and it's opening angle is very narrow, the tablet have to be placed higher and we included a board that helps the kid to place the bottle caps on the right place and have a better sense of their playing field.The donated kits go to the schools in a twelve pack box. This helps reduce the space used inside the classroom and facilitates the delivery process during class. Imagine how hard would be to handle 28 to 32 boxes for each teacher.


For makers and hackers

	The CAD files of the base and reflector will be available, so you can make your own designs and add a personal touch. 


	Our technology is built to work with Unity, the most popular game development engine. If you get a developer kit you will have early access to the SDK to start playing and developing new experiences and games using our technology. 


	We are a team that believes education is the most empowering and transformative tool. We gather experience in computer vision, pedagogy, human computer interaction and design.
                 Adolfo Valdivieso (Technology): I teach computers to recognize and track bottle caps, develop video-games and that kind of stuff.Evelyn Gómez (Operations): I make things happen whatever it takes.Félix Valdivieso (Pedagogy): These guys needed some adult supervision.Gerardo Hurtado (Art & Design): I make sure that every single part of Tullpi brings a smile in the kid's face.



	One of the things we learned in the process is that if you are building something for kids, you have to test everything as kids always think outside the box. Don’t believe me? Check this pictures…









	In our early interviews with parents and teachers, we found that the best practices in math had a common trait: transforming simple objects (such as food, car toys or so) or everyday activities (buying groceries, cleaning the house, etc.) into rich learning spaces. This combined with asking the right questions and patience gave them the best results. 



	We believe there is a great opportunity to create awesome and significant learning experiences, just by putting a little bit of magic into these kinds of elements. And this is the route we want to explore. Today we use bottle caps but tomorrow will be…

	There are always challenges, but our promise is that we'll rise to meet them. We'll do everything in our power to ship our rewards on time or earlier.


	We are committed to keep our backers informed. Our promise to deliver will be challenged at all times by the known complexities of manufacturing, production, shipping, and more.


	Therefore, in the event that unexpected issues arise, we will do our biggest effort to minimize the impact on our backers and dedicate ourselves to providing the best experience.


	If you have any question or doubt, don’t hesitate to write me to adolfo@tullpi.com




	Thank you very much!!!






FAQs- If I lose a bottle cap how can I replace it?
Tullpi works with any plastic bottle cap of regular size (30 mm), which is why you can replace these caps with some other you find at home and decide to recycle. No problem!- What is the board in the kit donated?
The tablets that are donated to public schools (part of Maba), have the camera in a corner and not in the center, like the iPad, which is why is necessary to define the play field and in that way make easier for children to know where they can put the cap and make the game to function properly.-What languages is the application?
The application is developed initially in Spanish and English.- Does the app work for android?
The application of Tullpi has been developed for Android and iOs operating system. However, our game also has a physical kit, in this first batch our kit has been designed for iPad. Our next kit design will be for ANDROID Tablet, and the community from this campaign will help us decide which one will be.- Which iPad models does it work with?
Currently Tullpi works with the iPad 2, 3, 4, iPad air 1, 2, iPad mini 2, 4.- Why bottle caps?
In schools where they cannot afford to buy the conventional material used to learn math (because it is quite expensive), ask parents to collect bottle caps, which is an awesome solution, bottle caps are easy to handle and come in different colors!, which is used to identify each color with a different concept, and blue caps are associated with the units, the red ones with tens and green ones to the hundreds.- What games does Tullpi have?
Tullpi comes with our FIRST game, a collection of 6 educational math games which develop the content that children learn in their first year of school: Counting, Sumas 1 Sumas 2 Subtraction, Number System, Double and Half.

This time of creation what we learned is that absolutely everything must be designed based on what the user wants and needs, so the development of our new games will be based on what you, our first users, tell us you would love to play.- You can only play with bottle caps?
Our first game, FIRST, is designed to work only with caps, however continue to create new games and they could work with elements that can surprise even us.- Who bring the tablets to schools?
To play Tullpi you need a tablet, then it is necessary that public schools that have donated Tullpi with tablets for use in class. Therefore, we work together with the Maba Project (www.proyectomaba.org), our strategic partner, they implement the use of tablets as a resource for learning in schools vulnerable / rural areas of Peru and we donate the kits to play Tullpi.

story:
WHO ARE WE

 

We are two young Romanian women, studying in the UK, at the University of Kent and at the London School of Economics.  We have started a film festival in Bacau, a post-industial town in Romania, which at the time was lacking any alternative cultural activities. Most importantly, there was only one commercial cinema in town.

Therefore, we decided to make a free film festival, with Romanian new wave and classic films. We have focused on open-air screenings, where anyone could join. Simultaneously, we have worked on putting back into the attention of the public cultural spaces that have been forgotten (like museums or theatres) by organising screening in their gardens. Our festival had a great impact, as hundreds of people came to see the films!

Due to our success we started the youth film summer school, where every year dozens of teenagers are applying. We are selecting 12 participants to come to Bacau and benefit from the free course, after which they are challenged to make a short film, which will be publicly screened. 

Everyone who is organising the summer school and the festival is a volunteer and we are doing this because we want to make a change. Even if we have started our careers in the UK, we come back to Romania each summer to organise the festival and the school! 

Ioana Pop is the project manager and the executive director. 

Geo Barcan is the initiator of the project and the artistic director. 

They work as a team along with other volunteers from all over the country and Europe. 

 

 

WHAT WE DO

 

"Film mai aproape" summer school is one of the few youth projects dedicated to filmmaking in Romania. Most of our participants have pursued a career into the arts and have described the experience as life-changing. 

We offer our participants professional training with well known filmmakers, accommodation and meals. The trainers come as volunteers and offer their expertise to the young artists. 

However, since most of the expenses are paid by our NGO, we need help to keep the school as free as possible, in order to offer the chances to any teenager from any social background.

If you would like to see some of the films made at the school please have a look here: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HKlqCmMuLRI
or to our channel
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8323BCigfoWQI5bINanAxQ/videos
 
This year the school will take place from the 13th of August to the 23rd.
 

 

OUR IDEA

 

We are planning on supporting the school from sponsors and donations. 

In the previous years, we have been supported by local council funds. However, this year they decided not to fund out project.

Therefore, we are asking for your help to keep this school happening, as it is an unique educational and cultural project! 

 

 

WHAT WE NEED

 

  • We like to aim high, so the budget we have applied with was around 5000 US dollars. If you would like to have a look at our budget before you make a donation, we will be happy to send it to you! We would like to come as close as possible to this sum! 

 

  • We want to say thank you to our donors and since we cannot give each of you a hug, a shake of hand and an enthusiastic smile, we would like to offer you a couple of personalised gifts! 

 

  • EACH OF YOU WILL RECEIVE A GIFT FROM US, DEPENDING ON THE SUM YOU WILL DONATE. ALL THE ITEMS ARE PERSONALISED WITH THE FESTIVAL BEAUTIFUL LOGO. IT COULD BE A PEN, A POSTER OF THE SUMMER SCHOOL, A T-SHIRT, OR EVEN A NOTEBOOK. 

 

  • We do not what to think that the summer school will not happen this year, so each donation will help a lot!

WHAT WE NEED
 
We like to aim high, so the budget we have applied with was around 5000 US dollars. If you would like to have a look at our budget before you make a donation, we will be happy to send it to you! We would like to come as close as possible to this sum! 
 
We want to say thank you to our donors and since we cannot give each of you a hug, a shake of hand and an enthusiastic smile, we would like to offer you a couple of personalised gifts! 
 
EACH OF YOU WILL RECEIVE A GIFT FROM US, DEPENDING ON THE SUM YOU WILL DONATE. ALL THE ITEMS ARE PERSONALISED WITH THE FESTIVAL BEAUTIFUL LOGO. IT COULD BE A PEN, A POSTER OF THE SUMMER SCHOOL, A T-SHIRT, OR EVEN A NOTEBOOK. 
 
We do not what to think that the summer school will not happen this year, so each donation will help a lot!

story:
Back to School Banks provide School Uniforms and supplies for children in their area. These are children whose parent's benefits have been sanctioned or who simply struggle to make ends meet. Parents are forced to make the choice between putting a roof over their kid's head and food on the table OR buying a school uniform. That's where the Back to School Bank helps out.

Referrals to the service can be made by care professionals, GPs,  schools and local family support organisations. These referrals are completely confidential so no-one ever would be aware the family received assistance. The child is given a brand new uniform or whichever individual elements they require and can fit in and feel exactly the same as any of their peers around them.

Your donation would be used to fund stocks of uniforms and school supplies, this is a completely voluntary organisation and no salaries are paid to anyone within.

story:
You've done it! Thanks to your support, we've hit our $5,000 goal cover the shipping costs for the 2015-2016 school year's Teaching Trunks! With the generous goal-matching from an anonymous donor, we've actually raised over $10,000! Be sure to follow the hashtag #TrunksofHope to see where hope is being spread next. If you would like to continue to support the Teaching Trunks program, you can do so online at The FHM's website. Thank you so much!

 

Donation Double!

Last year, we were able to raise over $7,000 to send Teaching Trunks free of charge to educators nationwide. This year's goal is $10,000 to cover the 2015-2016 school year's shipping costs and reach even more students. Thanks to the generosity of an anonymous donor, your donation today will go farther than ever. As soon as we meet our $5,000 goal, our anonymous donor will match those donations - so every dollar donated toward that $5,000 goal will be worth two dollars!


Who are we?

Located in the heart of sunny St. Petersburg, The Florida Holocaust Museum is one of the largest and one of only three Holocaust Museums in the country accredited by the American Alliance of Museums. Our mission is to teach members of all races and cultures to recognize the inherent worth and dignity of human life in order to prevent future genocides.


What are #TrunksofHope?

To teach about the Holocaust and to combat hate and prejudice, we developed Teaching Trunks to get learning materials into teachers’ hands FREE of charge.

The trunks are designed to be grade appropriate, touching on everything from basic respect and tolerance for younger grades to in-depth studies about the Holocaust for older students. In addition, we have trunks that focus specifically on Human Rights & Genocide as well as trunks that teach lessons of the Holocaust through the arts.


With books, videos, maps, diaries, photos, artwork, guidelines and lesson plans, each trunk is literally jam-packed with all the materials an educator would need to create an engaging learning experience for their students. Last year alone, our trunks traveled to 17 states, reaching approximately 50,000 students!

"Opening the trunk was like opening a surprise gift. It had a plethora of material that gave me the opportunity to give students a thorough background of the Holocaust. I was able to differentiate instructions by interest, readiness, and by product. As a teacher, I also received an exorbitant amount of material to build my knowledge. My students had more than enough books to read, read, read! Artwork spurred higher-order thinking and discussions (Philosophical Chair and Socratic Seminar). We had an awesome learning experience!" 
                                                  –Jenieff Watson, Assistant Principal



We need your help!

In the past, we've sent Teaching Trunks FREE of charge to any educator in the contiguous United States who wants one, but rising shipping costs have made this a much more expensive proposition, so we need to raise $5,000 to help cover the 2015-16 school year's shipping costs. Students really appreciate the trunks once they get to see all the things inside!


Aren't we past all of this?

Sadly, no. Hate is not just out there lurking in history books or foreign lands. It’s here. It’s now. And it needs our ongoing attention. In 2014, the Southern Poverty Law Center counted 784 active hate groups in the U.S. These include racist groups of all kinds, anti-LGBT, anti-Jewish, anti-Muslim, Neo-Nazis and Holocaust denial groups among others. Florida has the 2nd highest number of active hate groups of any state.



Breaking down the donations... and the Perks!

One round-trip Teaching Trunk journey to any school in the country costs an average of $300. Local educators can pick up a trunk from the Museum, but many schools served are well outside driving distance to the Museum.

Not only will your donation make it possible to keep this invaluable service FREE of charge for educators across Florida and the entire United States, your contribution will teach thousands of children to never forget what happened during the Holocaust, and the importance of being an Upstander in their own communities.


Browse our perks on the right-hand column. Sponsor a trunk for an entire school year, sponsor a single round-trip journey, or just give what you can to help ship #TrunksofHope nationwide! 

Interested in becoming a Lifetime Sponsor of a Teaching Trunk? Contact Maria at the Florida Holocaust Museum at (727) 820-0100, Ext. 274.


Please, help us spread the word!

The most important thing you can do to help us achieve our goal is to spread the word! Please share our campaign video on social media with the hashtag #TrunksofHope, or send an email to your network. Tell your friends, family, co-workers, local schools and affiliated organizations to get involved with the spread of tolerance and hope through education.


Educators, want to use our Teaching Trunks?

If you'd like to use one of our Teaching Trunks for Holocaust, Genocide or Character Education, please email us at trunks@thefhm.org


Follow #TrunksofHope!

Follow the Florida Holocaust Museum on Facebook, Twitter (@FLHolocaustMus) and Instagram (@FLHolocaustMuseum). We're asking educators to post photos, comments, thoughts and observations on social media with the hashtag #TrunksofHope, so you can follow the trunks wherever they go. 

Browse the photos in our IndieGoGo gallery section, join the conversation and watch hope spread to schools nationwide all year long!



A COPY OF THE OFFICIAL REGISTRATION AND FINANCIAL INFORMATION MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE DIVISION OF CONSUMER SERVICES BY CALLING TOLL-FREE (800-435-7352) WITHIN THE STATE. REGISTRATION DOES NOT IMPLY ENDORSEMENT APPROVAL, OR RECOMMENDATION BY THE STATE. FLORIDA HOLOCAUST MUSEUM INC. REGISTRATION #: CH6448

story:
Short Summary

Project Re-Direct/Youth and Family Services has been a successful 19 year school and community based agency. It has maintained its commitment, dedication, and resources to improving quality education for urban youth:

  • Project Re-Direct's Founder, Sharon Berry,  has dedicated more than 27 years as an educator and Child Advocate.
  • STEM Education is a critical component for employment in the 21st Century.
  • There will be 1.8 Million Stem related careers available in the next 10 years.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $25,000 to expand our STEM Programming for urban youth in the communities we serve..
  • Project Re-Direct will offer branded rewards in recognition and gratitude for the support we seek.
  • Project Re-Direct will utilize all funds raised to offer our STEM programming and strengthening our organization..

The Impact

  • Urban Youth, with an emphasis on females,  will receive critically needed educational skills necessary for the types of employment becoming available in our high tech economy.
  • Project Re-Direct has a 19 year track record of successfully offering cutting edge services to urban youth.
  • You can make a life transforming difference one child at a time.

Risks & Challenges

  • Gaining the Financial Resources is Our Primary Challenge.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Sharing this campaign with your friends can really make a difference. Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Like us on Facebook, tweet about us, forward our campaign on to all of your friends.

    We'd like to thank everyone who helps us with this program and we look forward to empowering many more kids in the future.

story:
Story

The Sigma Tau Delta Mu Xi chapter is hosted at Mansfield University of Pennsylvania. Sigma Tau Delta is an international honors society for English, and aims to promote literacy while sharing its love for the English language, and English literature. 

This project is to create a memorial space for a beloved professor of the English Department at Mansfield University of Pennsylvania. Dr. Kristin Sanner was a chapter sponsor for Sigma Tau Delta. She advised the group for many years, after having revitalized the chapter after decades of dormancy. She was instrumental in making the English department at the University an environment that encouraged communication and education. Dr. Sanner passed away from cancer in 2013, and this left our community bereft. Dr. Sanner was heavily involved in activities like gardening and hiking, and the environment was incredibly important to her. 
To honor her and reflect who she was, we are working on building an outdoor memorial space. This space would include landscaping, outdoor seating, and would be used by students across campus. One of the potential uses for this space would be as an outdoor classroom, or a place for students to gather and reflect. Currently, however, the space needs major repairs. The project photo is a photo of the space currently.  

What We Need & What You Get

Because our university is a small, public institution, all of the funding for this project must be privately raised. We have already raised $500 as a chapter through fundraising, and we are reaching out to faculty for donations as well. Our overall goal is to raise $2,500, which would cover the cost the materials needed for landscaping.
 In addition to this amount, we would love to have enough to build a memorial bench, and more potential seating in the space. We believe strongly that building this memorial will not only honor our professor, but create a space that will positively impact all students on our campus. 
Creating this space is something that we have worked on for several years, and we are finally close to realizing our goal. We have worked closely with the administration and our university's grounds crew to make a plan, and all that our chapter needs are the funds to make it all happen. 
All of our contributors will recieve a handwritten thank-you note from the Sigma Tau Delta Mu Xi chapter!

The Impact

Your contribution to this project will help to clear the lot of asphalt (pictured above),  and make the space flat and more conducive to outdoor seating. 
An idea we had for the space involves using existing campus resources to make a raised rock wall in the corner of the garden, so the wall can be used for seating, and so we can have a raised bed area for some of our plants.
Additionally, contributions will be used to purchase plants for the space, including flowering trees and other plants and flowers. 
Any funds we raise over our goal will be used to purchase a memorial bench, and to fund other potential ideas we have for the space. 

Risks & Challenges

We have the full support of our administration and grounds crew, so our only challenge is in raising the funds. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate financially to our project, we would very much appreciate if you shared it on social media, and/or sent positive vibes in our direction!

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of 25 young engineering students from TKM College of Engineering, Kollam, Kerala. This is our maiden try at SAE Baja and it is important for us as it is a way that helps us go beyond textbook learning. here we get to apply the engineering knowledge necessary in making an actual product and we get to deal with the various problems faced in the industry during the same. so in a nutshell, by participating in this competition, we get an actual industrial experience. So in a way, this is a form of social service in view of students getting on-hand experience in their favored field.

What We Need & What You Get

The overall budget of the project is USD 8000 which includes various aspects of manufacturing such as steel procurement, purchasing various parts (Suspensions, Steering rack, Engine, Break assembly, Transmission, Body works, Electrical fittings), transportation of vehicle from Kerala to Madhya Pradesh (event location - Indore).

We hope to make at least half of the total budget (USD 4000) through this crowd funding platform. Major contributors would be mentioned specially in our various social media platforms and in Baja related programs.

If by chance, we don't reach our target budget, we would have to turn to our own (already exhausted) pockets for the same.

story:
Hello Beautiful People!!!!

 

As a lot of you know I'm attending Ministry School at Bethel Atlanta(BASSM), and tuition payments are coming up! The tuition plan that I chose was 3 payments of $800. I paid the first of the three in early September but now the next is coming up shortly and I have found that my budget is incapable of paying the next payment of $800. I have found a job recently which was a huge blessing, but it's only making enough to allow me to pay living expenses, i.e. rent, utilities, groceries, laundry, gas, etc.. Everything so far has come out of my own pocket by the grace of God, but now I'm in need of His people. The next payment is due early November, and the 3rd and final payment is due early Febuary. Any little bit helps more than you know! :)

 If I have to go home now I would be able to say with confidence that it has all been worth it. However, the chances of me walking into this opportunity were slim and I believe I was able to be here for a reason and I would love to be able to walk that out in it's fullest possible way.

 My goal in coming here was to become a prospering advocate for God's heart through His works, and every day I feel more in tune with His plans for me.

 I would like to thank Bethel Atlanta for everything they've instilled in me so far, it's an amazing experience and one that I pray won't end soon.

 Thank you so much!

 I love you!

 Prayers are very much appreciated! :)

story:
Hello! Thank you for visiting my indiegogo site to help me fundraise money!!

My name is Pamela and a couple years ago I was matched up to my little sister in the Big Brothers Big Sisters program.  She is a wonderful girl with lots of personality and a huge heart.  She has really come out of her shell since we have been together.  She is really committed to carving out her own path in this world vs. accepting the cards she has been dealt.  She takes public transportation for 3 hours everyday just to get a better high school education than the school in her neighborhood.  

She is an inspiration to me which is why I really want to help her celebrate her 16th birthday with a party and memory she will always remember.  My little sister passed up her quinceanera (15th birthday party) in exchange for a 16th birthday party.  But she recently found out due to financial reasons she would not be able to have that party she was dreaming of.  So please help me surprise her with such a wonderful gift so she knows she has people on her side, rooting her on for her accomplishments and focus!!  

Where the money will go:

The money I am raising will be to rent out a space large enough to hold about 30 of her high school classmates, food, music, beverages, entertainment/music, (chaperones will be volunteers) decorations, gift bags for her guests and a new dress for her party.  

The biggest cost will be a venue so if anyone knows of a place that is a good value or maybe can be donated for the evening I would love suggestions!!

I want to give her everything she passed up for her quinceanera for her Sweet 16.  I want her to have fun with her friends and not think about financial status.  I want her to have an evening she will remember forever because someone cared enough for her to put together a birthday party.  I want her to realize that she matters.

If I am not able to raise the entire goal to throw her a party I will take whatever I was able to raise and either have a gathering for a few of her friends or take her out to dinner depending on how much was raised.  But I know we can do this together!

The Impact

I know this may seem like a costly goal to raise for but when I think to myself how it must feel to have never had a true birthday party with friends, no pizza parties, no bowling parties, no pin the tail on the donkey I feel like she deserves an amazing party for her 16th to make up for that.  Please help me bring a smile to her face so this just isn't another day in her life.  A life where everything seems to come hard and seems unreachable.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially there are other ways you can help me as well:

-Spread the word about my campaign.  If you have friends/family that have children and might be in a position to donate even a little because they know they would want their own children to be celebrated on their birthdays.  There are share tools on the Indigogo site so you can easily forward this on.

-If you know of any on in the even industry that might be interested in donating to my goal.  Everything from a DJ, venue, food to perhaps a store that might donate a party dress.

Thank you so much!!!!!!

Hello! Thank you for visiting my indiegogo site to help me fundraise money!!
My name is Pamela and a couple years ago I was matched up to my little sister in the Big Brothers Big Sisters program.  She is a wonderful girl with lots of personality and a huge heart.  She has really come out of her shell since we have been together.  She is really committed to carving out her own path in this world vs. accepting the cards she has been dealt.  She takes public transportation for 3 hours everyday just to get a better high school education than the school in her neighborhood.  
She is an inspiration to me which is why I really want to help her celebrate her 16th birthday with a party and memory she will always remember.  My little sister passed up her quinceanera (15th birthday party) in exchange for a 16th birthday party.  But she recently found out due to financial reasons she would not be able to have that party she was dreaming of.  So please help me surprise her with such a wonderful gift so she knows she has people on her side, rooting her on for her accomplishments and focus!!  
Where the money will go:
The money I am raising will be to rent out a space large enough to hold about 30 of her high school classmates, food, music, beverages, entertainment/music, (chaperones will be volunteers) decorations, gift bags for her guests and a new dress for her party.  
The biggest cost will be a venue so if anyone knows of a place that is a good value or maybe can be donated for the evening I would love suggestions!!
I want to give her everything she passed up for her quinceanera for her Sweet 16.  I want her to have fun with her friends and not think about financial status.  I want her to have an evening she will remember forever because someone cared enough for her to put together a birthday party.  I want her to realize that she matters.
If I am not able to raise the entire goal to throw her a party I will take whatever I was able to raise and either have a gathering for a few of her friends or take her out to dinner depending on how much was raised.  But I know we can do this together!


The Impact
I know this may seem like a costly goal to raise for but when I think to myself how it must feel to have never had a true birthday party with friends, no pizza parties, no bowling parties, no pin the tail on the donkey I feel like she deserves an amazing party for her 16th to make up for that.  Please help me bring a smile to her face so this just isn't another day in her life.  A life where everything seems to come hard and seems unreachable.  


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are not able to contribute financially there are other ways you can help me as well:
-Spread the word about my campaign.  If you have friends/family that have children and might be in a position to donate even a little because they know they would want their own children to be celebrated on their birthdays.  There are share tools on the Indigogo site so you can easily forward this on.
-If you know of any on in the even industry that might be interested in donating to my goal.  Everything from a DJ, venue, food to perhaps a store that might donate a party dress.
Thank you so much!!!!!!

story:
Short Summary

This research excursion will acquaint youth with many aspects of Kona, specifically the people, culture and landscapes of the Hawaiian island.  The H2O cohort from Leadership would use their Spring Break to travel, research and develop a sociological perspective of culture in Kona. Using STEM research methodologies, students will document their findings in the form of coded research field notes as means to identify and better understand the facets of a restorative community. Students will use their learned content to inform their developmental practices towards community restoration, once back in San Francisco.

What We Need

Thanks to gracious donations, we have achieved 70% of funding. We only need $5,500 to complete our expenses for youth airfare.

The Impact

Your donation will help to:
  • Facilitate students’ intellectual and spiritual growth
  • Contribute to students’ professional development
  • Accelerate students’ personal growth
  • Develop students’ skills for relating to cultural differences
  • Enhance students self-awareness and understanding of their own culture

story:
Hi, I'm Jeremy- a grad student at the University of Iowa studying Urban Planning. 

My goals are to learn as much as possible about community development and housing non-profits and to find ways to bring these ideas back home. 

I am also very interested in public art and will be researching how publicly funded art projects are carried out in India.  

Funds contributed will go to travel costs. Anything over my goal will go to the program tuition. 

I will be posting a regular blog while in India and will be writing a research paper. 

This program concentrates on eco-sensitive, low-cost housing in India. The goals of the program are to learn about:

--Architectural philosophy of using sustainable and local resources to benefit the community and the planet. 

--How local government and non-profit organizations are interrelated.

--How Kerala’s unique system of government and its citizens are working to improve the standard of living.

--Ways that these new innovations can be incorporated into our own urban development system.

 

Read my blog

Jeremy

 

More info about the trip:

http://www.uiowa.edu/~geog/india/

story:
As the winter holidays are drawing closer and closer, it is almost impossible not to think about gifts. In so many ways, Christmas is the most wonderful time of the year, and you can’t help wanting to do something very special. With my husband, who shares my passion for mountaineering with a mission, we decided to climb CHIMBORAZO, the tallest mountain in Ecuador (6,268m/20,564 ft) in order to help improve the health and well being of street children. We are hoping to raise enough funds to cover one year’s medical expenses for the children who were recently rescued from the streets and are now in the temporary institutional custody at the Child ‘N Family Center of Danielle Children’s Fund (DCF) in Ambato, Ecuador. DCF is a non-profit organization actively involved in rescuing and protecting street children in need.

HELP US TO PROVIDE THE MEANS TO COVER THE BASIC MEDCIAL COSTS OF DCF’S ‘ADOPTED’ CHILDREN. GIVE THE GIFT OF WELL-BEING THIS CHRISTMAS TO THOSE WHO NEED IT THE MOST – THE HELPLESS STREET CHILDREN OF ECUADOR. WE FULLY COVER  OUR OWN TRAVEL AND ACCOMMODATION EXPENSES, GEAR AND PROVISIONS. IN THIS WAY, ALL RAISED FUNDS GO DIRECTLY TO THE PROJECT AND WILL BE USED FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE CHILDREN.

 

DCF's Healthcare Expenses at the Child 'N Family Center in Ambato, Ecuador

*In the Temporary Institutional Custody Program, USD 200.00 per month are spent on healthcare: dental visits, general medical care, vaccinations, and personal hygiene. Of the $ 200.00, $ 60.00 per month cover dental care, and the remaining $ 140.00 are used towards general medical services.

*In the Systemic Family Services Program, USD 175.00 per month are spent on supporting families with chronically ill children, and families, who cannot afford to cover their own cost of necessary medical examinations, hospital visits, and medications.

 

The Impact of Your Donation

Currently, in the Temporary Institutional Custody Program at the Child 'N Family Center in Ambato, Ecuador there is a capacity to accommodate 10 children. Our goal is to raise funds to cover the healthcare costs of these children for a full calendar year. To achieve this, we need $2,400. What greater gift could one give to a child than WELL-BEING that would last for a whole year to come. The value of such a gift is indescribable, especially for those little street-roaming children, who cannot count on their parents to provide such resources for them.

- $6 cover the dental care for 1 child for 1 whole month;

- $72 pay for dental care for 1 whole year per child;

- $14 ensure doctor's visits, vaccinations, and medications for 1 child for a month;

- $168 cover the a child's general medical expenses for an entire year.

Whatever amount you choose to contribute, every bit of it will help enormously to keeping the children healthy and well.

Give the gift of WELL-BEING to a child in Ecuador during this Holiday Season by donating to our campaign. All donations will go directly to Danielle Children's Fund for keeping the children healthy at the Child 'N Family Center in Ambato, Ecuador. 

Share this campaign with your friends, family, relatives, and acquaintances. Text it, tweet it, and ask them to join in. Together, we can make a tremendous difference - create real magic for the street children of Ecuador during this Holiday Season, and make it last for an entire year!

Thank you for taking the time to read about our undertaking. 

We trust that you will enjoy playing Santa with us by joining in to distribute a very special gift - the gift of WELL-BEING - to the street children in Ecuador during the Winter Holidays.

CHILD ‘N FAMILY CENTER IN AMBATO, ECUADOR OPERATED BY DANIELLE’S CHILDREN FUND 

Daniëlle Children's Fund (DCF) is a non-profit organization run by volunteers. DCF focuses on guiding children and their families in need. Besides providing a safe environment for children at risk, the Foundation also helps parents to create their own resources and possibilities to build a better future, and to assume their own responsibility for the upbringing of their children. DCF works closely together with the governmental institutions involved in child protection.

DCF established its first Child 'N Family Center in Kathmandu, Nepal in 2001. The second Center came to existence in Ambato, Ecuador in 2009. Two programs are offered at the Ecuador Center – the Temporary Institutional Custody Program, and the Systemic Family Services Program. Both of these programs focus on the children in need, as well as on the family as a whole.

*Temporary Institutional Custody - In this program, the Child ‘N Family Center offers temporary custody to children in at-risk situations (due to, for instance, physical abuse, sexual abuse or severe neglect). Every year around 30 children, boys and girls from 3 to 10 years old, receive a temporarily home at the Center - a safe roof above their head, food, education, love, and care. From the moment they enter the program, the focus is on family reunification. The application of an intensive guidance program is used to facilitate the safe return of the children in temporary custody to their original families. This goal is usually achieved within a six-month time frame. After reunification, the Center enables the child to live safely at home by continuing to provide intensive socio-psychological services in the child’s home environment, follow-up family therapies, and group workshops.

 *Systemic Family Services - In this program, the focus is on family preservation. Through socio-psychological interventions and stimulation of active family engagement, the Child ‘N Family Center manages to keep families securely together without permanently keeping the children in need out of their homes. The Center offers psychological, social, educational, and medical support often in the domestic environment or through family therapy sessions and workshops organized and held at the center. Each calendar year, the Center improves the quality of lives of about 100 dysfunctional families by helping them to transform their domestic situation into a safer and more secure environment for their children to live in.

story:
Help Dancer, Julie Drucker Raise $5,400 in 45 Days!

My name is Julie Drucker and I am a dancer and choreographer.  I'm raising money for a Motion Theater training in San Francisco, CA.  

I have produced inter-generational dance performance projects with communities of women and teens in the Bay Area and Northern California. Currently, I'm choreographing a work that addresses our relationship to technology called “The Body Feels What the Body Feels,” which involves college students, artists and teachers. I live in Ukiah, California, a rural area of 14,000 people, and there is limited access to the arts, especially dance. I have also taught dance in the public schools for many years. In 2009 I received grant funding from the Mendocino Arts Council for GASP, Get Arts in the Schools program, to teach at Anderson Valley High School in Boonville, CA.

 

Motion Theater Training

I am currently enrolled in a six-month “Motion Theater” immersion program in San Francisco with the Motion Institute, led by the creator of this work, Nina Wise. “Motion Theater”uses spoken language combined with a physical embodiment of an experience through movement in a witness format. This performance art also has the potential to change people's relationship to the stories they're telling, which lends a spiritual and healing quality to the work. By paying attention to the details of one's experience and verbalizing them in an improvisational way, combined with embodying those details moment by moment, an individual can learn to relate differently to his/her past.

 

Community Impact

I am looking for funding for this program for two reasons: to inform my own dance projects and to share this form with young and old alike in my community. I believe this work could inspire and move many people, since it gives them a way to transform their lives through the expression of stories and feelings.

I feel I have a large capacity to make people feel at ease, which allows greater trust to develop. I see it in my dance projects and in my teaching to both teens and adults. My dance performance project “Risk of Falling” featured 7 women between the ages of 25 and 85, all telling their stories of taking a personal risk. I also saw my students at Anderson Valley High, many of whom were English language learners, take greater risks due to the trust that I helped facilitate. In studying Motion Theater, it gives me yet another form in which to make people feel free. There is almost nothing that rivals how happy and content one can be after using sound, narrative and movement. The amount of joy I experience doing this form is unparalleled. A million heartfelt thanks for your generous help. Your financial support isn't just for one artist, but for the well being of many others.

Because I live in a very economically challenged area I intend to offer classes for a nominal fee and to teenagers at no cost.

  

What I'm Requesting

1) $3500 Motion Theater Training fee

2) $200 transportation to workshops

3) Once the training has ended, I'll use the remaining $1700 for studio rental, insurance, and advertising.

  

What You Receive

For a contribution of $25 you will receive a 1 ounce bag of personally harvested Mendocino Coast Yemaya Seaweed.

For a contribution of $50 you will receive one free class in Motion Theater.

For a contribution of $100 or more you will receive 2 free passes to my next performance.

For a contribution of $500 or more you will receive credit as a supporter of my next performance and 2 free passes.

For a contribution of $1,000 or more you will receive credit as a producer.

 

For More Information

www.motioninstitute.com 

juliedruckerdance@yahoo.com
