story:
What's this all about?

Since 2004 I've been working with young children and with adults who are inspired by teachers, children and families from Reggio Emilia Italy. I support a staff of 28 teachers who are doing this work one on one, in teams and as a whole staff. Now, I'd like to go there to learn first hand about the history and about what's happening today. From my mentors and studies of the Reggio Emilia approach I've learned:

  • that young children are protagonists in their own lives and deserve as much freedom and responsibility as possible.
  • that knowledge is constructed in community, within relationships among people and between people and their place, their things, their ideas
  • to hold a deep respect for the families of the children in my care, to be ready to be changed by my experiences and conversations with them
  • that teachers can be co-collaborators, co-learners, co-conspirators with children instead of experts imparting knowledge

I love bringing these concepts to other teachers each day, and I look forward to deepening my own understanding of these ideas and their history in Reggio Emilia.

Why Italy?

In my current work, I don't have many real peers; non-supervisory support staff who are entirely invested in the quality of the community, our relationships and our collective knowledge. In Reggio Emilia, I'll meet many other people who do this work, and I can't even imagine yet what I'll learn!

Relying on My Community

When I first started planning this trip it was no trouble for me to pay for it out of pocket. Now that I've started, my husband has joined the ranks of the underemployed, and I can't justify the cost of this trip anymore. After much soul searching, I've decided to ask you for help getting to Italy.

I'm looking for $2300. That's 1/2 of the cost of my airfare, conference fees (I'll be there with 300 teachers from all over the world) and hotel costs + the 4% that Indiegogo charges for running this site.

I'm offering you some writing, some pictures, even some souveniers of my trip.

 

The Impact

When I traveled to New Zealand in 2010, I was inspired by the teachers and children I met there. Today, the teachers Peabody Terrace Children's Center:

  • write learning stories (a relationship-based form of narrative assessment),
  • feel safer letting children assess their own risk on the playground and in big body games with one another,
  • created new policies through consensus building
  • are designing a natural playground,
  • embrace conflict with one another and among children
  • bring their whole selves, their passions, their interests and their histories to their teaching.

This is the work of these teachers themselves, of course, but much of this was informed by the stories, images and relationships I brought back with me from my time in Auckland with a brilliant collection of educators.  I'm so excited to think about what I might bring back to my community from Italy this  year.

I love working in a field, and in a specific culture that encourages trust, deep relationships and risk-taking. Now, I'm doing what I've encourage countless children and a few dozen teachers to do: ask for help.

Please be sure to share this campaign with friends who may contribute.

Thank you for your attention.

story:
Short Summary

The art of acting is my life. My name is Evan Langle and I have been an aspiring actor since I was born, no joke, I came out the womb holding a skull while reciting Hamlet! Ok, I'm slightly exaggerating, but I was writing and directing plays with my cousins as young as eight years old.  As I graduated High School, I stormed the stages of Pasadena City College in 5 main stage shows and 3 one act plays. Whilst doing that, I moved to Japan for a quick time, joined the Pacific Okinawa Players and performed patriotically for our american soldiers and their families.  

Clinging to the edge of my seat, I recently sent in an application for the 8 week summer intensive program 'Shakespere & His Contemporaries' at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Arts (LAMDA) and was offered a spot! Attending LAMDA has been a huge dream of mine since I was in high school. It is one of the leading drama schools in the UK and has produced such legends as Jim Broadbent, Brian Cox, and Donald Sutherland to name a few.

Now having achieved the first big step, the next obstacle I face is MONEY. I'll share with you what my acting professor and mentor told me in a recent email upon hearing the news of my acceptance...

"You are a very gifted young  man, Evan Langle, and deserve and have earned this very good fortune. It ain’t cheap. But you will be affected by this experience the rest of your life. Again, congrats."

Your contribution in helping me achieve this TREMENDOUS-STUPENDOUS opportunity will open many doors and add immensley to my inner growth as an artist. Not only will I be learning a great deal but I will also be gaining life experience by studying acting outside of LA in a different culture that is less 'fame' induced and more about the basic love of the craft. 

   

What I Need & What You Get

Tuition for the LAMDA 8 week summer course is $6,052 due by April 1

The housing provided by LAMDA is $2,700 due by March 15th (I am currently looking for alternate housing that might be cheaper, however if I cannot find any by the deadline I will be going with the school's option)

Altogether tuition & housing comes to $8752. Anything over that will be going towards airfare, food, transportation & student visa.

I will be applying for a loan as the due dates for the fees are coming up extremely fast. All the money raised by this campaign will be put towards paying back the loan.

There are some perks for your donations, aside form the inner satisfaction of helping one achieve their dreams ;) Various gifts ranging from simple hugs to me putting on a live show purely for your entertainment =)

 

 The Impact

 The first time I stepped out on the stage in 2009, as the drunken hopeless romantic Dr. Gerald Lyman in 'Bus Stop', I was overwhelmed by this wonderful feeling almost like electricity. There is nothing greater for an actor than the power you have to move an audience, whether it be to laughter or to tears. Theater is so trascending. To create real life moments on a stage or in front of a camera, there is nothing else like it in the world. It is one of the oldest and greatest forms of artistic expression. When I finished that first performance and had taken my bow, my body zinging with adrenaline, my father came up to me and in his usual jokester like way, smiled and said "You were funnier than shit!!" I hugged him for a good minute and when I stepped back and looked at him, he had gone teary-eyed and said "I'm proud of you." I knew right then that I was on the right track and this is what I wanted to do for the rest of my life.

Taking this summer course at LAMDA may not lead to an Academy Award or guarantee myself an agent. What this will do is provide me a once in a lifetime experience that will further my knowledge and help me grow as an artist so that I may continue to tell stories and move people.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people cannot contribute financially. Hello, starving student here! There are other ways to help make this happen!

SPREAD THE WORD! Sing it from the mountain tops! Go out and share this to the four corners of the world!

But seriously, you can share this page on you facebook, twitter, myspace or whatever social network you use.

Thank ever so much for you help and support. It is greatly appreciated .
story_txt:
Short Summary
The art of acting is my life. My name is Evan Langle and I have been an aspiring actor since I was born, no joke, I came out the womb holding a skull while reciting Hamlet! Ok, I'm slightly exaggerating, but I was writing and directing plays with my cousins as young as eight years old.  As I graduated High School, I stormed the stages of Pasadena City College in 5 main stage shows and 3 one act plays. Whilst doing that, I moved to Japan for a quick time, joined the Pacific Okinawa Players and performed patriotically for our american soldiers and their families.

story:
Hi! My name is Bethany and I'm currently studying a level 4 diploma in Art and Design at my local college but this autumn I have been accepted to study Conservation and Restoration at university. I am keen to gain as much experience as possible in this area so that I can make an effective contribution in the future.

Adventures in Preservation offer a three week hands on study camp at the underground churches of Puglia that are in danger of disappearing from Italy's heritage. Due to Italy's (and much of Europe) financial situation at the moment, it cannot afford the extent of conservation work needed and so volunteers are indispenable in this area. Italy's wealth of history and heritage is not only of importance to Italy itself but much is of international consequence.

Fees for this project are about £2000 not including travel to Italy. Your donations would go towards my accommodation and food, lectures and educational excursion as well as materials and other transport. If I were not to reach this goal, (I am largely expecting to pay for this from working alongside my college course) it would go towards my fees, materials and living costs for university next year.

For centuries, the citizens of Matera were buried in the network of underground chambers, ossuaries, and catacombs beneath San Pietro Barisano. For a long period of time, the church was the city’s only cemetery and as such holds a wealth of archaeological and epigraphic information about the history and culture of Matera. San Pietro also boasts a fine array 17th century frescoes, including depictions of the Annunication, Madonna and Child, and a spectrum of assorted saints. Collectively, the rupestrian churches of Puglia possess wall paintings that span a thousand years and create a visual document of religious and artistic evolution. At the oldest churches, the style of the wall paintings reflects Byzantine influences. Finally, the churches are spectacles in themselves, their hulking frames emerging from and blending into their mountainous backdrop. The Sassi and the Park of the Rupestrian Churches of Matera was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1993.

I am lucky enough to live in one of the most beautiful and culturally rich places in England, the Peak District. Whilst at school I have volunteered at a local museum; updating archive systems, giving tours and administrative work. In more hands on practical experience, since last autumn I have been learning the traditional craft of book binding which is hugely rewarding. I would love the opportunity to apply the skills learnt here and in my art & design diploma to the conservation of even such a small, but still important part of our world heritage.

Of course, if you cannot contribute financially simply sharing my venture or the work of any these organisations would be immensely appreciated. Thank you.

http://adventuresinpreservation.org/

http://www.messors.com/

www.whc.unesco.org

story:
Link to article about the campaign ; http://aarhusculture.com/2013/04/20/mali-support-the-future/  

Short Summary

My name is Linda Sanogo and I am 23 years old. I grew up in Niger with a Danish mother and Malian father. I came to Denmark for over 10 years ago and I am now studying French literature at the University of Aarhus with the purpose of take my masters in African studies. In my spare time I paint and watch movies. In addition I write for www.aarhusculture.com and works as a fashion and advertising model where I have 3 agencies in Denmark, Germany and Lithuania.

In 2010 I was elected Miss Mali, and have traveled around the world and represented Mali as ambassador at four major beauty pageants. I did it with intend of raising awareness of this beautiful sub Saharan nation. Mali is known for its handicrafts and especially its music. My collection will be donated to a specific project for the country's schoolchildren via www.globalpartnership.org. I believe that the only way Africa will come out of its poverty is, not by sending food and clothes, but through education and innovation.

In depth rapport on education in the world’s poorest countries; http://siteresources.worldbank.org

What We Need & What You Get

My goal with this collection is to sponsor a scholarship program for Mali's children thru www.globalpartnership.org. Public education in Mali is, in principle, provided free of charge and is compulsory for nine years between the ages of 7 and 16.  The system encompasses six years of primary education beginning at age seven, followed by six years of secondary education, generally divided into two three-year cycles. However, Mali’s actual primary school enrollment rate is low, in large part because families are unable to cover the cost of uniforms, books, supplies, and other fees required to attend even public school. Since it is very expensive to send a child to school for an ordinary Malian family, many choose not to send their children to school and instead send them of to find work. It is especially girls who are vulnerable. A certain percentage will get years of schooling before they find themselves forced to leave school because the cost is too high for the family. It is a vicious circle and therefore the money will be donated for scholarships and tools for girls and boys in Mali, so they have a better chance of creating a secure future for themselves and their families. 

For 174,16 USD (134,15 EUR)  one child can go to school for a year with all exspences. 

*All funds will go to Global Partnership even if i don't reach my goal

The current situation in Mali

The Islamists in northern regions of Mali are terrorizing both Muslims and Christians. Children are forced into war. Midst of the tense situation, a young woman tries to improving conditions for children who are the main victims of this conflict.

Islamic extremists in Mali control the northern part of the country that is the size of France. As part of the extremist ideology, Islamists has banned music, alcohol, smoking and sports on TV. Whipping, public amputations and stoning have become common. In July, there was a couple stoned for having sex outside marriage.

Salvatore SAGÜES Amnesty International says the Voice of America News that the militants recruit children and forcing them into battle. "We have already learned that some child soldiers were sent to the front. Some of them have been injured and killed (...) It is prohibited under international law. If soldiers are under 15, it is a war crime." Amnesty International has expressed their deeply concern regarding the strict interpretation of Islam imposed on civilians.

The United States, France, England and Denmark sent "help" under the disguise that they will stop these extreme Muslims. We Malians is however well aware that, were it not for the gas pipeline, that the United states are building from Ivory Coast to Algeria through Niger and Mali, they would most likely never had entered the country to begin with. And in addition, Mali and Niger has some of the world's largest uranium reserves, which does not make these nations "charity actions" more credible. Francois Hollande (president of France) has even been awarded UNESCO’s peace medal for his contribution in Mali.

I am as Malian appalled that the media does not at any time bring up these issues.

Special vulnerable areas count  Mopti, Koutiala, Gao, Ségou and Timbuktu.

Mali in numbers;

  • Population: 14,533,511
  • Child Death Rate: 178 per 1,000
  • Infant Death Rate: 109 per 1,000
  • Life Expectancy: 51 Years
  • Poverty Rate: 44%
  • Underweight Children: 27%
  • Human Development Rank: 175
  • Maternal Death Risk: 1 in 22
  • Girls' Education: 6 Average Years in School
  • Clean Water Access: 64%

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with your frinds and family on facebook, twitter and so forth

story:
For the past five years, we've been grinding the freshest flour around, helping people reconnect with their food and their miller. This year, we're doing something different.

While our product hasn't changed, our goal has. Since January, we've been directing 100% of the proceeds of all our sales towards traveling to South Sudan to build a bicycle grinder - just like the one we've been busy turning for the last half decade.

That's right...we're bringing bike-mill technology from the Roberts Creek rainforest to the northern edge of the youngest country on the planet!

On December 9th, my brother Josh and I will fly to Kampala, Uganda, and make our way 1500 kilometres overland to the village of Panlang in Northern Bahr el Ghazal state, South Sudan. There we will attempt to construct a bike-mill for the community in partnership with the Pan-Aweil Development Agency, which has agreed to organize/coordinate our project on the ground.

Follow along with us as we fundraise for this incredible journey! 

This journey will take us to one of the most remote and inaccessible corners of South Sudan, a country emerging from decades of civil war and chronic underdevelopment. 'Roads' on maps are little more than sand tracks for hundreds of kilometres, transport is unreliable and basic supplies are hard to locate. It's certainly going to be a challenge to get to Panlang, not to mention actually building the bike-mill on site using local materials and local labour!

All this is going to take $$$ - so we're looking for contributions towards on-the-ground expenses that will make this project a success in South Sudan. This money will not be used for flight tickets; we've secured flights already.

In order to make sure that we committ 100% of our efforts towards this goal, we are utilizing a combination of business as (un)usual (donating 100% of our profits in 2013 to this objective) personalized contributions and this crowd funding campaign. Based on years of past experience, we are confident that these multiple funding sources will allow us to reach our goal by November, 2013. 

Every dollar you donate will be directed towards constructing a bike-mill in Panlang, including paying for found materials and local labour.

Spread the word! Buy some Flour Peddler Flour through a variety of touch points in Vancouver or just make a small donation! Every penny helps increase a communities technological and agricultural processing capacity with the goals of food sovereignty in mind!

contact us for more info: peddleflour@gmail.com or visit www.theflourpeddler.com

story:
The Dream

     My Name is Jason Cope. Since I was a child, my dream has been to be a Knight, wading into battle weilding sword and shield and donning shining armour. After extensive research and networking, I have found my gateway to that dream, The Battle of the Nations. BotN is a full contact, international, medieval fighting tournament held every year in Europe. in 2012, the United States team went and competed for the first time, and caught the eye of the Europeans. With your contribution, I will be able to travel with these modern day Knights to France and help bring back glory to the United States!

What I Need & What You Get

If I can raise my goal of $1500 by january 25th, 2013, that will pay for my travel and expenses to the tournament. Alongside my own money, your contributions will help provide me with armour, weapons, and the clothing needed to compete in Historic Medieval Battles. You will be responsible for bringing my dream to life, and for that I will be forever greatful.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not donate funds to my campaign, there are still ways you can help me! You can help by linking this campaign onto your social media sites and hopefully others will donate to my cause! I understand that everyone is in fininacial hardships, especially with the holiday season approaching. Anything you can do to help is greatly appreciated!

story:
Derick's Dream is to Build a School

Wanonda Derick is a passionate and capable young man, with a dream to improve his community and create opportunities for the young orphans in his care. You can help him do this.  With the $3500US we are raising here, he will be able to fulfil his dream and build his school—five classrooms, for these young children at the Kepac Children’s Home and surrounding community in the Kazo Central Zone in Uganda.

Derick is an orphan who is running an orphanage, and he’s my friend. When I spoke to another man who also works for the children in that area, thinking he might be overseeing Derick, he said, this is Derick’s project. He’s in charge. 

In his own words, he isn’t doing this for himself, he’s doing it for his community, and I’m doing this for him.  But we need your help. Thank you for joining his community!

The Kepac Children’s Home is a registered charity in Uganda.

Stay in touch on Facebook!

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kepac-Childrens-Home-And-Volunteering-programme/190492517695082?fref=ts

 

What He Needs

Derick needs money for building materials and labor.

$720US will buy the bricks, sand and cement he needs to build the classrooms. 

$370US will buy the timber for the roofs of five classrooms.

$950US will buy the iron sheets for five classrooms.

$130US will buy the nails needed for the project.

$1200US will pay for the labor for 17 days of building.

 

The total cost of the project is about $3500US

 

Any additional money collected will be used for classroom supplies.

 

The Impact

These new classrooms will provide a learning experience for children from the orphanage and from local families that cannot afford school fees.  This will be an opportunity to expand their horizons and prepare them for a meaningful adult life.  There are about 150 children who need a place to experience hands on learning and open their minds to new possibilities for themselves.

 

How You Can Help

Click and contribute, then share! Thank you for spreading the word. Every bit helps this young man realize his dream and provide opportunities for other young people.

We thank you!  Derick thanks you.  Aimee thanks you. The children thank you!!

For each contribution of $25-49, we will send you a handmade bracelet (similar to the ones in these pictures) as our thank you to you.  

For each contribution of $50-99, we will send you a handmade bracelet and necklace (similar to the ones in these pictures) as our thank you to you.

For each contribution of $100 or more, we will send you a handmade necklace and a small handwoven bag (similar to the ones in these pictures) as our thank you to you. 

                           

These necklaces, bracelets and bags will be made by local women who are donating them as their contribution to the project.
story_txt:
Derick's Dream is to Build a School
Wanonda Derick is a passionate and capable young man, with a dream to improve his community and create opportunities for the young orphans in his care. You can help him do this.  With the $3500US we are raising here, he will be able to fulfil his dream and build his school—five classrooms, for these young children at the Kepac Children’s Home and surrounding community in the Kazo Central Zone in Uganda.
Derick is an orphan who is running an orphanage, and he’s my friend. When I spoke to another man who also works for the children in that area, thinking he might be overseeing Derick, he said, this is Derick’s project. He’s in charge. 
In his own words, he isn’t doing this for himself, he’s doing it for his community, and I’m doing this for him.  But we need your help. Thank you for joining his community!
The Kepac Children’s Home is a registered charity in Uganda.
Stay in touch on Facebook!
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kepac-Childrens-Home-And-Volunteering-programme/190492517695082?fref=ts
 
What He Needs 
Derick needs money for building materials and labor.
$720US will buy the bricks, sand and cement he needs to build the classrooms. 
$370US will buy the timber for the roofs of five classrooms.
$950US will buy the iron sheets for five classrooms.
$130US will buy the nails needed for the project.
$1200US will pay for the labor for 17 days of building.
 
The total cost of the project is about $3500US
 
Any additional money collected will be used for classroom supplies.
 
The Impact
These new classrooms will provide a learning experience for children from the orphanage and from local families that cannot afford school fees.  This will be an opportunity to expand their horizons and prepare them for a meaningful adult life.  There are about 150 children who need a place to experience hands on learning and open their minds to new possibilities for themselves.
 
How You Can Help
Click and contribute, then share! Thank you for spreading the word. Every bit helps this young man realize his dream and provide opportunities for other young people.
We thank you!  Derick thanks you.  Aimee thanks you. The children thank you!!
For each contribution of $25-49, we will send you a handmade bracelet (similar to the ones in these pictures) as our thank you to you.  
For each contribution of $50-99, we will send you a handmade bracelet and necklace (similar to the ones in these pictures) as our thank you to you.
For each contribution of $100 or more, we will send you a handmade necklace and a small handwoven bag (similar to the ones in these pictures) as our thank you to you. 
                            
These necklaces, bracelets and bags will be made by local women who are donating them as their contribution to the project.

story:
Hello beautiful people!! I am Jasmine Hardnett. I am a 19 year old  junior at Tennessee State University. I wish to travel to Capetown, South Africa this Summer to study Women's Studies in which I will be able to interact with the women of the villages and witness how they live dg ay to day. I will also be able to meet and interact with women and children who have HIV and AIDS. The total cost of the trip is $4,700 and I am receiving a grant for $2500. I am setting up this campaign in hopes that I can raise enough money to fund the remaining balance of $2200 by the end of February.

I've always had a fascination with the African culture and history and I've been wanting to visit a country there for quite some time but have not been able to afford it. By contributing to this campaign, you will be investing in my future success. I am really looking forward to meeting people who aren't as fortunate as I am and that are used to working hard for everything, versus having things handed to them and done for them. This will be a very humbling and life-changing experience that I may never have the opportunity to experience ever again in life.

story:
My name is Gregory Reese and I am from Cleveland Ohio in the USA. I started practicing meditation in 2003 and during my 3rd sitting I saw an incredible Blue light shimmering directly in front of my eyes. This magnificent event led me down a path of awakening where I eventually became consciously aware of child abuse I suffered beginning at the age of five. Thanks to my learning and practicing Yoga, I was able to surrender and let go of painful wounds that I had suppressed for decades, wounds that had caused me to live a hurtful and destructive life. Thanks to the practice of Yoga I have discovered the joy of Self Love, and thanks to this I have learned to truly live a life filled with Love and Happiness.

I am here to raise the funds I will need to become a certified Yoga Instructor in the Integral Yoga Institute tradition. Sri Swami Satchidananda created this tradition, it is the tradition that gave me the tools to liberate myself from my own suffering. I have since learned that my purpose in this life is to teach others how they too can heal, grow, and transform their lives with the practice of Yoga. This is the beginning of my own transformation into the vocation of my heart's desire, my soul's purpose.

All those who contribute to this campaign will not only assist myself in the realization of my life's work, but will also assist in the healing of humanity by helping to provide the world with one more passionate Yoga instructor who wants to make a difference. They will be assisting the Veterans in my community suffering from PTSD that I volunteer to teach. They will be assisting their own positive karma as well, simply by giving to an auspicious cause.

What I Need 

Teacher Training begins on April 15th 2013 at the Satchidananda Ashram in Virginia. The cost of my tuition and living expenses will be $3600. With your help, I will graduate on May 15th as a certified Yoga Instructor, ready willing and able to begin teaching others the Eight Limbs of Yoga.

The Impact

Now understanding the value of self love, a life of joy, and a peaceful mind, I am eager to teach this to anyone who would like to learn. This can only make the world a better place, one person at a time. Also; having healed myself from PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder), which I suffered as a victim of child abuse, and having served my country as a Marine Corps Rifleman during Desert Storm, I have been volunteering my time at the Veterans Hospital in my community with the hope of helping returning Veterans heal themselves from their own PTSD. Your contributions will help firmly establish this volunteer service, and thereby assist in the healing of a community

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, but you are moved to action in some way, please get the word out. Share this with your friends, family, and co-workers. Use the Indiegogo share tools which are designed to help you with this.

Thank You

Namaste

story:
Short Summary

  • Hey! My name is Joe, I'm the Executive Producer and Creator of OffSet Web Series.
  • A Community Based Web Series here to support and promote local filmmakers.
  • Now a Non-Profit 501c3 State Charity under Fiscal Sponsorship with The New Mexico Film Foundation.
  • Helping people to see more out of life, step up and GO FOR IT!!!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our Goal of $5000 will be going to Season 3 budget expenses, including(Film rentals, Equipment, Feed the Cast and Crew during production, Promotional Material, Props, Set Decoration, And the like)
  • The Perks are on Point! Loaded with Recognition and OffSet Swag. Also Insider Networking and Career Advancement Opportunities.   
  • Thankfully, OffSet is not a high budget project to produce. Any remaining donations will be Reinvested and used to ensure a following season.

The Impact

  • The Purpose of Life is to experience Growth! OffSet gives the opportunity to the Seeds of the Local Film Community! With an environment soiled to nurture Growth in the Industry.      
  • The Momentum is Real! Now engaging into our 3rd Year. The Attraction is Exciting! 
  • Keeping it Home Grown with the thrust of Enlightenment towards Evolution is principle to this project's Core Values.

Risks & Challenges

  • Of course we anticipate bumps along the road, But the Longevity of this project based on specific plans and the growing number of people make us Extremely Confident on it's Completion.   
  • Resourcefulness is always key, But remaining in an "Efficient towards Completion" mindset is the most important quality each team member should have to ensure Victory.              

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Other than making a Donation, we encourage you to PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD to friends, co workers, family, and all over about our show and what we are doing for the community!  
  • PLEASE use Social Media, Our Website, as well as the Indiegogo share tools!
  • THANK YOU ALL!!!!

story:
Can we change their world? 
Together, YES, we can! 

  1. FACT- About 70% of blind adults are unemployed.

  2. FACT- Of that 30% who are employed, 90% are Braille Literate!

  3. FACT- Under 10% of all blind adults and children are learning or know braille.

. '

 

EDUCATION AND POVERTY RATES of the BLIND

  • Only 32% graduate high school

  • 16% graduate college

  • 28% Live below the poverty level.

Braille Literacy Can Make All the Difference! 


"IF ONLY THEY HAD THE RIGHT TOOLS."

Introducing the BrailleDoodle! 


The BrailleDoodle has an array of hundreds of holes, place tightly together, that cover the surface.

Each hole contains a tiny element that can be pulled to the surface by a magnetic stylus and locked into place to create a touchable effect. The user erases the creation by pushing the elements back down with a satisfying “pop!”

__________________________________

 

In every row, a word can be spelled out and felt by the user. The user can spell out short words or small sentences like. "Now braille is fun!"

__________________________________________

“As a TVI for over 33 years, I am very excited at the prospect of being able to work with the BrailleDoodle. Teaching Braille and Nemeth remotely over the past several months has proven to be very difficult. The device’s durability and affordability mean that it can be purchased not only for in-school use but also for many of my students who continue to be remote learners. I look forward to using it!” - Jacqueline Becker, TVI – Braille Specialist.

__________________________________________

 

ART 

 


 

A device for creating and erasing art has always made for a fun and educational toy. Now, an art toy is expressly designed for those who are blind, deaf-blind, or low vision.

 

________________________________________________

What's the money for?

Our team at TouchPad Pro Assistive Technology (TPPAT) is in the early stages of seed funding, and we want to assure you that every dollar will go toward the development and release of the BrailleDoodle.

Benchmarks for success:

*Not only do we want to make our products affordable, but a percentage of all sales will also go toward giving products to those who cannot afford them.

____________________________________________

 

Our Story 

I am Daniel Lubiner and for more than ten years I have worked at a school for the blind and low-vision in the Bronx. I teach art to students ages 5 to 21, and it is those student who have inspired all the products at TPPAT LLC. The products I have designed will bring tactile art, braille, technology, and opportunity to the blind and low-vision. Please visit our website for much more information: http://TPPAT.com 

Our Team

I know I can't do this alone. I have met some wonderful people, both folks who are blind and sighted along this journey, Now we are a team!

   .. ,   

__________________________________________

COVID-19

Thousands of blind children (and newly blind adults) are stuck at home due to COVID-19. Instructing these students over computers or tablets, especially in braille, has proven difficult, if not impossible. Most students have no tool to manipulate at home. Braille teaching devices available today are expensive or impractical for this purpose. 

______________________________

Risks & Challenges

One of the risks and challenges is that whenever you make a new technology could have setbacks and unexpected costs. Our focus on affordability is paramount to the development of this product. That will make the development of a design, that much more difficult. 

_____________________________________________

There Are Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to help us with a monetary contribution now or in the future, we are so grateful! Here are some ways to help us (a few that  don't require any money) to make a huge impact on this campaign:

  • Use the share buttons to send this to your social media/email/text connections and encourage everyone to join this mission!
  • Challenge your friends to get involved at any level to support literacy and art for the blind!
  • How many friends can you motivate to donate just $1? Can you get your entire class/school/team to join the mission?
  • Create a "Coin Club": Challenge your co-workers, social media friends, and family to donate at the coin levels ($30-35) and everyone will earn a Braille Coin!
  • Let someone else know who may be interested in our company.

THANK YOU!

_____________________________________

Fabulous Perks

_____________________________________

The Future of TPPAT

The future for our company is very exciting. Inventions like the Braille cloud and the TouchPad Pro will be game-changers! Please, visit our website for more information. But here is a demo video for the TouchPad Pro Invention that normally "blows people away!" (best in full-screen)

Let someone else know who may be interested in our company.
THANK YOU!

_____________________________________
Fabulous Perks

_____________________________________
The Future of TPPAT

campaign_city: New York City area, United States

story:
Current conditions

People are getting excited about the Tokyo Olympics in 2020. Preparations are being made for the Tokyo Olympics, but companies are looking to hire more English speakers as part of these preparations.　

We want to help bridge that gap.　We are an English language school in the Philippines, founded in 2014. Many Filipinos have been helping out at our school and have worked with on various projects. They are so kind and we want to return the kindness.

Filipinos face many challenges such as extremely low salaries, a high unemployment rate, and, as a result, much poverty. So many children can’t afford an education, and spend long hours working to help support their family..

Therefore, we would like to offer support for some of these problems through our project. We will begin a program where we teach Japanese language and job skills necessary to work in Japan or in  Japanese companies located in the Philippines. Then we will introduce them to companies hiring speakers of Japanese and English.

Also, our project will require hiring some Filipino employees and purchases from Filipino companies, which brings more money into the country.

 

What's special about our school.

We are a little different than your typical Japanese language school. We teach Japanese language, Japanese social norms, Japanese business etiquette and job training. This way, our students can become familiar with the industry.

We assist students in getting the Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT) certificate through counseling. The JLPT is available twice a year in the Philippines; and this certificate looks very good on a resume in Japan, as it is evidence of one’s Japanese language ability.

 

Our goal

We feel that it is our responsibility to assist our neighbor, the Philippines, and to gain an even better relationship between our countries in a way that appeals to each country both of us. Moreover, they will have the opportunity to meet people from all over the world coming to Japan for the Tokyo Olympics and hopefully gain a broader world view. We hope that our students will carry these experiences with them as they continue to grow, and develop good relationships with people from various countries. Our goal is to facilitate a borderless, peaceful future.

story:
The Mermaid Garden

  • I have always known a few things: that I wanted to be a teacher, and that I love the water are two of them.  My first memory is in a pool playing with my mom, and my first job at 16 was Lifeguarding for the City of Boise Natatorium and Hydrotube.  
  • I have been Coaching swimming now for 18 years, and I have always been a teacher who is teaching the kids much more than swimming: how to allow the water to hold them up, how to allow others to support them, how to support each other, to share ideas, to be creative, to use imagination.  How to self-cope: talking to oneself, to your body, to your fears, teaching your body to be soft, telling yourself truths instead of fears, using the water to connect all parts of oneself nurturing the total child in return.  Breathing, and moving, and imagery work, all for the sake of feeling gooooood, feeling comfortable and happy in the water.
  • I found that solely teaching in the water was draining, and began Coaching motor development outside the pool 12 years ago for balance.  I worked at a gymnastics gym, teaching children ages walking to 5 years old all the skills they would need to be healthy athletes of any sport or simply life.  This transferred over to yoga well, because I found that just as I teach swimming holistically, so do I teach motor development.  I love to use all my resources, playing games, coloring, breathing, dancing, sharing, singing, silence, and more to help children connect to all parts of themselves as one integrated peaceful being.
  • I am ready!  I am so ready to begin this new journey, and I need help with some funding to begin!

What I need funds for:

  • $100 for my LLC
  • About $173 x 2 for two different types of liability insurance: swimming and gymnastics/yoga
  • $100 for a cover to my underwater camera (what good would swim lessons be without a fun way to document and give back to the parents!?)
  • $100 for a large animal mat for baby beluga classes and kids to jump off of
  • A bunch of little things aka manipulatives: kick boards, diving toys, buckets, pool noodles, place markers, frisbees, diving rings, splash bombs, watering cans, etc. for manipulatives that I will use both in and out of the pool - my boss today gave me $100 start on this, so that is good!
  • Some yoga materials: books, pick-a-card sets, bean bags, and scarves
  • And I have the rest!  I just bought 6 pairs of flippers, a lot of toys to get started, 8 yoga mats, a collection of kids books and coloring utensils, and I am just about ready to go!  Any help you have to send my way will help me be able to afford this start-up and begin classes in July; Thank you!

The Impact, The Risk, The Hurdles!  What's in it for you?

Because I have been teaching both of these skills for so long, my start-up is not giant.  I have a good collection of tools already that I can use to begin, and I need just a little nudge to have the start that I desire.  I am so appreciative for anything you can do to help me and any shares you can make to friends you have that you feel may want to support my cause.  I am so excited to make an impact on this world's little people even more so than I have been able to do up until now.  I love children; they are my favorite little creative beings, and I love to build them up with empowerment and imagination.

I have always known a few things: that I wanted to be a teacher, and that I love the water are two of them.  My first memory is in a pool playing with my mom, and my first job at 16 was Lifeguarding for the City of Boise Natatorium and Hydrotube.  
I have been Coaching swimming now for 18 years, and I have always been a teacher who is teaching the kids much more than swimming: how to allow the water to hold them up, how to allow others to support them, how to support each other, to share ideas, to be creative, to use imagination.  How to self-cope: talking to oneself, to your body, to your fears, teaching your body to be soft, telling yourself truths instead of fears, using the water to connect all parts of oneself nurturing the total child in return.  Breathing, and moving, and imagery work, all for the sake of feeling gooooood, feeling comfortable and happy in the water.
I found that solely teaching in the water was draining, and began Coaching motor development outside the pool 12 years ago for balance.  I worked at a gymnastics gym, teaching children ages walking to 5 years old all the skills they would need to be healthy athletes of any sport or simply life.  This transferred over to yoga well, because I found that just as I teach swimming holistically, so do I teach motor development.  I love to use all my resources, playing games, coloring, breathing, dancing, sharing, singing, silence, and more to help children connect to all parts of themselves as one integrated peaceful being.
I am ready!  I am so ready to begin this new journey, and I need help with some funding to begin!


What I need funds for:

$100 for my LLC
About $173 x 2 for two different types of liability insurance: swimming and gymnastics/yoga
$100 for a cover to my underwater camera (what good would swim lessons be without a fun way to document and give back to the parents!?)
$100 for a large animal mat for baby beluga classes and kids to jump off of
A bunch of little things aka manipulatives: kick boards, diving toys, buckets, pool noodles, place markers, frisbees, diving rings, splash bombs, watering cans, etc. for manipulatives that I will use both in and out of the pool - my boss today gave me $100 start on this, so that is good!
Some yoga materials: books, pick-a-card sets, bean bags, and scarves
And I have the rest!  I just bought 6 pairs of flippers, a lot of toys to get started, 8 yoga mats, a collection of kids books and coloring utensils, and I am just about ready to go!  Any help you have to send my way will help me be able to afford this start-up and begin classes in July; Thank you!


The Impact, The Risk, The Hurdles!  What's in it for you?
Because I have been teaching both of these skills for so long, my start-up is not giant.  I have a good collection of tools already that I can use to begin, and I need just a little nudge to have the start that I desire.  I am so appreciative for anything you can do to help me and any shares you can make to friends you have that you feel may want to support my cause.  I am so excited to make an impact on this world's little people even more so than I have been able to do up until now.  I love children; they are my favorite little creative beings, and I love to build them up with empowerment and imagination.

story:
Help me help others !

 

Hello, I am John T. Casey, MSW from Los Angeles, Ca. I strive to one day obtain a Psy.D. and become a Licensed Psychologist. 

 

I am the product of a broken home, divorced parents. I witnessed domestic violence, alcoholism, and experienced much more before I was 9 years old. With God's help and guidance I survived and I recently received my graduate degree in Social Work, and I have devoted 15 years of my life to the underserved communites of Los Angeles working in the role as a child protective services social worker. 

 

I am a certifed facilitator and I teach Anger Management, Parenting, and Domestic Violence/Batterers Intervention classes. I teach these classes at greatly reduced rates, because my constituents are from lower income families. However, my counterparts in the community, and outlying areas charge astronomical rates for the same classes. 

I have teamed with a local non profit agency to provide these services/classes at these low rates, however, the demand has been very high. 

I contemplated applying for a grant to provide these classes for free, however, with the current economical climate, many of the funds from community grants have dried up, or require a rigorous, exhausting (time consuming)process. 

So, if I can raise a certain amount of money, I can cover expenses and provide these classes for free to the community (Watts, L.A.,Compton, Lynwood, Inglewood, Hawthorne, Gardena, and Long Beach). This will go a long way in the underserved communities of Greater Los Angeles to eradicate domestic violence, child abuse, spousal abuse, and neglect. 

 

Please view my website for additional information about me: http://urbanangermanagement.com

 

 

 

Please join me!

story:
My name is Maggie Humbert

I was born and raised in Indiana, but moved to Appleton, Wisconsin about 15 years ago.  I am a 45 year old single Christian woman who used to be an x-ray tech for the past 20 plus years until a spine injury took me out of that career and the workforce.  I have been without income since December 23rd 2010, and have been fighting to survive ever since.

My current education and physical restrictions have omitted me from the work force in the area I live.  I am awaiting a disability judgment that may take up to 18 months before I get approved, and until I can earn a new degree in a profession that matches my restrictions I am without income.  Without income and with a serious spine injury I am unable to move to an area where I can find gainful employment.  I lack the funds to complete the last four classes of my degree and have exhausted any state or federal assistance.

I don't want to be a burden on society; I want to contribute to it.  I just need some help to get over these last few hurdles.  My family is unable to help me financially through this tough and scary time in my life. 

 What I need

Each course costs roughly $1,800 (which covers tuition, books, and materials), and I have four classes left before graduation.

I am working with the local Department of Vocational Rehabilitation, but the assistance I receive from them is used (in part) to pay for my living expenses.

I am faced with the choice of paying for school (that I need to land a job that I can physically do) or use the funds to keep a roof over my head.  I really need some help.

I am an intelligent individual and a great student (with a 3.8 GPA).  I have learned so much through these trials and hope to use that knowledge to enhance a business and my community in some way.  I am a creative and hard worker who really wants to contribute to society so I can feel as though I have a purpose in life again.

If I don't reach my entire goal, I will still use the funds to pay for the remaining classes I need to graduate.

The Impact

Your contributions will help a person who is earnestly seeking to better herself and make herself useful again, instead of a financial drag on her community and country.

You will give me reason to get out of bed every day, a reason to smile instead of cry, and you will help bring back autonomy into my life.

 Other sources of help

Please tell your neighbors, your co-workers, your boss...tell everyone you meet about my story.  Direct them to my blog so they can read it for themselves, and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.  I am a person in need, reaching out for assistance.  Please help me become a working citizen again. 

 Thank you for talking the time to read my story.

story:
About me

I am 12 years old and I am in the 6th grade.  I live in Springfield, Missouri.       I have a brother, sister, mom and dad,I have three dogs.  My favorite things to do are reading , learning the Chinese language and playing drums, and listening to my favorite music.

My campaign

Thank you for taking the time to read about my traveling dream.   If my goal is met,  I will be able to study abroad for a year in China.   The program I am interested in takes High School students from the ages of 15-18 years of age.  My goal is to raise $7,500.

 

What We Need & What You Get

When i am in China I plan on learning more about their culture and their language. If my goal is met I will be able to go to Beijing,Forbidden City, The Great Wall, The Mueseum of the Terrecotta Army, Xi'an city wall, and the Dujiangyan.  I also will learn more about the locals and try to take every advanage of helping me learn more of the chinese language and become more fluent with that language. If my goal is not met I will put that money to savings and wait till i can come up with the rest of that money to go to China.  When you donate money to my campaign you will recieve some perks.  Each perk is different depending on how much you donate.    

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to my campaign you can also get the word out about my campaign (you can use indiegogo share tools.)   Thank you for your time and consideration!  

 

Please help if you can it will make a difference.

Please help if you can it will make a difference.

story:
— Ты уроки сделал?
— Ну мам!..
— Быстро, я сказала!

Зачем вы ходили в школу? Не почему — с этим все ясно, или кажется, что ясно, но причин можно найти массу. А вот цель... И если спросить ребят в возрасте от 7 до 17, то можно услышать разное, но, полагаю, «за знаниями» будет где-то в конце рейтинга, если он составлен честно. Эти самые абстрактные «знания» висят над школьником дамокловым мечом все десять лет, ими «пичкают», их оценивают и проверяют, но мало кто из педагогов задается вопросом, что конкретно этот человек будет делать с полученной информацией после экзаменов.

«Сложно» равно «трудно»? «Много» равно «скучно»? «Наукообразно» равно «непонятно»? «Нет!» — говорят преподаватели Зимней Пущинской Школы. И пусть только на одну неделю, но это действительно становится так. Больше двадцати лет назад учёные наукограда Пущино придумали собирать ребят и рассказывать им о своей работе, о современных представлениях и том, что ещё ждет своих первооткрывателей. Каждый хотел достучаться, донести, передать тот азарт, который не раз испытывал сам и в работе, и в жизни. Учёные они ведь такие: «Наука — это изучение Природы и наслаждение ею. Я ощущаю своё тело, разум, поступки и окружающую меня среду как взаимосвязанное целое. Для меня нет различия между работой и досугом — просто это разные приёмы одной и той же игры», — написал в своей книжке «От мечты к открытию» Ганс Селье слова, под которыми подпишутся многие.

И ведь получилось! Сначала знакомые и знакомые знакомых, а потом всё больше незнакомых школьников сами стали стремиться провести весенние каникулы с такими же увлеченными людьми. Вскоре выросло целое поколение «зпшовцев»: кто-то, поступив в вуз (и не в абы какой, а как правило, из десятки лучших российских), сам стал преподавать в Школе; некоторые привели уже своих детей; одни уехали, другие уже вернулись; многие просто хранят в памяти атмосферу интеллектуального братства, сотворчества и взаимного интереса — но и это немало! Из чего же, из чего же, из чего же сделана ЗПШ, спросите вы?

...Из заданий,
Дураковаляний,
Выдумок и состязаний
По шевеленью мозгами.


Есть курсы (в этом году около 60), методики которых разрабатываются преподавателями специально для Школы, и выбор, куда ходить, делает сам ученик. Есть студии, где после учебного дня можно занять себя всякими любопытными штуковинам вроде плетения фенечек и буриме. Есть команды, собираемые отчасти случайно и разновозрастно, но в процессе общешкольных игр, соревнований и прочих коалиций выясняется, что проявить себя может каждый, причем тогда, когда никто и не ждёт. Здесь не требуют отчёта, не выставляют оценок и не спрашивают, «что хотел сказать автор». На удивление, сам начинаешь понимать, что узнал и насколько хорошо, а главное, зачем.

— Эй, пацан, куда стулья потащил? Мы тут из них вообще-то числа Фибоначчи моделируем.
— А у нас там настоящий робот ходит, и лабиринт уже заканчивается, надо дальше скорее строить. Ну что вам, жалко?
— Да бери, бери, не канючь только. Там кто-нибудь снимает? Хоть потом посмотреть.

Ведь вы не забыли, с чего начался этот разговор? После Школы каждый, будь то Ваня Иванов из 6-го «А» или директор ЗПШ, доктор физико-математических наук, заведующий лабораторией прикладной математики Института прикладной математики РАН, заведующий базовой кафедрой «Яндекс» ВШЭ Михаил Абрамович Ройтберг, может открыть для себя что-то новое. И это не красивые слова, просто попав в животворную среду ЗПШ осознаёшь, как важно доверять себе и окружающим, сколько возможностей таится вокруг нас и как это здорово можно использовать, да что там — прямо-таки кощунственно не использовать!

— Простите, можно пару слов для телевидения? У вас такой удивленный и восторженный вид, вы в первый раз на ЗПШ?
— В шестой.

Тех, кто раз в году считает своим долгом осчастливить около 250 детей (и это число растёт), — всего-то около сотни, меньше, чем амурских тигров. Не дайте нам почувствовать себя вымирающим видом — ведь мы не получаем за это зарплату, а частенько раскошеливаемся сами. И ищем спонсоров, гадая, дадут ли денег, хватит ли их, будет ли помещение, компьютеры, канцтовары, жильё и питание, не сорвётся ли всё в последний момент? Пока это каждый раз рулетка, но хочется всё изменить.


Вы знаете, как? Можете подкинуть идей, денег или вещей? Пишите нам по адресу: zpsh2012@zpsh.ru. Подробнее о деятельности Школы и сопутствующих мероприятих в течение года можно почитать на www.zpsh.ru и ВКонтакте: http://vk.com/zpsh_ru. Новости оперативне всего появляются в твиттере: https://twitter.com/#!/zpsh_ru. Ролики о нас висят на http://www.youtube.com/user/ZpshVideo.

У вас такой удивленный и восторженный вид, вы в первый раз на ЗПШ?— В шестой.Тех, кто раз в году считает своим долгом осчастливить около 250 детей (и это число растёт), — всего-то около сотни, меньше, чем амурских тигров. Не дайте нам почувствовать себя вымирающим видом — ведь мы не получаем за это зарплату, а частенько раскошеливаемся сами. И ищем спонсоров, гадая, дадут ли денег, хватит ли их, будет ли помещение, компьютеры, канцтовары, жильё и питание, не сорвётся ли всё в последний момент? Пока это каждый раз рулетка, но хочется всё изменить.

 

Вы знаете, как? Можете подкинуть идей, денег или вещей? Пишите нам по адресу: zpsh2012@zpsh.ru. Подробнее о деятельности Школы и сопутствующих мероприятих в течение года можно почитать на www.zpsh.ru и ВКонтакте: http://vk.com/zpsh_ru. Новости оперативне всего появляются в твиттере: https://twitter.com/#!/zpsh_ru. Ролики о нас висят на http://www.youtube.com/user/ZpshVideo.

story:
English Version & Versión en español

Short Summary

Jukeboxlessons.com is a web platform where you can find teachers to learn anything you want, no matter where you are, by means of videoconference. You can be in a small village in Greece, and have a saxophone lesson with a pro jazz master from New York. 

Or take a cooking lesson with a japanese chef...

Choose among thousands of possibilities, prices, languages. Interact with people from all over the world.The possibilities are unlimited!

You can also find teachers in your city, if you prefer face to face lessons. 

If you master a speciality and you want to teach it, at jukeboxlessons we provide you with a Home, where people can find you and purchase your lessons, or hire you for consulting.

Resumen Español

Jukeboxlessons.com es una plataforma web donde puedes encontrar profesores para aprender cualquier materia, sin importar donde estés, mediante videconferencia. Puedes estar en un pequeño pueblo de España y aprender saxofón con un maestro del Jazz de Nueva York. 

O tomar una clase de cocina con un chef japonés...

Escoge entre miles de posibilidades, precios, idiomas. Interactúa con gente de todo el mundo. Las posibilidades son ilimitadas. 

Si dominas una especialidad y quieres enseñarla, en Jukeboxlessons tienes tu espacio, donde personas de todo el mundo pueden comprarte clases o contratarte para consultas.

What We Need & What You Get

 Our project is already online. We have invested money and time over the last two years, and now we are proud to have it functioning. So it's not just an idea, but a reality. More than 250 teachers from many different countries have already registered in only one month.

Why do we need funds?

Being a global project, it's a huge effort. We need funds to make it grow and become sustainable.

We'll spend the money we raise on:

  • advertizing (google campaigns, facebook campaigns, marketing, and all we can do to make jukeboxlessons known worldwide and to bring people to know and use the interface)
  • Improving our website. We want to make it better, program new tools for teachers and students, improve graphics, add new sections, create multimedia content, translate it to other languages...
  • Hire a team to increase our capacity .

What do you get? 

The satisfaction of contributing to develop this unique platform. Our sincere appreciation and gratefulness. And the rewards offered with our perks... Check them out at our perks section!

Qué necesitamos & qué obtienes?

 Nuestro proyecto ya está online. Hemos invertido tiempo y dinero durante dos años, y estamos orgullosos de que ya está funcionando. No es solo una idea, sino una realidad. Más de 270 profesores de muchos países se han inscrito en un mes.

Por qué necesitamos fondos?

Es un proyecto global, y el esfuerzo es enorme. Necesitamos para hacerlo crecer y volverlo sostenible.

Invertiremos los fondos en:

  • publicidad (campañas de google, campañas de facebook, marketing, y todo lo que podamos hacer para hacer conocida nuestra web y conseguir que la gente la utilice.
  • Mejorar nuestra web. Programar herramientas nuevas para alunos y profesores, mejorar el diseño, agregar nuevas secciones, crear contenido multimedia, traducirla a más idiomas...
  • Contratar un equipo para incrementar nuestra capacidad.

Qué obtienes por esto?

La satisfacción de haber contribuido a desarrollar una plataforma única. Nuestro sincero aprecio y gratitud. Y las recompensas que proponemos en las "Perks", míralas en la sección "perks"!

Who are we, who is behind the project?

My name is Sebastian Crispo. I'm a musician, writer, language teacher and sportsman... A creative character with determination and practical ideas. I was born in Switzerland, grew up in Haiti and Uruguay, and I now live in Barcelona. I'm a passionate, and I believe in ideas becoming reality. I feel this project is both interesting and challenging, and it is rewarding to bring people from so many different countries and backgrounds to connect wih each other and share knowledge. 

My partner, Federico Zabaleta, is good with the numbers. He has an open mind that made him believe in this project and work for it.

Now, we hope to see this unique project blossom, like a flower in spring, and grow like a baobab tree over the centuries... We are counting on you!

Quiénes estamos detrás de este proyecto?

Mi nombre es Sebastián Crispo. Soy músico, escritor, profesor de idiomas y de música, deportista... Un perfil creativo con ideas prácticas y determinación. Nací en Suiza, crecí en Haiti y Uruguay, y ahora vivo en Barcelona. Creo en las ideas que se vuelven realidad. Pienso que este proyecto es un desafío interesante. Es una satisfacción conectar a tanta gente de diferentes paises y culturas, para que compartan conocimiento. 

Mi socio, Federico Zabaleta, es bueno con los números. Tiene una mentalidad abierta y un espíritu emprendedor que le hicieron creer en este proyecto y trabajar en él.

Ahora esperamos verlo crecer y asentarse, contamos con ustedes!

Other Ways You Can Help/otras formas de ayudar (comparte links)

If you can't contribute with money at this stage, don't worry, any support will be much appreciated.

For example, you could help us spread the word...

  • Tell people about our project:

          jukeboxlessons.com

  • Like our facebook page:

          facebook.com/jukeboxlessons

  • Mention our Indiegogo fundraising campain to others:

          Indiegogo.com/jukeboxlessons

          

Thank you all very much for taking a few moments to learn about this campaign and thank you for your support.

Gracias a todos por tomarse unos momentos para informarse de esta campaña, y gracias por el support.

Best wishes!

Sebastian

story:
If we’re honest, introductions are always a bit painful and slightly awkward even though they are a necessity in life. I’m not going to make any promises here, but I will do my best to make this as painless as possible and perhaps even slightly enjoyable.

My name, as given on the fantastic little name tag above, is Charlene. Though I grew up in the US, I am now in the UK getting a Master’s degree in Cultural Heritage and International Development at the University of East Anglia. This is the point where most people glaze over and simply nod and smile, as they have no clue what I am on about. Let me attempt to alleviate your confusion.

My course is a yearlong program that explores the themes of cultural heritage (what makes up culture, how it is defined, how it can be carried forward for future generations or destroyed), and the complexities of international development (what development is and means, how it is deployed, what countries are considered as developing). The combination of these two ideas means that the bulk of my studies are centred on cultural elements within the developing world.

In particular, the cultural elements I’m studying are archaeological sites that are located within the Middle East. Thus far, I’ve been quite lucky and landed a two-week (self-funded) internship with the Petra National Trust – a Jordanian NGO that works with the awe inspiring site of Petra (yes, the same Petra that can be seen in Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade). While the internship was amazing, it only provided the basis for the big kahuna – my dissertation (also known as a Master's thesis in the US).

Finally, the reason you are here is revealed!

To complete my degree, I must research and write a dissertation, which is due at the beginning of September. This research, like the internship before it, is also self-funded. Unfortunately, funding for the humanities and travel in general is low, and though I did apply to an educational foundation (SPRET), the award I received does not even cover the cost of one of my plane tickets.

What exactly is it that I want to do, you ask? Fantastic question!

To complete my dissertation (which has the glaze inducing title of: Culture for sale: Issues in the development of stable management structures and tourism sustainability in tentative UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the Middle East) I need to visit several sites in the Middle East, meet with the site managers (or an NGO working with the site) and discuss what issues they are facing from both management and tourism aspects. Though in some cases, such as Jordan, tourism makes up a large portion of the country’s income, there is a stigma attached to the region that limits the number of visitors. There can also be issues within the local population that cause discourse as well.

The sites I wish to visit are all archaeological and on the UNESCO World Heritage Site tentative list. This means that someday they might be listed as a World Heritage Site and see an increase in visitors, which could cause problems if there is not a stable management and tourism structure in place.

Let’s break down the specifics, shall we?

I am asking for donations to help fund the travel and research portion of my dissertation. Not to worry, I will do all the heavy lifting and writing myself!

My trip will include visits to Jordan (Jerash Archaeological City), United Arab Emirates (Al Bidya Mosque and Ed-Dur Site), and Qatar (Al-Zubarah town), lasting approximately two weeks in total. Originally, the trip was scheduled to take place in June, until I received the bad news regarding my funding. It has now been pushed to July and though it will be hot, I will gladly make it work.

Travel includes (all Round Trip):

  • Transportation from Norwich, UK, to London, UK
  • Airfare - Amman, Jordan/London, UK (Booking this one with easyJet to help lower the cost!)
  • Airfare – Amman, Jordan/Dubai, UAE
  • Airfare – Dubai, UAE/Doha, Qatar
  • Transportation while in Jordan, UAE, and Qatar

Value: £1,100

Other expenses:

  • Food – essential to life
  • Lodging (No Four Seasons, I promise!!)

Value: £900

Please note that this campaign is in US dollars, though my value estimates are in Pounds. This was done to make donations and the receipt of funds much less painful. In addition, this campaign gives me the funds regardless of the goal being reached. How then, will I spend the funds if I cannot afford the entire trip? Depending on the amount reached, I will adjust my travel and research. Funds will not go unused or to assist in the purchase of a pair of Jimmy Choos!

This research is incredibly important for both the completion of my degree and for archaeological sites that are facing management and sustainability issues. I do hope to continue my career in the heritage sector in the Middle East and this is one of the steps required to get me there.

Anyone who contributes will receive a sincere thank you note, a post card from my travels, and my eternal gratitude!

But wait, there’s more!!

I do realise that not everyone can donate funds, which is beyond understandable. If this is the case, there are still a few things you can do to help me (you too will also receive my eternal gratitude):

  • Donate airline miles or hotel points: I am a United Airlines fan and could convert any miles or hotel points which were donated to help either pay for or lower the cost of my travel.

 

  • Share this campaign via email or on any social media platform you wish! Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest (just don’t get stuck there looking at baking recipes!), Tumblr, etc!

 

  • Suggest funding opportunities: Know of an organisation that is granting research or travel funds? Let me know! I would be happy to hear about it!

 

Thank you for reading about my campaign. I hope it was at least slightly enjoyable and thank you for any assistance in advance!

story:
My name is Christian Haas. I mentor adults with intellectual disabilities. I help integrate them into college and the community where they focus on independent living, community services, campus engagement, self determination, career development, & academic enrichment.



These students are not qualified for Bright Futures, Pell Grants, or student loans. This campaign hopes to raise enough money to cover tuition for those students who need the extra help. Students meet with mentors, work on their reading and math skills, hold on and off campus internships, and audit college level courses.

  

Many colleges are  leading the way in providing robust alternatives to outdated approaches to special education. The students I work with show tremendous growth in their abilities & character. This postsecondary movement, which values inclusion and equal opportunity, is reforming special education on campuses across the state.

 

College courses are not cheap. With the cost of tuition and books forever rising, many students are facing difficult choices regarding their future on college campuses across the nation.

 

Your support will help pay for tuition & fees, textbooks, and will supplement any other unexpected costs students are not able to pay.

 

Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can still be a positive force in these students' lives. Sharing this campaign with your friends is a good place to start. I am so grateful for your support.

 

When they say it takes a village to raise a child, they mean it. That is precisely why I’m turning to my village to help in this endeavor.

 

Please note- This fundraising initiative has been autonomously created and implemented by Christian Haas, independent from USFSP and any other department or institution.

story:
Short Summary

We, the Juilliard ARTreach New Orleans Service Team, have until March 2nd to meet our budget so that we can fly to New Orleans this Saturday and teach, perform, and build homes for the New Orleans community, in conjunction with the Habitat for Humanity, the New Orleans Center for Creative Arts (NOCCA), and the YMCA.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1000 to meet our goal by this Saturday! If you donate $25 or more, you will receive a youtube video of a Juilliard dancer choreographing a solo dedicated to you!!!

The Impact

Your donation helps us provide 1 week of artistic and educational support for the children of New Orleans, along with the creation of new homes built by our team in conjunction with the Habitat for Humanity.

Other Ways You Can Help

Send a donation to sabrina.tanbara@gmail.com via paypal.com to directly support our mission!!

story:
Short Summary

100 Black Men of Pensacola, Inc. offers young men educational and scholarly opportunities. With leadership development as the focus, young men receive training in areas of leadership, social development, life skills and more.

What We Need & What You Get

Your Investment in Our Young Men's Futures  
This season we ask that you invest in our  Annual Beautillion. This invitational letter is to ask you to consider becoming a program sponsor.
This year's sponsorship investment opportunities and packages are as follows:
$500 - 2 tickets to the Beautillion and a ¼ page ad in our souvenir journal
$1,000- 4 tickets to the Beautillion, and a ½ page ad in our souvenir journal
$2,000 - 6 tickets to the Beautillion and a full-page ad in our souvenir journal
$3,000 - (A table sponsorship) 8 tickets to the Beautillion and a full page ad in our souvenir journal
 
Your generous investment in us enables our organization to invest in these deserving young men who will be emerging leaders for our local community and beyond.
 
All sponsors will receive premier acknowledgement at all media events, at the Beautillion and in our souvenir journal. We must have your camera-ready material by February 10, 2013. Your acceptance of our request by this date will allow us to have programs printed and get the tickets to you in a timely manner. Visit www.100blackmenpensacola.org.
story_txt:
Short Summary
100 Black Men of Pensacola, Inc. offers young men educational and scholarly opportunities. With leadership development as the focus, young men receive training in areas of leadership, social development, life skills and more.


What We Need & What You Get
Your Investment in Our Young Men's Futures   
This season we ask that you invest in our  Annual Beautillion. This invitational letter is to ask you to consider becoming a program sponsor. 
This year's sponsorship investment opportunities and packages are as follows: 

$500 - 2 tickets to the Beautillion and a ¼ page ad in our souvenir journal


$1,000- 4 tickets to the Beautillion, and a ½ page ad in our souvenir journal


$2,000 - 6 tickets to the Beautillion and a full-page ad in our souvenir journal


$3,000 - (A table sponsorship) 8 tickets to the Beautillion and a full page ad in our souvenir journal

 
Your generous investment in us enables our organization to invest in these deserving young men who will be emerging leaders for our local community and beyond. 
 
All sponsors will receive premier acknowledgement at all media events, at the Beautillion and in our souvenir journal. We must have your camera-ready material by February 10, 2013. Your acceptance of our request by this date will allow us to have programs printed and get the tickets to you in a timely manner. Visit www.100blackmenpensacola.org.

story:
Thank you so much!

To everyone who contributed and shared the campaign, thank you!

We spent about $7,500 on the first ten ads. You can see photos and a map of locations at our site.

Keep in touch on Facebook and Twitter for news on our plans for the rest of the funds.

You can also chip in through Paypal and get the same perks listed here.

[Note: you do not  need a PayPal account to donate through PayPal. You can use any credit card. Click "Donate", then look for the "Don't have a Paypal account?" section at the bottom left of the page.]

Questions? Tweet to @talkbacktohate.

 

Poster #1 is now live!

Check out the map at TalkBackToHate.org. 

 

 

About the campaign:

Have you seen these subway station ads?

 
These ads attack our most basic communal values: they try to exploit the city’s grief and anger over 9/11, and they demonize and intimidate members of a particular religious group. 
 
That's not how we roll. Everyone has a right to feel at home in this city, and that includes our Muslim neighbors.

Don't let hate get the last word.

If you chip in, 

We'll buy our own ads—

and run them in as many stations as we can.

In just two weeks, we raised $7,500, to get started with ads in ten subway stations. We've gotten great press to amplify our voices, so the whole world will hear our response. 

 

Official design for the first poster! 


 

How can you be a part of it? 

We need your help to pay for the ads. You can also contribute your message to the campaign. See the perks on the right-hand sidebar.

Other ways to help: Even if you can't pitch in, you can help spread the word by telling your friends, family, and anyone else you know!

Join Us Online: You can Follow @TalkBackToHate on Twitter and Like us on Facebook.. 

If you're really serious, you can print this page and hand it out on the subway if you want! But please don't litter :)

 

What will it take?

Just $7,500 will get us started with ads in 10 stations. Here are the costs including IndieGogo and Paypal fees:

 

This is a "Flexible Funding" campaign, which means that as soon as we have enough money to print the ads, we can have them produced and sent to the MTA. We'll post the receipts and invoices for all campaign-related costs on the "Transparency" section at TalkBackToHate.org, which will launch in the coming weeks. 

After another $500 to cover project costs (poster perks, domains and hosting for TalkBacktoHate.org, and buying equipment needed to create the video), each additional $6,500 will pay for another ten ads—so keep it up, and share this with everyone you know! 

If we're between funding milestones when the campaign ends—i.e., we raised $13,400 and were able to run the first ten ads, but we're $600 short of running the next ten—we'll raise enough via PayPal to put us over the top. If there's any leftover money, we'll set up a vote that lets donors choose an NYC-based charity to receive the money. 

 

Wait, who's behind this response campaign?

You are. The campaign is being run by regular New Yorkers. We're not connected to any political, religious, or nonprofit group. Anyone can join us.

No, seriously, who set this up? OK, from the guy who created the IndieGogo page and the video: My name is Akiva Freidlin and I'm a thirty-year-old white guy who lives in Manhattan. I'm also the grandchild of Holocaust survivors who came to the United States looking for freedom, tolerance, and prosperity—and found it in New York. 

The New Yorkers I know are proud to share this city with neighbors of all cultures, nations, and religions, and we reject hateful attacks that target Muslims or anyone else—so I asked my friends to help me put together this campaign.  (I happen to work at a nonprofit, but this effort is completely independent from any organization, and any views expressed are mine alone.)

Want to ask me a question? You can reach me on Twitter via @akivaf, but please follow @TalkBackToHate for campaign-related news and tweets.

 

 

Creative Commons Music Credit: "Whispering Through", by (Asura) / CC BY 3.0
