story:
On January 24, 2011, my son Jamison was involved in an auto accident that left him paralyzed from the neck down and ventilator dependent. He fractured his neck at C1-C2 and his back at T4-T5-T6. Three days after the accident, doctors talked with us about removing him from life support as they thought his chances for survival were slim. Not wanting to make a quick decision, my wife and I decided to take a "wait and see" approach. The very next day, Jamison woke up and was fully cognitive even though he had suffered some swelling of his brain. Doctors gave him little chance of regaining any movement and had low expectations for his life expectancy. He was at UAB hospital in the ICU for a little over a month before we had him transferred to The Shepherd Center in Atlanta. He transferred into the ICU there. The Shepherd Center is a hospital that specializes in spinal cord injuries. Doctors at The Shepherd Center had little hope of his regaining any movement as well, until he wiggled his big toe on his left foot. Then he became able to to squeeze his thighs together a little. He then gained slight movement in his left arm and then his right. While most of the movement has noy become functional, his right arm has grown stronger and he can now move it a little back and forth and up and down. He can now barely pick his right arm up and put it in his lap.

While we have private insurance coverage for him, there have been so many expenses that have not been covered. Our savings, retirement, and children's college funds are now gone.

We are raising funds to get him a WREX exoskeleton arm that will help him regain some functional use of his right arm. He could work a computer keyboard, scratch his nose, feed himself, and many other things you and I take for granted. It would give my 19 year old son some sense of independence. Something he's not had in two years now.

I cant afford to send perks for donations as seems common on this site but your contribution, in any way that you can contribute, would be greatly appreciated. It is hard for my family and I to seek out help as we have always been givers by nature and being the ones needing help is very humbling. Please know that any help is greatly appreciated....The picture is Jamison using a mouthstick to operate a donated IPad.

story:
FREE PERKS!

I now say thank you to the challenges, because each one makes me wiser and stronger.  I am by no means where I want to be, but I am enjoying the journey.  I ACTUALLY LOVE WHAT I DO, AND HOW I DO IT!
That is why I'm asking you to please don't be shy!  TWEET YOUR REQUEST to @angelicaross with the hashtag #MissRoss and tell me which perk you would like and I will do my best to give you what I have to give.  I am looking to go to Life Coach Training so that I can give more efficiently, and become a better me in the process.  You are welcome to come a long with me on the journey.  As I learn better, I will do better, and I will pass it on.  Please consider donating even $1 just to say, I support you, and I will genuinely be grateful, and am willing to publicly thank you for your support.

The calling came to me sitting in the church pews as a child.  A call I was afraid to ignore, but more afraid to answer.  Why me?  Who would listen to me?  I was told I was an abomination, and that my path would lead me straight to hell, which it did.  I have been through hell and now I'm back with a message for those who are suffering through their own version hell.  I currently work as an Employment Program Coordinator and provide career coaching for transgender, gender non-conforming, and cisgender individuals.  With a foundation in Buddhism as well as A Course in Miracles, I want to expand and begin to focus on Life and Spiritual Coaching.  I want to formalize my skills to help others see the value in ALL of life, even the painful parts.  I aim to help shift a perspective of fear to love and courage.  I have watched my life unfold in divine order, and I am grateful for the lessons, and wish to use some of those lessons as my #LifeClass as Oprah would put it.  With your help, after completing the Life Coach Training I will be certified and will receive credentials from the International Coach Federation.

Join Me on the Journey!

I am on the right path, and would like your help getting there, in return I am willing to help you, or someone you know with Perks that include: 

  • FREE 30 minute or 1 Hour Coaching Sessions
  • Custom Web Designs
  • FREE Web hosting
  • Custom Facebook Cover art for Personal or Business pages
  • Online Tutorials & Workshops
  • Radio Advertisement on my Blog Talk Radio Show, "Miss Ross Live!"
  • Be my Co-Host for a day on Miss Ross Live!
  • Download my Exclusive Demo CD
  • Thank You's on Facebook, Twitter, and even Youtube and MUCH MORE!
  • Feel free to suggest a Perk and if it's reasonable and feasible I'll add it!    

This is a FLEXIBLE FUNDING campaign which means even if I don't reach my goal, your contributions will go towards helping me start enrolling for class and start somewhere, if it's just the first class!

I will be enrolling in the Certified Life Coach training, which consist of the 130-Hours of training, starting September 16th 2013 and it will that will take me 1 year to complete all required courses for my CLC Credentials from the Institute for Life Coach Training.  

HELP ME HELP OTHERS!  MAKE A CONTRIBUTION TODAY!

  • Help me spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, and more!
  • Take up a collection at work or with your family and share the perks!
  • Make a Youtube video of support!
  • Put a banner on your website or blog!
  • ASK ME HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP AND I'M SURE I'LL FIND A WAY!

story:
Who We Are!

WordWorks! is a creative writing lab based in Lynchburg, Virginia.  

Our Mission

WordWorks! provides creative and expository writing skill support to K-12 students and their teachers.  Through after-school tutoring, workshops, student publications and in-school programs, our services are structured around the ideas that individual attention can spark great leaps in learning and that solid writing skills are a building block for future success.

Our Vision

Challenging and fun, our programs are designed to foster a love of language and give young people the power to express ideas effectively, creatively, confidently, and in their individual voices while at the same time teaching the critical thinking and communication skills necessary to be a successful and contributing adult.  With this in mind and with the generous help of volunteers and educational professionals, WordWorks! provides all of its services free of charge.

But How Do You Do All That?

How, you ask?  Through writing workshops, individualized attention to student needs and regularly publishing the work of our young authors.  Also by liberally using zombies, superhero animals, the magic of telepathic writing powers and monthly haiku competitions as inspiration.  (Never underestimate the power of a nicely worded haiku.)

What We Need!

With our Fall Fundraising Spectacular we hope to raise money for:

  • Publishing our Summer Anthology, a collection of over one hundred stories and poems written by children participating in our summer workshops.
  • Establishing an in-house lending library of age appropriate and culturally relevant reading materials.
  • Snacks!  Because after school, children are hungry and it is always easier to write when your belly is full.
  • Pencils, paper, crayons, glue, tape, markers, staples, etc; instruments critical to any serious creative endeavor and which all seem to get used at a fantastic rate of speed.
  • Electricity!  Because writing in the dark, while not impossible, is very very difficult.

WordWorks! provides of all of its services free of charge so that every child always has the ability to participate.  We rely wholly on the generosity of volunteers who donate their time and energy to help teach our workshops. Your support of WordWorks! during our Fall Fundraising Spectacular helps ensure that we will be able to continue to provide our high quality, unique programs to the children of our community.  

What's In It For You!

Endless thanks and the knowledge that you are now officially a part of something really special that makes a real and regular difference in the lives and futures of young people. Also, we have a few "actual things" we can give you:

  • $10 - A high five for being awesome!  Virtual high fives to everyone unable to travel to Lynchburg, VA to receive their high five in person. 
  • $50 - A year's worth of our original WordWorks publications.
  • $100 - A year's worth of our original WordWorks publications AND an original story and/or picture by one of our official WordWorks! young writers.
  • $500 - A year's worth of our original WordWorks publications AND an original story and/or picture by one of our official WordWorks! young writers AND a handcrafted valentine card to the person of your choice created and designed by one of our official WordWorks! young writers.  

Our Impact!

In the last year WordWorks! has served over two hundred children and published two works of student writing.  We have hosted sixteen workshops, a month long in-school program and a monthly open house featuring local art and music.  With your help we can do so much more.  In the pipe is another story collection (our largest yet!) and we can't wait to give even more children the chance to see their work in print and publicly celebrated.  We have four more workshops planned for the coming months and are starting an after-school pilot program this week.  Help us continue to do what we do to make a meaningful impact in the education and cultural development of children!

Other Ways You Can Help!

Not everyone can give money, but that's okay!  

WordWorks! is forever in need of volunteers and snack-bringers and cheerleaders who can spread the word far and wide about the important work we do.  Please share this campaign with your favorite people and help us fulfill our mission of giving all children the power to express themselves through writing.

story:
Join the cause and enter the raffle for a chance to win some custom art work! Read below for more details.

There are 11 days left to go on the fundraiser and I am still working towards my goal so to add to the perks of donating I am doing a raffle!

For a donation of only $15 you will be entered in a raffle to win a custom painting/charcoal/pastel/whatever medium you prefer done by my girlfriend.

She is super versatile in her styles so whatever you would want done she will paint it for you. Portraits, abstract, comic book styles etc. There will be two names drawn for this raffle.

The first name gets a larger piece and the second a smaller one. But we need a minimum of 50 entries in order to make it to our goal so please share this with your friends and family!!! Where else will you be able to get a custom painting for only $15?

To donate and enter click on the link to the fundraising website!!! Thanks again for all of your support!

 Check out the gallery to see some of her stuff.

 

Hay everyone, I have come into a really tight spot and I need your help. 

What I'm doing...

I have maintained a 4.0 for the past three years in community college and now I’m all set to transfer to the Jacobs School of Engineering at UCSD as a computer science major.

Why I need help...

Due to issues with financial aid I have been paying for school out-of-pocket for the last year. I have been able to make it so far by doing odd job concrete work but due to my heavy course load last semester and this coming summer semester I have been unable to take on enough work.

How you can help...

I am reaching out for fiscal assistance this last semester of community college.  Every penny counts and is much appreciated! 

I think $1500 should be enough to keep this ship from sinking and to find safe harbor on the luxurious shores of La Jolla (La Hoya, for those of you who are not of the southern persuasion). Thanks for the love!

Hay everyone, I have come into a really tight spot and I need your help. 
What I'm doing...
I have maintained a 4.0 for the past three years in community college and now I’m all set to transfer to the Jacobs School of Engineering at UCSD as a computer science major.
Why I need help...
Due to issues with financial aid I have been paying for school out-of-pocket for the last year. I have been able to make it so far by doing odd job concrete work but due to my heavy course load last semester and this coming summer semester I have been unable to take on enough work.
How you can help...
I am reaching out for fiscal assistance this last semester of community college.  Every penny counts and is much appreciated! 
I think $1500 should be enough to keep this ship from sinking and to find safe harbor on the luxurious shores of La Jolla (La Hoya, for those of you who are not of the southern persuasion). Thanks for the love!

story:
Short Summary

We know how much children love sweets, so we decided to make them, and also their parents, happy with a cooking book with the most special homemade European sweets. The goal of our campaign is to release a cute cooking book and organize a “children cocktail party” for the abused and homeless children in Bucharest, Romania.

Cooking book

My name is Alina Paduraru and I'm a journalist from Bucharest, Romania. Beside journalism, in my free time I'm a cooking enthusiast and really love to share my special cookies with other people and making them a bit happier and excited about new tastes. Together with my friend, also Alina, who's a photographer, I would like to realease a cooking book with healthy European homemade sweets dedicated to children.

Children Cocktail Party

Also, I would like to organise a small party, or better said “children cocktail” for the abused and homeless children in Bucharest. I'm planning, with the help of the specialized foundations to invite as many children as possible to my event. I see everyday abandoned children on the street or children abused by their parents or relatives and I would like to make them a bit happier, at least for a day.

And for make my dream come true, I need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

2000 $ : this is the money I need to do all I told you about before.

2000 $ means the book realease, the prints, the perks and the cocktail party and the little gifts for the children.

Any contribution is most welcomed!

Perks:

- big biiiig thanks!

- your name on the Thank You list

- online cooking book

- printed recipes

- printed cooking calendars

- our official sponsor

- special Romanian gift

- special invitation to our party

The Impact

To be honest, I wish my campaign to have a double impact. 

The social impact: I want the society to pay more attention about children, the real future. I want the society to watch out more about how the children are treated and what is happening to them. I want the society to be less ignorant and think about the people around, mostly the little ones.

The personal impact: I want to be able to realease my first cooking book and learn parents about what their children need. I want that our children to learn that good cookies are not only chocolate bars and Fast-Food pies. I want to make them to taste a bit more of natural delights.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can’t contribute, I would highly appreciate if you will share my campaign and make some noise about it.

story:
Our dear Emily has an opportunity this summer to attend the Pre-College Art Lab at the Kansas City Art Institute, July 7-26.  This is a three week residency program where she will have the opportunity to discover first hand the commitment it takes to be an artist.  The cost is $2,899, due by June 7th, 2013.

Emily has worked tirelessly in school the past twelve years, and will be graduating this May with honors as well as having earned the A+ Scholarship which will pay for 2 semesters of community college. She will have already earned three college credits by the time she graduates, having taken dual-credit courses her Junior and Senior years.  By completing the PCAL program, she will have already accumulated 5 credits before she even enrolls as a full-time college student.  She is well on her way to a promising future.

What Your Financial Support Will Provide:

  • Three college credits
  • Tuition
  • Room and board
  • Supplies
  • Some excursions and weekend activities
  • One semester living center grant if she chooses to enroll at KCAI
  • Portfolio review at the conclusion of the program
  • Exhibition of work in a public show
  • Much more!

How Emily Will Grow As An Artist:

She will be allowed to:

  • Meet a faculty of artists and educators who will inspire, motivate and push her closer to her artistic goals.
  • Study within a college-like curriculum that will expose her to new techniques and media.
  • Experience the joy of working within well-equipped studios featuring specialized equipment.
  • Live, learn, laugh and connect with high school students from across the country who are each serious about art.
  • Create art five days a week, nine hours a day for three weeks of art-making heaven.

Emily has been blessed with many gifts, including her creativity, intelligence, self-discipline, and her supportive friends and family.  All of the above are vital, but with the financial support of the latter, she can get a head start towards realizing her dreams.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in the position to help financially, please take the time to share this campaign with others on whichever social media outlet you choose. Just by taking the time to read this, you have shown your love and support, and for that we thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Having grown up with my mother who's artistic endavours knows no boundaries she nurtured my own passion for the arts. From this encouragement and my own fervor, I completed my honours degree in fine arts, with a minor in art history, from Queens University, Kingston On. 

Upon completing my degree, I wished to expand my knowledge and understanding of art as an object in regards to preventative and restorative conservation. This led me to my current program of study, Applied Museum Studies. In accordance with the program requirements I am to complete a four month long internship. 

I Have been accepted as an intern with the National Gallery of Ireland for art conservation. By donating to this campaign it will help me gain experience in a field I hope to pursue at a masters level and as my future career.

What We Need & What You Get

As this is an unpaid internship, and a course requirement, I am unable to gain financially via this internship, and am still required to pay tuition fees. The aid brought about through this campaign will help me with airfare, room and board during the placement.   

The perks will be clips and photographs of both Dublin city and the work undertaken by me at the Gallery. 

short video clips will be taken of exciting events and famous monuments within the exciting city of Dublin. In addition pen, pastel, silkscreen and lithograph prints will be given out as a perk, all of them having been created by me over the past few years. 

The Impact

The field of cultural heritage and the preservation of it is an invaluable one. The artefacts preserved within institutions such as the National Gallery of Ireland, help facilitate a greater understanding of various parts of history, whether it be our own or not.

It is crucial that future generations are trained to care for our fine art collections and artefacts inorder to preserve the history and historical significance attached to said objects. Through this placement I hope to learn and gain practical experience in theories and techniques for the preservation of fine art in order to maintain historical and culturally significant artefacts.

story:
Short Summary

                I started making murals with young people around 5 years ago. It has become a passion in my life at this point. I am so inspired by the young people I work with, their excitement and energy for working to create something beautiful in their community. I have done projects in Newburgh, NY, where I currently am an art teacher, and have traveled to Belize and Ecuador to work with young people to create murals in their communities.

               It is extremely challenging and intimidating walking into a community other than my own, especially in a culture other than mine,  and to embark on an artistic journey of creation with young people I don’t know and who don’t know me. Working together requires trust, but this leap of faith has time and again yielded a wonderful result both in both the process and the product. When young people create something larger than themselves, they learn firsthand about the power of community. It’s a valuable and inspirational lesson.

          The projects I have done in Newburgh and Belize were completely independently conceived of and realized by me. The projects in Ecuador were done in tandem with One World Classrooms, a non-profit organization whose mission is to foster cross-cultural communication through the arts and technology, between schools in the United States and schools in countries around the world. The trips I have taken have changed my life in that they have taught me that art making is universal and bridges language and culture.

       I believe these projects have in a small way changed the lives of the young people involved .This year I would like to travel to Windhoek, Namibia, with One World Classrooms, to create a mural with young people. I am trying to raise $2000 so that I can pay for my plane tickets and expenses while I am there. Your contribution no matter how small, will help to keep these projects alive. Please consider donating.

story:
My name is Eileen Iannone and I am a freshman Honors student at The University of Toledo, majoring in Geography and Planning and minoring in Spanish. The campaign I'm working on is through International Samaritan, an organization that leads volunteer groups, students, and individuals on 7-10 day service trips. The organization serves families living in poverty on the rim of the city dumps in Guatemala, Honduras, Egypt, and other locations. 


I will be traveling to Guatemala, where, according to a Poverty Analysis conducted by Poverty Reduction and Equity, "Approximately 75 percent of the population is estimated to live below the poverty line. . . Almost 58 percent of the population have incomes below the extreme poverty line, which is defined as the amount needed to purchase a basic basket of food."


On my trip I will:

  • Tutor and assist teachers at elementary and nursery schools.

  • Complete physical projects such as cleaning, landscaping and building.

  • Visit ecologically and culturally significant sites.


    This trip will aid me in my experience with Geography and Planning as I experience a new country and help with restructuring its urban landscape. It will also aid me in strengthening my Spanish abilities as I interact with native speakers. 

    Seventy percent of the residents in the Guatemala City garbage dump suffer from illiteracy. I will help change that statistic by working with students at the I.S. schools and nurseries, building classrooms, and teaching English and health. 

    I hope to gain a new outlook on the world around me, a new perspective of my interactions with the poor, and more incentives to help those around me- both at home and afar. 


    “There is no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up.” 

    ― John Holmes

story:
Who Am I?

Hi! I'm Shauna Aura Knight, and for the past years I've traveled the US and Canada teaching leadership, community building, public speaking, ritual facilitation, and personal growth work., but I need help to keep doing this work.

My primary audience has been the Pagan/Earth-centered/Alternative spirituality communities and other artistic and activist groups. Grassroots leaders have a tough job; we step into leadership without a lot of training, and when our groups blow up, we don't know what went wrong. I dream of healthy, vital grassroots groups and Pagan communities. I have worked to make leadership training more broadly available.

My challenge: in following this calling, I've taught for many groups that couldn't afford to pay me much. Often I even paid gas money out of my own pocket to be able to travel and teach without pay. In the past years I've spent more in car repairs than I've ever earned in class fees. This has left me without any financial buffer. 

Recently, my car was totaled in an accident that wasn't my fault, however I won't receive any settlement toward a new car. This has left me without any way to get to the conferences, festivals, and events where I've agreed to teach leadership. 

I'm stuck in a Catch-22. I live in a rural area in order to minimize my expenses so I can focus on writing and teaching. Without a car, I can't get to any of my upcoming teaching engagements. There aren't even viable jobs within walking distance of me. I've sacrificed so many creature comforts in order to bring the leadership work out to the world, but now I need help to continue offering leadership training. 


Raising Funds: 

I'm looking to raise enough money for a car so I can continue to travel and teach leadership. Optimally that's about $6,000, though I could buy a less reliable vehicle for about $2,000.

I have listed more extensive details at the bottom of the page about my specific goals and what work I will do including some cool "stretch" goals if I surpass $5,000. 

While more than 75% of my mileage is from traveling for teaching or running Pagan events in Chicago, having a car also allows me to sell my artwork and bring in other freelance income that will in turn allow me to fund future leadership training work and resources like videos. 

In addition, I hope to raise additional  for my living expenses in order to have the time to finish writing several books on leadership and facilitation, or even create videos and recordings to offer further resources to people who cannot travel to attend leadership classes in person.

You can help me achieve more leadership education. I believe that it is crucial for grassroots groups to have access to leadership and facilitation skills in order to do the work that calls to them. 

Help me keep building stronger leaders and stronger communities.

If you haven't heard of me before and want to know where your money would be going to, you can learn more about me at: http://www.ShaunaAuraKnight.com/about 
or you can read some of my leadership blog posts at  https://shaunaaura.wordpress.com or my environmental and other activism posts at http://paganactivist.com/author/shaunaaura/

You can also take a look at my currently published books. http://www.shaunaauraknight.com/books/


What You Get

I'm offering some cool things in return for your generosity. I certainly welcome donations from folks who have benefited from my writing and leadership training in the past, and those who want others to benefit in the future.

I think one of the cool parts of an Indiegogo campaign is the ability to offer you—my supporters--some tangible, nifty perks that tie into the work that I’ve already done, and that further community building work that I hope to continue doing

Perks Include:

  • MP3 files of chants and guided Trance Journeys, 
  • eBooks and hardcopies of my collected articles and blog posts on Leadership and Ritual Facilitation,
  • Perks also include one-on-one or small-group Skype calls with me to talk through leadership issues,
  • I'll write articles or do a Youtube video on leadership topics of your choice,
  • My own artwork and digital collage images, or having me come to town to paint a mural in your home or even having me build a shrine in your back yard or other installation,
  • Bringing bringing me to town to teach workshops, or even having me help you organize a leadership conference in your area. 

Check out some of my artwork if interested in those perks:
Watercolors: 
http://shaunaknightarts.wordpress.com/fantasy-paintings/
Mythic Mixed Media: 
http://shaunaknightarts.wordpress.com/mythic-mixed-media/
Digital collage Images: https://www.etsy.com/shop/ShaunaAuraKnight

A note about the perks:
Paintings will be given away as perks on a "first come first served" basis, however, if a particular painting is sold, I can either paint another one that is similar, or prints may also be available. 

Items from the digital goodie packs will be available in early March. Physical items such as paintings that I have on hand will be shipped early April at the latest. If your perk includes custom work, that may take longer.

If you choose one of the perks that involve my travel, we will arrange for a time that works best, this year or next year. For any of the perks where I'm traveling out of town, pricing reflects the assumption that I'll be staying in a spare room locally. We'll need to negotiate specifics--for instance, I need to stay in a smoke-free space. Please feel free to contact me with questions if you are thinking about selecting one of these perks. ShaunaAura (at) gmail DOT com. 

*Perks such as the installation art and conference planning do not include things like extensive supply costs or renting venues or paying for other event costs. Contact me if you want to talk shop on your vision and how I can help make that happen for you.

**I reserve the right to turn any of those gigs down based on the creepy factor. It's only happened once or twice, but I have had people that hit high on my creepy scale invite me to stay with them and teach and I've had to say no.

The Impact

We need healthier communities. Whatever your spiritual background, whatever your particular interests...you are doing work that matters, and I want to help you grow stronger, healthier groups.

Sometimes leaders need help figuring out group dynamics, or be a better public speaker, or how to facilitate a workshop or a ritual. There are so many challenges to small group leadership and most volunteer leaders can't afford to spend the time and the money to take college-level leadership classes or attend expensive seminars. For that matter, most leadership classes don't address the special needs of grassroots groups. 

I want to help more communities succeed. I want to see us change the world, build a healthier, beautiful world of cooperation and connection. I've seen the positive impact of my leadership work when I travel and teach and I want to help grow more leaders and more teachers.

Let me help you build stronger communities.


Other Ways You Can Help

Money is tight for many folks, and I of all people get that. There are lots of cool fundraisers I'd love to donate to myself! I want to let you know that truly, $1 or $5 really does make a difference. 

However, other ways you can help include getting the word out about this campaign. with Indiegogo's sharing tools, or you can:

  • Post a link to this campaign on your Facebook wall
  • Post a link on your Twitter 
  • Mention this fundraiser to friends in person.
  • Mention this fundraiser on a Yahoo group or Meetup group you are a part of
  • Do a blog post about this campaign
  • Share one of my leadership blog posts on your Facebook, Twitter, or blog, with a link to my campaign. https://shaunaaura.wordpress.com

Here's a Twitter post you can copy and paste:
Help @Shauna_A_Knight raise money to offer more leadership, facilitation, and community building education http://bit.ly/1fjFejs

If you'd like to find other creative ways to help, please contact me at ShaunaAura (at) gmail DOT com.

Collaboration: You can also collaborate with other members of your local community to raise money toward the larger goals, such as bringing me in to teach leadership. I know of several communities that were planning to host a bake sale to help bring me to their area to teach leadership classes.

Books: You can also buy or post links to my already published books, or recommend my books to your friends. http://www.shaunaauraknight.com/books/ 

I make about $1 per book sale on any book where I'm the sole author, and word-of-mouth is how most people learn about new books. It might sound silly, but more book sales in the coming months would make a big difference in what kind of car I can buy.


What Will I Use The Money For?

This depends on how much I raise. Optimally, I’d like to raise about $5-$6,000 for a reliable used Dodge Grand Caravan. It's a car that fits all of my event supplies, it gets good mileage, and it's also the car that kept me alive in an accident that the police say should have put me into the hospital. 

When I drive long distances alone, it’s nice to know that my car is going to keep me safe and not break down during a trip. I've been there, I've done that. If you want, I'll tell the story via a Youtube video :D

I can buy an ok car for as little as $2,000-$3,000, it’s just that that car is likely to rack up more in car repairs more quickly, but at least I’ll have a vehicle.

If I raise enough money, I plan to use about $1,000-$2000 to cover some of my living expenses for the next months so that I can finish up several of the books on leadership and ritual facilitation that I am close to finishing. 

Stretch Goals

I'm nothing if not a dreamer, and this is the fun part for me. I'm always thinking up cool ideas for what I could do if I had the time and the money. All of these projects are things that are on the horizon for me, but here are some projects I'll commit to doing if we zoom past $5,000 together. 

If we make: 

$6,000:
I’ll write a series of blog posts based upon topics suggested by you folks who become backers. You’ll get to vote on what I write about.

$7,000:
I’ll create a Youtube video or series of shorter videos on the topic of your choice. Backers will get to vote on what I do the video on. The video will be available for free download as a community resource, so I’m thinking topics like leadership or ritual arts. But, I’ll read the phone book or play didgeridoo on a pool noodle if you want. (No really, I’ve done it, it’s my only party trick.)

$8,000: 
I’ll record a whole bunch of chants that I regularly use in ritual and make them available for a free download on my site so that it's easier to learn them. Some of these chants I’ll have to check in with their copyright holders, others I already have permission to do this.

$9,000:
I'll set things on Fire. Really. I’ll replicate some of the “ritual leader setting things on fire” accidents I’ve either been personally responsible for, or witnessed others doing. I’ll film these in a safe environment and post them on Youtube for educational purposes to first understand 1. How the fire accident happened, and 2. How to prevent them, 3. How to put the fire out once it happens, and 4. Some tips on how to recover as a facilitator and re-center the group to move forward with the ritual after the fire is out.

$10,000:
Wow. If we hit 10K on this fundraiser, I’ll have the time to do something pretty cool. I’ll organize a Pagan leadership conference in Chicago (or the nearby Midwest) that will have registrations available on a sliding scale (ie, no one turned away for lack of funds) so that people, regardless of income, can better afford to attend. 

Backers will have the opportunity to attend some kind of VIP party or have access to a VIP package at the event. In fact, if we reach this fundraising goal, the backers can vote on what kind of a VIP package you’re interested in, or what presenters (and maybe musicians) you’d like to see at this event.


What Do I Dream Of?

Beyond all of that, here are some projects I’m working on (or would like to devote time to) that become far easier for me to do if I meet or exceed my funding goals:

  • A series of books on facilitating rituals
  • A series of books on Pagan leadership
  • Videos that go along with the books to make training accessible to people who can’t travel or pay to attend workshops
  • My ability to travel and teach to even more places to offer education that many  Pagans don’t have access to

Thank you for your assistance in helping me build my dream of healthier and more effective communities. 

And good luck to you in the work that you are doing, whatever your community, whatever your calling.
story_txt:
Who Am I?Hi! I'm Shauna Aura Knight, and for the past years I've traveled the US and Canada teaching leadership, community building, public speaking, ritual facilitation, and personal growth work., but I need help to keep doing this work.My primary audience has been the Pagan/Earth-centered/Alternative spirituality communities and other artistic and activist groups. Grassroots leaders have a tough job; we step into leadership without a lot of training, and when our groups blow up, we don't know what went wrong. I dream of healthy, vital grassroots groups and Pagan communities. I have worked to make leadership training more broadly available.My challenge: in following this calling, I've taught for many groups that couldn't afford to pay me much. Often I even paid gas money out of my own pocket to be able to travel and teach without pay. In the past years I've spent more in car repairs than I've ever earned in class fees. This has left me without any financial buffer. Recently, my car was totaled in an accident that wasn't my fault, however I won't receive any settlement toward a new car. This has left me without any way to get to the conferences, festivals, and events where I've agreed to teach leadership. I'm stuck in a Catch-22. I live in a rural area in order to minimize my expenses so I can focus on writing and teaching. Without a car, I can't get to any of my upcoming teaching engagements. There aren't even viable jobs within walking distance of me. I've sacrificed so many creature comforts in order to bring the leadership work out to the world, but now I need help to continue offering leadership training. 
Raising Funds: I'm looking to raise enough money for a car so I can continue to travel and teach leadership. Optimally that's about $6,000, though I could buy a less reliable vehicle for about $2,000.I have listed more extensive details at the bottom of the page about my specific goals and what work I will do including some cool "stretch" goals if I surpass $5,000. While more than 75% of my mileage is from traveling for teaching or running Pagan events in Chicago, having a car also allows me to sell my artwork and bring in other freelance income that will in turn allow me to fund future leadership training work and resources like videos. In addition, I hope to raise additional  for my living expenses in order to have the time to finish writing several books on leadership and facilitation, or even create videos and recordings to offer further resources to people who cannot travel to attend leadership classes in person.You can help me achieve more leadership education. I believe that it is crucial for grassroots groups to have access to leadership and facilitation skills in order to do the work that calls to them. Help me keep building stronger leaders and stronger communities.If you haven't heard of me before and want to know where your money would be going to, you can learn more about me at: http://www.ShaunaAuraKnight.com/about or you can read some of my leadership blog posts at  https://shaunaaura.wordpress.com or my environmental and other activism posts at http://paganactivist.com/author/shaunaaura/You can also take a look at my currently published books. http://www.shaunaauraknight.com/books/
What You GetI'm offering some cool things in return for your generosity. I certainly welcome donations from folks who have benefited from my writing and leadership training in the past, and those who want others to benefit in the future.I think one of the cool parts of an Indiegogo campaign is the ability to offer you—my supporters--some tangible, nifty perks that tie into the work that I’ve already done, and that further community building work that I hope to continue doingPerks Include:
MP3 files of chants and guided Trance Journeys, 
eBooks and hardcopies of my collected articles and blog posts on Leadership and Ritual Facilitation,
Perks also include one-on-one or small-group Skype calls with me to talk through leadership issues,
I'll write articles or do a Youtube video on leadership topics of your choice,
My own artwork and digital collage images, or having me come to town to paint a mural in your home or even having me build a shrine in your back yard or other installation,
Bringing bringing me to town to teach workshops, or even having me help you organize a leadership conference in your area. 
Check out some of my artwork if interested in those perks:Watercolors: http://shaunaknightarts.wordpress.com/fantasy-paintings/Mythic Mixed Media: http://shaunaknightarts.wordpress.com/mythic-mixed-media/Digital collage Images: https://www.etsy.com/shop/ShaunaAuraKnightA note about the perks:Paintings will be given away as perks on a "first come first served" basis, however, if a particular painting is sold, I can either paint another one that is similar, or prints may also be available. Items from the digital goodie packs will be available in early March. Physical items such as paintings that I have on hand will be shipped early April at the latest. If your perk includes custom work, that may take longer.If you choose one of the perks that involve my travel, we will arrange for a time that works best, this year or next year. For any of the perks where I'm traveling out of town, pricing reflects the assumption that I'll be staying in a spare room locally. We'll need to negotiate specifics--for instance, I need to stay in a smoke-free space. Please feel free to contact me with questions if you are thinking about selecting one of these perks. ShaunaAura (at) gmail DOT com. *Perks such as the installation art and conference planning do not include things like extensive supply costs or renting venues or paying for other event costs. Contact me if you want to talk shop on your vision and how I can help make that happen for you.**I reserve the right to turn any of those gigs down based on the creepy factor. It's only happened once or twice, but I have had people that hit high on my creepy scale invite me to stay with them and teach and I've had to say no.The ImpactWe need healthier communities. Whatever your spiritual background, whatever your particular interests...you are doing work that matters, and I want to help you grow stronger, healthier groups. Sometimes leaders need help figuring out group dynamics, or be a better public speaker, or how to facilitate a workshop or a ritual. There are so many challenges to small group leadership and most volunteer leaders can't afford to spend the time and the money to take college-level leadership classes or attend expensive seminars. For that matter, most leadership classes don't address the special needs of grassroots groups. I want to help more communities succeed. I want to see us change the world, build a healthier, beautiful world of cooperation and connection. I've seen the positive impact of my leadership work when I travel and teach and I want to help grow more leaders and more teachers.Let me help you build stronger communities.Other Ways You Can HelpMoney is tight for many folks, and I of all people get that. There are lots of cool fundraisers I'd love to donate to myself! I want to let you know that truly, $1 or $5 really does make a difference. However, other ways you can help include getting the word out about this campaign. with Indiegogo's sharing tools, or you can:

Post a link to this campaign on your Facebook wall

Post a link on your Twitter 
Mention this fundraiser to friends in person.
Mention this fundraiser on a Yahoo group or Meetup group you are a part of
Do a blog post about this campaign
Share one of my leadership blog posts on your Facebook, Twitter, or blog, with a link to my campaign. https://shaunaaura.wordpress.com
Here's a Twitter post you can copy and paste:Help @Shauna_A_Knight raise money to offer more leadership, facilitation, and community building education http://bit.ly/1fjFejsIf you'd like to find other creative ways to help, please contact me at ShaunaAura (at) gmail DOT com.Collaboration: You can also collaborate with other members of your local community to raise money toward the larger goals, such as bringing me in to teach leadership. I know of several communities that were planning to host a bake sale to help bring me to their area to teach leadership classes.Books: You can also buy or post links to my already published books, or recommend my books to your friends. http://www.shaunaauraknight.com/books/ I make about $1 per book sale on any book where I'm the sole author, and word-of-mouth is how most people learn about new books. It might sound silly, but more book sales in the coming months would make a big difference in what kind of car I can buy.What Will I Use The Money For?This depends on how much I raise. Optimally, I’d like to raise about
$5-$6,000 for a reliable used Dodge Grand Caravan. It's a car that fits all of my event supplies, it gets good mileage, and it's also the car that kept me alive in an accident that the police say should have put me into the hospital. When I drive long distances
alone, it’s nice to know that my car is going to keep me safe and not break down during a trip. I've been there, I've done that. If you want, I'll tell the story via a Youtube video :DI can
buy an ok car for as little as $2,000-$3,000, it’s just that that car is likely
to rack up more in car repairs more quickly, but at least I’ll have a vehicle.
If I raise enough money, I plan to use about $1,000-$2000 to cover some of my living expenses for the next months so that I can finish up several of the books on leadership and ritual facilitation that I am close to finishing. Stretch GoalsI'm nothing if not a dreamer, and this is the fun part for me. I'm always thinking up cool ideas for what I could do if I had the time and the money. All of these projects are things that are on the horizon for me, but here are some projects I'll commit to doing if we zoom past $5,000 together. 
If we make: $6,000:
I’ll write a series of blog posts based upon topics suggested by you folks who become backers. You’ll
get to vote on what I write about.
$7,000:I’ll create a Youtube video or series of shorter videos on the topic of your
choice. Backers will get to vote on what I do the video on. The video will be
available for free download as a community resource, so I’m thinking topics
like leadership or ritual arts. But, I’ll read the phone book or play
didgeridoo on a pool noodle if you want. (No really, I’ve done it, it’s my only
party trick.)
$8,000: I’ll record a whole bunch of chants that I regularly use in ritual and make
them available for a free download on my site so that it's easier to learn them. Some of these chants I’ll have to check in
with their copyright holders, others I already have permission to do this.
$9,000:I'll set things on Fire. Really. I’ll replicate some of the “ritual leader setting things on fire” accidents I’ve
either been personally responsible for, or witnessed others doing. I’ll film
these in a safe environment and post them on Youtube for educational purposes
to first understand 1. How the fire accident happened, and 2. How to prevent
them, 3. How to put the fire out once it happens, and 4. Some tips on how to
recover as a facilitator and re-center the group to move forward with the
ritual after the fire is out.
$10,000:Wow. If we hit 10K on this fundraiser, I’ll have the time to do something pretty cool. I’ll
organize a Pagan leadership conference in Chicago (or the nearby Midwest) that
will have registrations available on a sliding scale (ie, no one turned away
for lack of funds) so that people, regardless of income, can better afford to
attend. Backers will have the opportunity to attend some kind of VIP
party or have access to a VIP package at the event. In fact, if we reach this
fundraising goal, the backers can vote on what kind of a VIP package you’re
interested in, or what presenters (and maybe musicians) you’d like to see at
this event.What Do I Dream Of?Beyond
all of that, here are some projects I’m working on (or would like to devote time to)
that become far easier for me to do if I meet or exceed my funding goals:


A
series of books on facilitating rituals


A
series of books on Pagan leadership


Videos
that go along with the books to make training accessible to people who can’t travel
or pay to attend workshops


My
ability to travel and teach to even more places to offer education that
many  Pagans don’t have access to

Thank you for your assistance in helping me build my dream of healthier and more effective communities. And good luck to you in the work that you are doing, whatever your community, whatever your calling.

story:
Hey San Diego! Our girls need role models, and there are so many in and from Southeast San Diego that go unrecognized!

We, as a group of young ladies born and raised in Southeast San Diego, recognize this issue and, as a result, are excited to launch LikeHER! LikeHER is a book that highlights the stories of ~20 African-American women from Southeast San Diego – stories of women who have done great things and who have maintained a heart for their community.

Our aim is to achieve the following through the book:

  • Build the self-esteem of young African-American women in Southeast San Diego
  • Recognize women who often go unrecognized
  • Show the world that Southeast San Diego produces extraordinary and smart women who are grounded and care about their community

The LikeHER book supports the efforts of our organization, DETOUR Empowers; specifically the event highlighted in the video, the FANCY Teen Girls Expo.


A snapshot of some of the AMAZING women featured in the book:




  • Graphic Design
  • 250 copies of the book for the ladies profiled, and for teen girls in the community
  • Celebration lunch for the ladies profiled in the book
  • Publicity campaign (video, social media blitz)
  • Support other DETOUR Empowers events/projects


DETOUR uplifts, motivates, and inspires women and girls through education, empowerment, and entertainment. DETOUR provides a positive forum for women and girls to become actively engaged in working towards acquiring the skills necessary to become what they aspire to be and to achieve their dreams.

The goal of the organization is to encourage living a fulfilled positive lifestyle, while promoting the revitalization of self-esteem and self-perception. Our message is it is never too late to reposition yourself to passionately seek and fulfill your purpose!

DETOUR was worked in Southeast San Diego for over 4 years and holds an annual Expo for teen girls that will be held at O’Farrell middle school this spring.

story:
Versión en Inglés

Resumen en Español

La historia de la Astronomía en México es tan antigua como la historia del país. En 1847, cuando México era una nación nueva, recién liberado del gobierno español, surgió el primer intento de establecer un observatorio moderno. Sin embargo, este observatorio fue destruido por un bombardeo del ejercito de los Estados Unidos durante la intervención estadounidense en México. Esto, afortunadamente, hizo poco por desmotivar el interés de la gente mexicana por la Astronomía.

Posteriormente en 1867 con la colaboración de Francisco Díaz Covarrubias (1833-1889); geógrafo, ingeniero, conocido científico y educador, se dio el establecimiento de un modesto observatorio en el techo del Palacio Nacional. Así, la Astronomía en México comienza a ganar impulso y en 1874 México participa en la observación del “Tránsito de Venus” en Japón.

México contribuyó con precisas observaciones que fueron utilizadas para establecer la distancia entre el Sol y la Tierra y las dimensiones del Sistema Solar, el éxito de este evento fue tal que motivó la creación del Anuario Astronómico Nacional en 1881. Y es en 1902 que un nuevo capítulo de la historia astronómica fue abierto y la Sociedad Astronómica de México fue fundada. Desde entonces, la Sociedad ha motivado a muchas personas a acercarse a la ciencia a través de la divulgación de la Astronomía. Con el pasar de los años la SAM creció en tamaño e importancia, a tal grado que logró tener tres importantes edificios. Los cuales incluyeron el primer planetario de América latina, un importante Observatorio Astronómico en Chapa de México (estado de México); la SAM llegó a tener cerca de mil socios activos.

Edificio principal donde se encuentra el primer planetario de México.

Sin embargo, en los últimos 20 años debido a las diversas crisis económicas en México y el Mundo, y junto con una pobre administración, la Sociedad perdió fuerza y casi desaparece. Sus instalaciones fueron dañadas por el paso del tiempo hasta el grado de no ser funcionales (aún así la SAM no ha cerrado sus puertas por completo).

Años sin mantenimiento, este es el estado del interior del edificio.

Hace un par de años, los socios de la SAM empezaron a trabajar activamente para revivirla y lograr que su objetivo principal se siga cumpliendo: divulgar la Astronomía, Ciencia y Tecnología. Por eso, la meta actual, es poder restaurar por completo nuestro planetario y volverlo sustentable y funcional de nuevo.

Imagen del planetario Spitz en los ochentas.

¡Qué necesitamos y como utilizaremos el dinero!

Actualmente la SAM no cuenta con ningún tipo de apoyo económico ni financiamiento. El poco dinero que obtiene es por la contribución de los miembros y de los varios cursos y talleres que organiza. Este dinero es apenas suficiente para pagar los gastos básicos y definitivamente no es suficiente para restaurar nuestro planetario. Este planetario es el más antiguo de México y el primero de Latino América, tiene un significado importante y hoy día está prácticamente desmantelado. Los donativos que recibamos serán utilizados para reconstruir y equipar el planetario, UN PLANETARIO que nos pertenezca a todos. Las tareas específicas a realizar son:

-  Comprar e instalar el piso.

-  Comprar e instalar aislamiento acústico en las paredes.

-  Adquirir asientos reclinables para el planetario.

-  Arreglar el domo.

-  Instalar equipo de audio.

-  Comprar e instalar un nuevo proyector digital.

El proyector digital será utilizado en conjunto con el proyector antiguo, el cual sigue trabajando y en muy buenas condiciones. La reconstrucción de este planetario es muy importante, no tan solo para la SAM, sino también para promocionar ampliamente la ciencia y cultura en México.

Estado actual del Planetario y de su Domo.

El Impacto de tu contribución

Hoy día existen pocos planetarios con infraestructura moderna y abiertos al público general que trabajen en México, mismos que no son ni cercanamente suficientes para dar servicio ni siquiera a la población de la Ciudad de México. La reapertura de nuestro planetario permitirá a muchas más personas acercarse a la Astronomía, Ciencia y Cultura en general. Uno de nuestros propósitos y compromisos que tendrá un fuerte impacto, es que una vez abierto el planetario, la SAM ofrecerá funciones gratuitas a todas las escuelas interesadas que lo soliciten.

Otras Maneras en las que Puedes Ayudar

La SAM agradecerá cualquier tipo de ayuda sin importar de quien proceda. Puede ser trabajo voluntario, ayuda dando cursos o pláticas, o simplemente promoviendo y compartiendo esta iniciativa a través de su red social favorita. No dude en contactarnos si está interesado en alguna forma alternativa de ayudar a esta noble causa.

Retribuciones:


Donativo
(dólares)

Gratficación

Descripción

$1.00

¡GRACIAS!

¡Tantas GRACIAS como estrellas en el cielo! Recibirás nuestro agradecimiento y tu ayuda sera reconocida en nuestro sitio de internet y redes sociales.

$5.00

Tu cumpleaños en el cielo.

Con tu fecha y lugar de nacimiento, nosotros te enviaremos un mapa celeste que muestre las estrellas justo como se veían en ese lugar y fecha precisas. Un excelente regalo para todos aquellos que quieren conocer su verdadero signo zodiacal.

$10.00

Triple cumpleaños en el cielo.

Recibirás dos mapas celestes extra con las fechas y lugares de tu elección. Perfecto para compartirlo con tus familiares y amigos.

$20.00

Tu cumpleaños en el cielo comentado.

Te mandaremos tu mapa celeste comentado por un astrónomo professional remarcando los objetos astronómicos, constelaciones, y los hechos y sucesos interesantes.

$40.00

Luz solar en tu bolsillo.

Todo lo anterior, más uno de nuestros tres relojes de sol diseñados en la sociedad y cortados con laser. Estos marcadores del tiempo seran diseñados especialmente y te reconocerán como un promotor de la ciencia y la educación.

$60.00

Triple luz solar en tu bolsillo.

Dos relojes de sol más y únicos serán a tu lista de regalos. El major accesorio para los amantes de la ciencia y los geeks. Arma tu colección. Hechos a mano en la Sociedad Astronómica.

$100.00

Mapa celeste enmarcado.

Todo lo anterior con tu mapa celeste bellamente enmarcado y certificado por la SAM. Una gran pieza para platicar e indispensable para los amantes de la Astronomía.

$250.00

Una noche de las estrellas.

Esto incluye una noche de las estrellas con telescopio y una función de planetario en nuestras instalaciones de la Ciudad de México para 40 personas afortunadas.

$500.00

¡Placa conmemorativa!

Tu nombre sera incluído en una placa conmemortativa que permanecerá permanentemente dentro del planetario y revelada por el Presidente de la Sociedad durante la ceremonia de inauguración. Serás un invitado de honor a este evento y serás recordado por las futuras generaciones como promotor de la ciencia.

$1000.00

Membresía de por vida.

Disfrutarás de los beneficios de ser socio honorario de por vida en la Sociedad Astronómica de México. Una verdadera inversion para un contribuidor serio.

$10000.00

Tu nombre al Planetario.

El Planetario será inaugurado llevando tu nombre durante cinco años. Esta oportunidad única en la vida sera para un solo afortunado.


¡Ejemplo simplificado de tu Mapa Celeste!

¿Sabías que desde la invención de los signos zodiacales hace más de 3000 años, el cielo ha cambiado y los signos zodiacales tradicionales no corresponden a los actuales? Les dejamos un ejemplo de lo que será la retribución para los que donen en nuestro Proyecto para revivivir el Planetario de la SAM.

Nuestros relojitos de Sol exclusivos para esta campaña:




Resumen en Inglés

Short Summary

The History of Astronomy in Mexico is as old as the history of the country. In 1847, with Mexico freshly liberated from the Spanish government, the first attempt to establish a modern observatory was made, this observatory was later destroyed by the bombing of the united states army during the mexican-american war. This, however, did little to discourage the interest of the Mexican people in astronomy.

During 1867 with the collaboration of Francisco Díaz Covarrubias (1833-1889); geographical engineer and reknown scientist and educator, the establishment of a modest observatory on the roof of the National Palace was made possible. Astronomy in Mexico started to gain momentum and in 1874 Mexico participated in the observation of the "Transit of Venus" in Japan.

Mexico contributed with precise observations that were used to establish the Sun-Earth distance and the dimensions of the solar system, the success of this event led to the creation of the Mexican Observatory Yearbook, published yearly since 1881. In 1902 a new chapter in the astronomical history of the country was opened and the Astronomical Society of Mexico (SAM due to its name in spanish: Sociedad Astronómica de México) was founded. Since then, the society has motivated many people to get closer to science through the divulgation of astronomy. Throughout the years the astronomical society grew both in size and importance, to a point where it had control over three important buildings, which included the first planetarium in latin america, an important astronomical observatory in Chapa de Mota (Estado de México) and close to 1000 active members.

Main building of SAM, inside the first planetarium in Mexico

However, during the last 20 years, various economic crises in Mexico and the world and with very poor management the society lost strength and almost fell apart. Its facilities were damaged by the passing of time until they were not fully functional anymore (even through all this, the SAM has never closed it's doors completely).

Years without maintenance this is the state of the interior of the building

Until a couple of years ago, when new SAM members started to actively work on reviving and getting the society to fulfill its primary objective again: to divulge astronomy, science and technology. The goal now, is to be able to fully restore our planetarium and thus become self sustained and functional again.

Image showing the planetary Spitz later in the 80s

Perks for your contribution

What We Need and How the Money will be Used

Currently, the SAM does not have economic aid or funding of any sort. The little money there is comes from member contributions and from the various courses and workshops organized by the society. It is barely enough to pay the bills and definitely not enough to restore our planetarium. This planetarium is the oldest in Mexico and the first in Latin America, it has an important historical significance and yet it is practically dismantled. The donations we receive will be used to build and equip the planetarium, a planetarium that will belong to all of us. The specific tasks to be performed are:

- Purchase and install the floor.

- Buy and install acoustic insulation for the walls.

- Acquire reclining seats for the planetarium.

- Fix the dome.

- Install audio equipment.

- Buy and install a new digital projector.

The digital projector will be used in conjunction with the old mechanical projector, which is still working and in very good conditions. Rebuilding this planetarium is very important, not only for the society, but for the widespread promotion of science and culture in Mexico.

Current status of the planetarium and dome

The Impact of Your Contribution

Currently there are a few working planetariums in Mexico with modern infrastructure and open to the public, but they are not nearly enough to service the large population of the city, much less of the country. The reopening of our planetarium will allow a lot more people to get closer to astronomy, science and culture in general. One of our objectives and commitments that will have a strong impact, is that once the planetarium is restored, the SAM will be open for free planetarium programs to all interested schools.

Other Ways You Can Help

We will welcome any possible help coming from anyone. Whether it's voluntary work, helping us with lectures or courses or just by promoting and sharing this initiative through your favourite social network! Don't hesitate in contacting us if you are interested in alternative ways of providing help to this noble cause.

As seen on (como lo viste en):
