Sin embargo,
en los últimos 20 años debido a las diversas crisis económicas en México y el
Mundo, y junto con una pobre administración, la Sociedad perdió fuerza y casi
desaparece. Sus instalaciones fueron dañadas por el paso del tiempo hasta el
grado de no ser funcionales (aún así la SAM no ha cerrado sus puertas por
completo).Años sin mantenimiento, este es el estado del interior del edificio.
Hace un par
de años, los socios de la SAM empezaron a trabajar activamente para revivirla y
lograr que su objetivo principal se siga cumpliendo: divulgar la Astronomía,
Ciencia y Tecnología. Por eso, la meta actual, es poder restaurar por completo
nuestro planetario y volverlo sustentable y funcional de nuevo.Imagen del planetario Spitz en los ochentas.

¡Qué necesitamos y como utilizaremos el dinero! 
Actualmente
la SAM no cuenta con ningún tipo de apoyo económico ni financiamiento. El poco
dinero que obtiene es por la contribución de los miembros y de los varios cursos
y talleres que organiza. Este dinero es apenas suficiente para pagar los gastos
básicos y definitivamente no es suficiente para restaurar nuestro planetario.
Este planetario es el más antiguo de México y el primero de Latino América,
tiene un significado importante y hoy día está prácticamente desmantelado. Los
donativos que recibamos serán utilizados para reconstruir y equipar el
planetario, UN PLANETARIO que nos pertenezca a todos. Las tareas específicas a
realizar son:
- 
Comprar e instalar el piso.
- 
Comprar e instalar aislamiento acústico en las paredes.
- 
Adquirir asientos reclinables para el planetario.
- 
Arreglar el domo.
- 
Instalar equipo de audio.
- 
Comprar e instalar un nuevo proyector digital.
El proyector
digital será utilizado en conjunto con el proyector antiguo, el cual sigue
trabajando y en muy buenas condiciones. La reconstrucción de este planetario es
muy importante, no tan solo para la SAM, sino también para promocionar
ampliamente la ciencia y cultura en México.
Estado actual del Planetario y de su Domo.

El
Impacto de tu contribución
Hoy día
existen pocos planetarios con infraestructura moderna y abiertos al público
general que trabajen en México, mismos que no son ni cercanamente suficientes
para dar servicio ni siquiera a la población de la Ciudad de México. La
reapertura de nuestro planetario permitirá a muchas más personas acercarse a la
Astronomía, Ciencia y Cultura en general. Uno de nuestros propósitos y
compromisos que tendrá un fuerte impacto, es que una vez abierto el planetario,
la SAM ofrecerá funciones gratuitas a todas las escuelas interesadas que lo
soliciten.
Otras
Maneras en las que Puedes Ayudar
La SAM
agradecerá cualquier tipo de ayuda sin importar de quien proceda. Puede ser
trabajo voluntario, ayuda dando cursos o pláticas, o simplemente promoviendo y
compartiendo esta iniciativa a través de su red social favorita. No dude en
contactarnos si está interesado en alguna forma alternativa de ayudar a esta
noble causa.Retribuciones:



Donativo(dólares)



Gratficación



Descripción





$1.00


¡GRACIAS!


¡Tantas
  GRACIAS como estrellas en el cielo! Recibirás nuestro agradecimiento y tu
  ayuda sera reconocida en nuestro sitio de internet y redes sociales.




$5.00


Tu cumpleaños en el cielo.


Con tu
  fecha y lugar de nacimiento, nosotros te enviaremos un mapa celeste que
  muestre las estrellas justo como se veían en ese lugar y fecha precisas. Un
  excelente regalo para todos aquellos que quieren conocer su verdadero signo
  zodiacal.




$10.00


Triple cumpleaños en el cielo.


Recibirás
  dos mapas celestes extra con las fechas y lugares de tu elección. Perfecto
  para compartirlo con tus familiares y amigos.




$20.00


Tu cumpleaños en el cielo comentado.


Te
  mandaremos tu mapa celeste comentado por un astrónomo professional remarcando
  los objetos astronómicos, constelaciones, y los hechos y sucesos
  interesantes.




$40.00


Luz solar en tu bolsillo.


Todo lo
  anterior, más uno de nuestros tres relojes de sol diseñados en la sociedad y
  cortados con laser. Estos marcadores del tiempo seran diseñados especialmente
  y te reconocerán como un promotor de la ciencia y la educación.




$60.00


Triple luz solar en tu bolsillo.


Dos
  relojes de sol más y únicos serán a tu lista de regalos. El major accesorio
  para los amantes de la ciencia y los geeks. Arma tu colección. Hechos a mano
  en la Sociedad Astronómica.




$100.00


Mapa celeste enmarcado.


Todo lo
  anterior con tu mapa celeste bellamente enmarcado y certificado por la SAM. Una
  gran pieza para platicar e indispensable para los amantes de la Astronomía.




$250.00


Una noche de las estrellas.


Esto
  incluye una noche de las estrellas con telescopio y una función de planetario
  en nuestras instalaciones de la Ciudad de México para 40 personas afortunadas.




$500.00


¡Placa conmemorativa!


Tu nombre sera
  incluído en una placa conmemortativa que permanecerá permanentemente dentro
  del planetario y revelada por el Presidente de la Sociedad durante la ceremonia
  de inauguración. Serás un invitado de honor a este
  evento y serás recordado por las futuras generaciones como promotor de la
  ciencia.




$1000.00


Membresía de por vida.


Disfrutarás
  de los beneficios de ser socio honorario de por vida en la Sociedad Astronómica
  de México. Una verdadera inversion para un contribuidor serio.




$10000.00


Tu nombre al Planetario.


El
  Planetario será inaugurado llevando tu nombre durante cinco años. Esta
  oportunidad única en la vida sera para un solo afortunado.


¡Ejemplo simplificado de tu Mapa Celeste!¿Sabías
 que desde la invención de los signos zodiacales hace más de 3000 años, 
el cielo ha cambiado y los signos zodiacales tradicionales no 
corresponden a los actuales? Les dejamos un ejemplo de lo que será la 
retribución para los que donen en nuestro Proyecto para revivivir el 
Planetario de la SAM.Nuestros relojitos de Sol exclusivos para esta campaña:


Resumen en Inglés


Short SummaryThe History of Astronomy in Mexico is as old as the history of the country. In 1847, with Mexico freshly liberated from the Spanish government, the first attempt to establish a modern observatory was made, this observatory was later destroyed by the bombing of the united states army during the mexican-american war. This, however, did little to discourage the interest of the Mexican people in astronomy.During 1867 with the collaboration of Francisco Díaz Covarrubias (1833-1889); geographical engineer and reknown scientist and educator, the establishment of a modest observatory on the roof of the National Palace was made possible. Astronomy in Mexico started to gain momentum and in 1874 Mexico participated in the observation of the "Transit of Venus" in Japan.Mexico contributed with precise observations that were used to establish the Sun-Earth distance and the dimensions of the solar system, the success of this event led to the creation of the Mexican Observatory Yearbook, published yearly since 1881. In 1902 a new chapter in the astronomical history of the country was opened and the Astronomical Society of Mexico (SAM due to its name in spanish: Sociedad Astronómica de México) was founded. Since then, the society has motivated many people to get closer to science through the divulgation of astronomy. Throughout the years the astronomical society grew both in size and importance, to a point where it had control over three important buildings, which included the first planetarium in latin america, an important astronomical observatory in Chapa de Mota (Estado de México) and close to 1000 active members.Main building of SAM, inside the first planetarium in MexicoHowever, during the last 20 years, various economic crises in Mexico and the world and with very poor management the society lost strength and almost fell apart. Its facilities were damaged by the passing of time until they were not fully functional anymore (even through all this, the SAM has never closed it's doors completely).Years without maintenance this is the state of the interior of the buildingUntil a couple of years ago, when new SAM members started to actively work on reviving and getting the society to fulfill its primary objective again: to divulge  astronomy, science and technology. The goal now, is to be able to fully restore our planetarium and thus become self sustained and functional again.Image showing the planetary Spitz later in the 80s
Perks for your contribution


What We Need and How the Money will be UsedCurrently, the SAM does not have economic aid or funding of any sort. The
little money there is comes from member contributions and from the
 various courses and workshops organized by the society. It is barely enough to pay the bills and definitely not enough to restore our
 planetarium. This planetarium is the oldest in Mexico and the first in Latin America, it has an important historical significance and yet it is practically dismantled. The donations we receive will be used to build and equip the planetarium, a planetarium that will belong to all of us. The specific tasks to be performed are:- Purchase and install the floor.- Buy and install acoustic insulation for the walls.- Acquire reclining seats for the planetarium.- Fix the dome.- Install audio equipment.- Buy and install a new digital projector.The digital projector will be used in conjunction with the old mechanical projector, which is still working and in very good conditions. Rebuilding this planetarium is very important, not only for the society, but for the widespread promotion of science and culture in Mexico.Current status of the planetarium and dome
The Impact of Your ContributionCurrently there are a few working planetariums in Mexico with modern infrastructure and open to the public, but they are not nearly enough to service the large population of the city, much less of the country. The reopening of our planetarium will allow a lot more people to get closer to astronomy, science and culture in general. One of our objectives and commitments that will have a strong impact, is that once the planetarium is restored, the SAM will be open for free planetarium programs to all interested schools.
Other Ways You Can HelpWe will welcome any possible help coming from anyone. Whether it's voluntary work, helping us with lectures or courses or just by promoting and sharing this initiative through your favourite social network! Don't hesitate in contacting us if you are interested in alternative ways of providing help to this noble cause.As seen on (como lo viste en):

story:
Who is Ivan and what is Practice MBA?

I'm a former management consultant, Wharton MBA grad, and, before that, a decidedly "non-traditional" MBA candidate (I majored in History in college, worked for a molecular medicine journal, a software services start-up, and for GE Litigation and Legal Policy prior to business school).

Before starting this new venture, I served as Director of Career Development at the Yale School of Management and as a Sr. Associate Director at The Wharton School -- coaching MBAs to achieve their academic, professional, and extracurricular goals.

Throughout these experiences, I've been keenly aware of the steep learning curve and immense hurdles that must be overcome by MBAs who are from non-business backgrounds, and/or who are traveling thousands of miles from home to enroll in business school.

I created Practice MBA (PMBA) to offer an intensive, pre-MBA educational program -- a summer school 'boot camp' focusing on academic skills, career development, personal effectiveness, and culture and language transition -- that is intended to reduce the disparities among rising MBAs and enable non-traditional and international students alike to start business school on an equal footing with their most commercially-experienced, domestic MBA peers. 

Last summer, we conducted a pilot program for a handful of students now enrolled at Chicago Booth, Columbia Business School, Michigan Ross, Minnesota Carlson, and Harvard Business School. We would like to expand our program this year to accommodate more students who have been admitted to leading business schools in North America and Europe. We need your help to continue to develop our program!!

Why is this important?

Business schools today have a broad social mandate to develop leaders who will achieve positive impact for both business and society.

Schools therefore admit not only students with traditional pre-MBA backgrounds such as finance or consulting, but students who are increasingly from non-business careers -- including military service, professional sports, the creative arts, nonprofit management, teaching, journalism, medicine, and law -- as well as students who are coming to the U.S. or Western Europe from the emerging economies of Africa, Asia, Latin America, and the Middle East.

If we want these students to succeed -- to have the foundation of hard and soft skills that will allow them to maximize their use of time in business school, and to subsequently transform as broad a range of fields as their backgrounds represent -- then we must help them by leveling the playing field in an MBA environment that tends to privilege a more narrow set of pre-MBA professional and educational backgrounds.

Your help in funding this campaign will allow us to create a unique learning experience for rising MBAs who will gather at the University of Washington's campus in Seattle this coming July for 1-3 weeks of hands-on learning spanning everything from financial modeling via Excel to creating an individual MBA career strategy.

We are excited to have garnered early media attention in the following publications:

  • ‘Extra Help for Foreign M.B.A.s’ – The Wall Street Journal
  • ‘A Pre-MBA Boot Camp for New Admits’ – Poets & Quants
  • ‘Heading to Business School? An Essential Pre-MBA Strategy’ – Forbes

Can you help make this project a reality?

We need your help to fund the 2014 Practice MBA Summer Forum! 

Each Indiegogo contribution towards our $30,000 goal will be divided among the following three, mission-critical categories:

  • Marketing -- help us generate broader awareness of our program and services among incoming and future MBAs by boosting our global marketing efforts via sites such as Clear Admit, Poets & Quants, GMAT Club, and Beat the GMAT.

  • Scholarships -- help us start a scholarship fund that will reduce cost barriers for talented students who need our program most. We will dedicate a portion of each contribution to fund scholarships for students attending specific schools. (MBA alumni will be able to help students admitted to their alma mater participate in Practice MBA.)

  • Faculty -- help us bring additional world-class faculty from both the private sector and higher education together at the University of Washington for our inaugural, in-person program in July 2014 (defraying travel costs and allowing us to invest in additional course modules and curriculum development).

We believe that we can dramatically improve students' baseline knowledge and capabilities, as well as their academic performance, job-search outcomes, and overall sense of well-being during the critical first year of business school.

What else can you do?

Please share our campaign link with friends and family, with the special MBAs in your life, and with colleagues who care about business education and its outcomes.

Please Facebook post, Tweet, or add our campaign URL to your favorite LinkedIn Group or discussion by copying and pasting the text below:

" Help Ivan’s new venture, Practice MBA, change the face of business school education: http://bit.ly/1mc7Ing "

If you simply want to use our full campaign link, it is:

  • www.igg.me/at/practicemba

Last but not least ...
A Wilderness Skills Course for rising MBAs

At Seattle's doorstep lie some of the most compelling natural settings in North America -- to the South and East, the volcanic peaks of the Cascade Range (including 14,411 ft. Mt. Rainier); to the North, the archipelago of the San Juan Islands in the Salish Sea; and to the West, the Olympic Peninsula and the Hoh Rainforest, the wettest place in the continental U.S..

In 2014, we're proud to offer a series of optional 7-day Wilderness Skills courses in Washington's Central Cascade mountains to rising MBAs who want to complement their business school preparation efforts with an outdoor skills-building course that will highlight the natural beauty of the Cascade Range and allow them to experience learning in a wilderness classroom.

We've partnered with The National Outdoor Leadership School (NOLS), the world’s premier outdoor education organization, to create a Wilderness Skills course that not only enables our students to acquire the skills necessary to travel comfortably and safely in the remote backcountry, but to acquire an appreciation for the environment, an understanding of natural resources conservation topics, and a love for the outdoors that will change their lives and guide their actions as future business leaders.

Please help us spread the word and attract our first class of students to the 2014 Practice MBA-NOLS Wilderness Skills course!

Here are photo samples of some of our great perks!

We hope you enjoy some of these great perks!! These contribution rewards give us an opportunity to thank you for your support, and to celebrate all that is great about Seattle.

story:
Who We Are

Hey people, we're a Denver, CO. based business and we're excited to bring you the best Television and Live Events from around the WORLD, such as concerts and music festivals, directly to your tablet, smart device (Apple-Android) or even your television at home. We've been working hard here in Denver for the past year to get this product developed and into the hands of the people that want it the most!


Every year more and more people get tired of dealing with those large media monopolies and aren't left with too many options. We found that even with the few options that are available, you will still be sacrificing quality for accessibility/convenience.We want you to sacrifice NOTHING!!

With a growing number of baby boomers learning the ins and outs of all this new technology, the number of people "cutting the cord" on their cable and satellite providers keeps rising every year. With this trend, those monopolies will be struggling to keep up. We're hoping for that!! This will keep your viewing experience inexpensive and thorough! As well as give incentive's to those companies to maintain great quality streams in this growing market.


Our #1 Objective: capture content at the Highest quality and Stream it back at the Highest quality!! We've gone with the big dogs in the industry BrightCove to achieve this. We are willing to give you only THE BEST QUALITY possible! To us the only way to reach this goal is with BrightCove, they recently received a few awards, one of which was for the "Best Enterprise Video Platform!"

YOU have the power to bring television & LIVE events to the world! So help bring this product into fruition and we'll hook you up for your wonderful contributions!!

What We Need & What You Get

Like we mentioned earlier we wont settle for anything less than the BEST!!

In order to achieve this we need to reach our goal of $50,000. This funding will be used to set up our contract with BrightCove in order to stream all the content that we want for our network!! With them we'll be at the same caliber as one of our favorite networks SHOWTIME!

We will also need funding for the Server farm which will store ALL of our content! If you've ever seen a server farm you know that the technology is AWESOME and, with all awesome tech comes BIG MONEY$$!! So with a little help, you will have your favorite show, movie or event archived for you to watch, when you want, where ever you want, even LIVE! 

Maybe you've been dying to show your cousin or mom your favorite show The Office from here in America back home in Peru. Well this is how you will get that done,YouTix LIVE! Maybe you just miss your favorite Team from back home in Spain or the Soap Opera from Italy, Finisce Centovetrine, that you love the most.

We want to bring that to you and give you the freedom to take it with you where ever your life leads you! In order to do these things we must also secure licenses from as many networks from around the world as possible. So connections are invaluable to us as well, if you would like to partner with us, send us your contact info and a proposal.

One last thing you will be helping with is getting this GREAT STAFF a nice salary so they can stop eating like college students ;)  !  !  !

The Impact

Have you been on a business trip for multiple weeks or even months? Did you miss your shows or live events? Are you tired of trying to stream your recorded shows from you Sling box or streaming websites/apps? Can't watch your favorite sport in China? Maybe you just want to see Cricket games from India?

We found that there is a growing trend in the amount of people throwing away their TV network contracts and going towards streaming everything, from movies to TV shows, ALL on the internet!


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't invest any money for now and we respect that!! Yet contributions don't always have to have a monetary value!! We would love it if you could spread the word about this great idea and hop on board once it's available to the general market. Spread our YouTix Live Link  and campaign link on your Facebook, like our Facebook page and follow our Twitter, that is worth TONS to us!!

https://twitter.com/youtixlive

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Youtixlive


With your help we'll be watching NEW MOVIES on Mt. Fiji by the end of this year!! Or watching the NBA Finals in China by next season!!!! Help YouTix Live make this happen!! THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT, YOU ARE OUR FUTURE AND A ROCKSTAR!!


http://blog.brightcove.com/en/2013/12/its-nice-be-recognized%E2%80%A6 -Brightcove Awards link



Getting some great exposure!

http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/a-great-new-product-for-existing--future-cord-cutters-241536981.html

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT, YOU ARE OUR FUTURE AND A ROCKSTAR!!http://blog.brightcove.com/en/2013/12/its-nice-be-recognized%E2%80%A6 -Brightcove Awards linkGetting some great exposure!http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/a-great-new-product-for-existing--future-cord-cutters-241536981.html

story:
What's This All About?

Thank you for you support.  Please contact Debbie Kardon Schwartz at dkschwartz@cohencamps.org for more information.

For more information or to apply please go to http://www.onwardisrael.com/category/cohen-camps

http://www.onwardisrael.com/category/cohen-camps

Invest in Israel, Internships & Jewish Camp. The Cohen Camps, a family of three Jewish camps in New England, invest deeply in their campers and staff. Our oldest campers can cap off their experience with our immensely popular Dor L'Dor (DLD) leadership program, a five-week leadership training program which combines Israel travel with CIT camp counselor experience. Now we're taking DLD to the next level:

Our Camp counselors want to return to camp as counselors during college, and we want them to do so: they bring enormous energy and experience to our campers. And yet these young leaders face enormous pressure to secure internships that will make them more marketable after college. 

To meet this challenge, the Cohen Camps is pioneering a new initiative: Dor L'Dor: College Style. In collaboration with the well-regarded Onward Israel program, a program of the Jewish Agency for Israel (JAFI), Dor L'Dor will be able to offer a professional Israel internship program, designed just for Cohen Camps college-age counselors, followed by a full summer of a higher-level camp job. It's a seamless way to have it all: global work experience, a deeper connection to Israel, and a summer job that benefits both the student and the campers. 

Simply put, Dor L'Dor College Style is an entirely new concept in Jewish camping and education, invented by the Cohen Camps but already being looked at as a model by others. We are thrilled to pilot it during Summer 2014. 

Curious about DLD-College Style? Click the link below to read the story of how DLD-College came to be and please share widely!
http://www.camppembroke.org/blog/creating-internships-and-great-counselors-too-dld-college-style/ 

All the things about Dor L’Dor: College Style to love! 

 

Breaking It Down: How's it going to work?

  • Partnering with Onward Israel, 9 - 12 participants, all DLD graduates selected on the basis of their applications, will train in five-week intensive internships in Israel in May-June 2014, combining their work with high level learning and Israel engagement activities.  
  • These participants will then return to New England in time for staff orientation to work for the summer at their Camp as a veteran counselor.

What We Need & What You Get

 

With any new start-up there are often a few hurdles to overcome. Our main challenge is funding. The Cohen Camps need to raise an initial investment of $18,000 to make this program a reality. This investment helps cover the costs of staff, program planning, identifying great internships and making placement matches.

Of course, this isn't the full cost; the remainder of the program costs is being shared by Onward Israel and other donors.

The more funding, the more counselors who can participate. With a minimum of $18,000, we can launch an entirely new kind of internship and training program for nine college-aged counselors. All funds raised go directly to fund DLD: College Style.

We've got some great perks to offer as a thank you for your investment! These include a video diary, a group video chat with our interns (from Israel), and a Shabbat lunch at a camp with the counselors after they return. You can see a list of all the perks along the right-hand side of this page.

The Known Impact

We know that:

  • Great Camp Counselors are the foundation for a great camper experience. They are essential role models and mentors.

  • Veteran counselors help establish continuity, traditions and model high level camper/counselor relationships.

  • The first trip to Israel opens the door and forges a connection to Israel. The second touch deepens the connection and builds a solid foundation.

  • Our college students need 21st-Century skills and global work experience to get the jobs they want after graduation. We want to help.

The Impact:

  • The Participants: Job marketability and skills, while retaining the opportunity to participate in Jewish Overnight Camping.

  • Cohen Camps : A cohort of veteran counselors who will return to work at camp and ensure continuity and traditions as well as become a role model for staff and campers.
  • Jewish Overnight Camping: this program will become a model for other camps, whose college counselors are all facing the same counselor vs. internship dilemma.
  • The Jewish Community: Young professionals with an increased desire to connect and contribute to the greater Jewish community as a result of this unique program. Inspired by their second touch to Israel, this cohort of counselors will transition from being a college student to a young professional with a deeper connection to Israel.

BONUS:
Our Israel intern counselors will meet the Israeli-resident counselors the Cohen Camps hire to work at the Camps. The interns will benefit from having peers in Israel to help them acclimate, while the Israeli counselors will come to Camp knowing their fellow counselors.

 

Ways You Can Help

Please donate! In addition, please help: 

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google Plus, and other social sites. Use the hashtag: #DLDCollege
  •  TWEET: Donate now 2 @cohencamps campaign! College internships in Israel AND high-level camp jobs http://bit.ly/DLDCollegeStyle #DLDCollege 
  • Post to FACEBOOK: I love this! Watch and fund Dor L'Dor: College Style, Mashes eye-opening Israel internships with camp work experience to create awesome camp counselors. Fund the Cohen Camps IndieGoGo campaign http://bit.ly/DLDCollegeStyle  #DLDCollege
  • LIKE the Dor L'Dor Cohen Camps Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/DorLDorCohenCamps. Every "like" spreads the campaign further.
  • Want to blog about this great idea, or have another idea of how you'd like to be involved? We'd love to have you! Send an email to social@cohencamps.org.

The interns will benefit from having peers in Israel to help them acclimate, while the Israeli counselors will come to Camp knowing their fellow counselors.  Ways You Can HelpPlease donate! In addition, please help:

story:
Hi! Thanks for stopping by!

My name is Shiloh and I love learning. Growing up, I was one of those weidos who loved school and I would be profoundly upset if I had to miss a day.

Today, I'd be more than profoundly upset if I have to miss even a day at Mount Holyoke College due to not being able to afford the tuition. My partial scholarship from MHC covers most of the costs; however, my mother and I are having some difficulties coming up with the rest.

Potential donor, I've applied for scholarship after scholarship, but nothing has fallen through for me yet. If this doesn't work out, I may end up having to rob a bank. Kidding! I may be poor and desperate but I still have morals.

And that's exactly why you should donate to my campaign: I'm a good person and an excellent student. I place extreme value on getting an education and becoming a person that can make a difference in this world. I'm certain that if you support my campaign I won't let you down.

What I Need & What You Get

  • There are a great deal of perks to helping me, including handwritten thank you notes, regular updates, and, of course, extreme gratitude. 
  • The $5,000 which I'm asking for will go towards paying the remainder of my tuition for this year. This will cover about half what MHC is expecting me and my mom to provide.
  • Even if we can't reach the goal, any contributions will go towards paying off my tuition. I'll appreciate anything!

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't donate. However, if you still want to help me, spread the word about my campaign! I'd appreciate as much help as I can get!

story:
Hello, I have created this fundraiser to help open the doors to Dragon Phoenix School of Internal Martial Arts. Martial arts found me when I was a teenager and it has always felt like an element that has helped me in many ways and is meant to be a part of me. Recently I've found why that is and why all of my travels have led me to where I am. This is why I will open a martial arts school that focuses on helping people to feel better in the mind and the body.

I will open this school beginning in September of this year. It will be a struggle, but I am putting in everything that I have to make it happen, and it will succeed. There are some upfront costs that will be difficult. This is why I created this fundraiser. If you are willing to help me with some of the initial startup costs I would be more than grateful.

The biggest upfront cost will be rent of facilities to teach in. I plan on renting a location hourly at an established exercise center for my kids and teens classes. For my older adult class, I look to teach at a community center during the day that will be conveniently located for the students. This will greatly cut down on my initial costs, making my chances of success greater. In five years after becoming solidly established I plan on moving to a permanent location.

For the kids and teens classes I will offer a free uniform with a membership so that the students all feel like they belong to the group. This fundraiser also goes toward the initial upfront costs of a large uniform order.

In order to bring in students and be successful, I will need to reach out to the community and advertise my school.


When a person thinks of a martial arts studio, they usually imagine punching bags and mirrors and all sorts of fancy training equipment. One of the great things about how and what I teach is that none of that extra stuff is necessary. All I need is a big open room with preferably a wood floor.

 
The styles that I will be teaching are internal martial arts. The most well known one is Tai Chi. In the kids and teens classes it will be eventually shown as a fighting style, while in the older adults class it will be used as a holistic healing exercise. With internal martial arts, the focus is strengthening oneself from the inside out. It requires a disciplined mind and a relaxed body.

I've only set this fundraiser at $1000. The above startup costs will equal much more than that. I'm using this fundraiser to help give me a boost and make it a little easier for me to accomplish my dreams. If I raise my goal I will be elated and anything beyond will add to the smile in my heart. If you would like to learn some more details of this school, please visit the webpage at www.dragonphoenix.org .

Thank you for your support.

story:
Short Summary

HarambeeToday seeks to develop and foster an intellectual community, where Africanists can share their perspectives and insights pertaining to African economics. Our goal is to gather and disseminate useful insights that inspire readers worldwide to collaborate and advocate for the creation of a level playing field for Africans in local and global markets. 

The concept for HarambeeToday originated from members of the African Student Union on the Auraria Campus in Denver, Colorado. ASU members agreed to create a movement that would address economic inequities in Africa, but that undertaking meant dealing with the misconceptions and ignorance about Africa, and how it became the region with the poorest population. Debunking myths that have long dominated Africa’s identity would require a platform for dialogue and education. HarambeeToday is that platform. Harambee is Swahili for “all pull together.” In Kenya, when a community member is in need of resources, “Harambee” is the expression used to gather the community into providing the necessary resources.

The site will be lead by Rita Wold, a freelance journalist who has written for The Denver Post and the Denver Urban Spectrum. She earned a B.A. in journalism with a minor in Africa and Middle East studies from Metropolitan State University of Denver.  She is a first generation American of Eritrean descent who is passionate about Africa and African people.

What We Need

The cash required will see the business through until cash-flow break-even is achieved. The start-up cost includes paying writers, purchasing business insurance, advertising, and operational expenses.

After the $7,000 is raised, we will still have much work to do. First we will complete the website and mobile application of the site. Then we will plan a year worth of topics and find the best scholars for each topic.  Although there is much work to be done, we plan to launch five months after the campaign is over.  We have already developed a business plan with an in depth marketing and sales strategies.  We have all the skills and people to make it happen. We just need time to get everything going.

story:
Mindfulness, Music, and Education

What is mindfulness?  Mindfulness means maintaining a moment-by-moment awareness of our thoughts, feelings, bodily sensations, and surrounding environment.  (From GreaterGood.)

I'm a musician and educator who also practices mindfulness.  The more time I spend doing these different things, the more I see that they're not just unified by the fact that they all interest me, but that there is profound potential for them to enhance each other. Here's a little more about me:

I'm a K-8th grade general music teacher at a public charter school.  I've been trained in Orff Schulwerk, a developmental music education approach that foregrounds movement, improvisation, and composition.  Outside of my teaching, I'm a singer-songwriter who performs around the L.A. area.  I like to think of myself as a teaching artist, because the insights and experiences in my life as a musical artist inform my teaching in the classroom, and vice versa.

As a music educator, I'm a lifelong learner of music who's in the trenches every day figuring out how to better process music for children and help them unleash their musical, creative thinking, and collaborative skills.

Help a Music Educator Develop Her Craft

I'm naturally pretty shy, and so becoming someone who performs publicly has been a journey.  I've had to deal with stage fright and performance anxiety, and practicing mindfulness has helped me with this greatly.  As a music teacher, creating performance opportunities for children is part of my job, and I believe that teaching them mindfulness gives them a tool for dealing with the stress of performing.

In addition to being a life skill for reducing stress, mindfulness can also enhance creativity.  To be able to listen to each other while playing, to be able to accept your playing without judging it, to be able to be present and improvise -- all these require mental skills of attention and focus that can be trained through mindfulness.

Beyond music-specific benefits of practicing mindfulness, general benefits include better focus and concentration, increased sense of calm, decreased sense of anxiety, increased self-awareness, increased empathy, and more here.

The organization Mindful Schools has had great success with bringing mindfulness into the classroom.  I received a scholarship to take their Curriculum Training, which will give me the tools I need to design mindfulness curriculum for children. Amount needed after scholarship: $250.

In addition, I would like to enhance my work in early childhood music education and receive training through Music Together.  This will strengthen my teaching of younger children.  Paired with the mindfulness curriculum training, this will also enable me to bring a mindful approach to music education to families with young children in my community.  Music Together also prides itself on showing musical artists how to incorporate their own personal artistry in the classroom, which is something that I believe can strengthen my teaching.  Amount needed: $425.

Perks include digital downloads of my music, and copies of a mindfulness journal I'm creating for educators called Educator/Meditator, which will have exercises you can do to bring mindfulness into your life.

The Impact

Mindful Schools has taught mindfulness to over 30,000 and has shown mindfulness to have discernible effects on children's behavior and social/emotional skills.  By contributing to this project, you'll help me bring these benefits to the hundreds of children I currently work with -- and, over the course of my career, hopefully many more. 

You will also be supporting me in exploring the rich intersection between mindfulness and creativity.

Other Ways You Can Help

Post a link to this campaign by sharing this link: igg.me/at/laurenkinney

story:
First I want to thank you for visiting my page and for taking the time to know me and what i feel that the Lord is leading me to do this summer.

This summer i have the awesome opportunity to work with ACTS' Wilder institute and Luke18project's Summer leadership program. Both of these programs focus on raising up young adults who pursue the first and great commandment to love the Lord their God and  then they are thrust into the great commission to preach the same message that they have just received. 


The ACTS' Wilder Institute focuses on sending these college age students to the 10/40 window where a majority of the people groups have not heard his name while the SLP program focuses on sending students back to their college campuses to plant and fuel prayer and missional communities. 

With all this Said i Just want to invite you to partner with me as i raise some funds to help me with the expenses for the summer schools. I have been working hard this summer to cover some of the expenses while also paying for graduate school so it will be a great help to get most of the money in to help me be able to go and serve. If i have an extra i will put towards my expenses for working with the campus furnaces in the fall.

If you are interested in hearing more about ACTS or LUKE18Project you can contact me and we can meet over coffee or Just talk on the phone. you can also visit their youtube pages and websites which have great information about themselves.

Please be praying for me as well as my friend Katy that I will be going to Wilder Institute with. She is a worship leader and serves with me at Malone university.

First I want to thank you for visiting my page and for taking the time to know me and what i feel that the Lord is leading me to do this summer. This summer i have the awesome opportunity to work with ACTS' Wilder institute and Luke18project's Summer leadership program. Both of these programs focus on raising up young adults who pursue the first and great commandment to love the Lord their God and  then they are thrust into the great commission to preach the same message that they have just received. The ACTS' Wilder Institute focuses on sending these college age students to the 10/40 window where a majority of the people groups have not heard his name while the SLP program focuses on sending students back to their college campuses to plant and fuel prayer and missional communities. With all this Said i Just want to invite you to partner with me as i raise some funds to help me with the expenses for the summer schools. I have been working hard this summer to cover some of the expenses while also paying for graduate school so it will be a great help to get most of the money in to help me be able to go and serve. If i have an extra i will put towards my expenses for working with the campus furnaces in the fall.If you are interested in hearing more about ACTS or LUKE18Project you can contact me and we can meet over coffee or Just talk on the phone. you can also visit their youtube pages and websites which have great information about themselves. Please be praying for me as well as my friend Katy that I will be going 
to Wilder Institute with. She is a worship leader and serves with me at 
Malone university.

story:
What is unique about the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund?

If there is anything more inspiring than a young man or woman’s pursuit of their life’s dream, it’s a young person whose dream has been severely challenged, even taken from them by circumstances beyond their control, and who is determined not to give up. This is precisely the kind of young people who come to Greystone – they have a long-held dream of attending one of the US Federal Service Academies, and have received that dreaded letter of rejection.  However, they are unwilling to give up – and this is exactly why we are asking you to make a 100% tax-deductible donation to the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund.

But, there is something unique and special about any donation you make to the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund. Unlike all other scholarship assistance, it will not be used to provide only one scholarship and then be gone. Every dollar that you donate now will come back to the fund, again and again, to be used repeatedly for successive generations of Greystone students.

We’ll explain how this works in a moment – but before describing why your tax deductible donation will have this especially powerful impact, please allow us to tell you why the Greystone students who will benefit from the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund deserve your help.

Who will benefit from DreamMaker?

Greystone Preparatory School serves young people whose dream is to serve our country as a military officer after completing their education at one of our five Military Academies. What makes Greystone students stand out is that in spite of having first-rate academic records as well as solid records of accomplishment in athletics, community service, and extracurricular leadership throughout High School, their initial applications for appointments and admission to the Military Academy at West Point, Naval Academy, the Air Force Academy, the Coast Guard Academy or the Merchant Marine Academy were turned down.

This happens to thousands of highly qualified and motivated young men and women every year. There are relatively few slots available at each of the Service Academies for the many young people who dream of serving. Very often they are turned down simply because their GPA was .001% below that of the last candidate who was accepted, or because someone else had a slightly better letter of recommendation – or even simply because there are limited slots available in every Congressional district and there are always more highly qualified applicants than available appointments.

Whatever the reason for being turned down, many young men and women simply shrug and turn away, pursuing their life’s goals by another route. And most of them, because of who they are, will be successful in life. But there are always a few very special young people who take the hit, get up, dust themselves off, and move forward with determination toward the Service Academy dream that they will not abandon.

These are the young people who find Greystone.  For the past ten years, Greystone has taken these young people in and given them a first-class university education that is the equivalent of their first year math, science and humanities coursework at any of the Service Academies. They are worked with day and night in every way to ensure that their second application is successful. And over the past ten years over 98% of Greystone students have received at least one academy appointment, and many have received multiple appointments.

What does Greystone do?

Greystone is physically located on the campus of Schreiner University, a small, vibrant Texas institution with roots as a military prep school early in the 20th Century.  Since that time Schreiner has evolved into a leading private university that draws students from around the country and the world. Schreiner is no longer the small Texas Hill Country School that it once was, but it retains its allegiance to the goals and aspirations of young people whose ideals include service to others. That is why Greystone chose to affiliate with Schreiner University - to offer young people a chance to achieve their dream of becoming an academy-trained military officer.

Everybody knows that university education is expensive, and Schreiner University is no exception. Students who come to Greystone must find a way to pay for their freshman year at Schreiner. Between Schreiner’s resources and Greystone ’s resources we are usually able to find the financial help that students need. (It is important to say here that Greystone students pay NOTHING extra for the Greystone program – they simply have to come up with the normal freshman year expenses of attending Schreiner University, and nothing else.) In most cases the assistance that Schreiner and Greystone can offer together is enough, because most of our students have at least some family resources to fill in the remaining financial gap between assistance and expenses.

Why is there a special need?

However, every year one or two young people with special circumstances in their lives find us after being turned down, and they show us the fire in their bellies and the grit in their personality, and we know that these young people are destined to succeed. But – and this is where the Dream Maker scholarship Fund will come into play – their families have no resources to fill in that gap left when all available financial assistance is exhausted. Some of these young people don’t even have families – they have grown up in Foster Care, or in even more challenging circumstances. They have nothing except faith in themselves and an unstoppable desire to be accepted at one of the Service Academies and to make a life for themselves serving our country.

Greystone is not wealthy. We have no endowment. We have several small scholarship funds that have been set up by the families of friends of Greystone who have passed away, and we use the limited funds that are available through their generosity every year to help as many students as possible. But when a student comes to us with no resources at all, helping them is very difficult. Do we give that one student the whole $10,000 that is needed to fill in the gap, or do we help five highly qualified, high potential students who need just $2,000 each to fill in the gap? This is not an easy decision. Sometimes in the past we have decided that the young person who needs the $10,000 is so special that we have done what, in our minds, was the right thing and we have brought them on board. (And, by the way, in every single case where we have done that it was absolutely the right decision, because these students have always gone on to one of the academies and all are now either upper classmen and outstanding leaders or already serving with distinction as officers in the US Armed Forces.)

But we haven’t always been able to make that decision. Sometimes the money just wasn’t there. And that is why we are asking you to help us start the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund. This fund will be used only in cases where the financial need is so extreme, and the potential of the young person is so great, that turning them down would deny them their dream, and our country their service, simply because a few more dollars can’t be found.

Why will my donation have a long term impact?

Finally, here is why your donation to the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund will do far more than just pay for financial assistance to one of these deserving and highly qualified young people.

Every young person who enters a Service Academy and proves themselves by reaching the end of their third year, and who therefore is indisputably on their way to graduating and serving, is offered a financial package by one or more of the great financial institutions that serve military officers – institutions like USAA, and Navy Federal Credit Union.  This financial package is in the form of an ultra-low interest, extended term loan that is collateralized simply by their word of honor as an officer. The purpose of this loan has historically been to enable the young Academy graduate to buy their dress uniforms, a new car, an apartment, and perhaps to start married life. However, in the case of Greystone students that have received funds from the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund, before they borrow for any other purpose, they will borrow enough to pay back the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund in full for the assistance that they received. We will not make them sign any loan papers or legal contracts in return for receiving DreamMaker Scholarship Fund assistance – they will simply sign a pledge that, on their honor as a future officer, they will pay back the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund immediately upon receiving  their Third Year loan package.

This means that year after year, into the indefinite future, the donation that you make now to the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund will be supporting generations of future officers attending one of the US Service Academies. Every hundred dollars given now will ultimately do the work of thousands of dollars, continuing to help young people whose service to our country would otherwise be lost. With your tax-deductible help, Greystone and the DreamMaker Scholarship Fund will be there to ensure that this does not happen.

story:
Bula! 

Thank you to everyone who has helped me raise my goal! I have started another campaign at http://igg.me/p/626563/x/5081332, we are running out of time until I have to send the funds to Fiji! Please help me raise enough for rugby posts!

("Welcome!" in Fijian) 

I have recently reached my goal but overfunding is even better so please still donate!!! The extra money will be going to a rugby field (the Fijian national sport) for the children to play on, tiling classroom floors, or a photo copier!

            My name is Paloma Palmer and over this past summer I lived in a village called Nasivikoso in the heart of the Fijian highlands. During my stay in this impoverished village I contributed to the construction of a local elementary and middle school. In the mornings I did various jobs of construction and taught English to children in grades 1-4 in the evenings. This school is important to the local Fijians because the other school  the children would have to attend is a 3 mile hike away from the village. Once the rainy seasons begin in Fiji, the attendance rate drops severely due to flooding and an increase in sickness. 

How are the children of Nasivikoso to better their community if they don't have an education?

          This is why the local Nasivikoso Village School is crucial. The classrooms that are in the process of being  built are an amazing step forward, but there is still a lack of supplies. Desks and chairs are basic necessities for a productive class. I am returning next summer to Nasivikoso, hoping to have enough money to buy 30 pairs of desks and chairs. 

         A desk and a chair is $100 and my goal is to raise $3,000. I will raise $2,000 from Indiegogo and the other $1,000 from selling t-shirts that I designed at my school. The Nasivikoso school is desperate to support their children with what they need to be successful. With the help of your donation, education for these children will be easier to access, with something so simple as a desk and a chair! Through the Rustic Pathways Foundation, 100% of the donations will go to the cause that I have chosen.

         If you contribute more than $25 I will send you a heartfelt thank-you letter and pictures of the desks and chairs, the children, and the school. If I do not reach my goal that is okay because every single penny that I raise is going to the Nasivikoso School so nothing will go to waste! Education is the key to the future of the Nasivikoso village and is a very important part in a child's life. Without education they will not be able to make a better life for their families and grow as a community. The people of Nasivikoso deserve an education and deserve a bright future. Please help with a donation! Any amount is welcome because with your donation, no matter what size, the children will get closer and closer to a better education.

story:
I am a single working mother of three.  After divorcing several years ago, I went back to college to finish my Bachelor's Degree in Business Management.  I also went from a stay-at-home mom to a working mom.  My mother and my aunts are all real estate agents and I have assisted them off and on over the years to earn extra money.  I have been exposed to the real estate and mortgage business for over 20 years.  I very much enjoy this type of industry.  I found that I thoroughly enjoy working as the back end person, pushing papers and bringing attention to detail.  I like organized detailed chaos and that is what you get when you are a loan processor.  No loan application package is ever perfect and it is the job of the loan processor to make it perfect.  That is my gift, to make a borrower's dream come true by helping them gather and perfect what they need to get the loan they want approved.  The only down side to this is that the industry and the laws change rapidly. One way to keep up is continuing education.  


On April 30th I went to work as normal, ready to conquer the day.  I loved the company I worked for, the people I worked with and I enjoyed my job tremendously.  Unfortunately, my entire department was let go that day due to restructuring.  Basically, they moved our department here on the east coast back to the home office on the west coast and with no option for us to relocate. Suddenly, I was unemployed.  I decided to do some research to see how I could beef up my resume, further my education and take full advantage of this time off work while job hunting.  I found the National Association of Mortgage Processors online.  Then, I found out about their Boot Camp that allows you to take all the classes you need to become a Master Loan Processor for a fraction of the cost.  Having just been laid off work, I knew I did not have those funds available.  I called NAMP anyway and was informed that because I was let go through no fault of my own and was qualified for unemployment benefits (although not very much), they would give me the Boot Camp classes for HALF OFF.  That means for $495, I can become The Master Processor!  $495 is still not in my budget with three children and only a small unemployment income.  So I am asking you to please donate and/or share to help me raise the $495 and become The Master at my job!  I thank you in advance for your time in reading this, sharing this and hopefully donating.

Please visit www.mortgageprocessor.org for info on National Association of Mortgage Processors and to see more info on the Boot Camp offered.

story:
RH Conwell Elementary School served the children of Worthington as a public school until 2010, when the school was closed by the Gateway Regional School District (GRSD). Parents, friends, and community members banded together to reopen the school as a private, community school. This school has held firm to its mission, which is to prioritize the education of people in Worthington.  When the school reopened it remained true to its roots with unprecedented community and parent involvement and support.  This involvement and support is inherent in the name that was chosen for the private school.  Together we raised funds and conceived a vision.  Together we opened an elementary school in Worthington where no child was turned away for financial reasons. 

RH Conwell Community Education Center provides a “home away from home” where students can feel safe and gain confidence. Because the school is small, the staff gets to know each student and family. Teachers shape curriculum according to the needs and interests of individual children.  The curriculum extends beyond the building walls to the woods and garden, the parent-made bike trail, the restaurant across the street, the library down the road, and to the farms and fields of our town. We are, at our core, a community school. In addition to opening a private school, our community has been working with local and state government to reopen RH Conwell as a public school.  We are currently in the process of having a bill passed that will allow Worthington to exit from the GRSD and run its own elementary school.  The bill has already passed the House and is now awaiting approval from the Senate. 

We have now come upon another hurdle and we need your help.  We are confident that the legislation will pass and we will be able to reopen RH Conwell as a public school for the 2015-2016 school year.  However, we need your help to raise $300,000 to keep the RH Conwell Community Center open for this bridge year!  Our current funding sources will not be able to support us to the extent that they have for the last four school years, and our community does not want to send its children away from town for one year. To ensure our ability to operate at full capacity next year we need your help now.  Your donation will go directly to the school so we can remain open during this bridge year from private back to a public school. 

Please consider making a tax-deductible donation to help keep our civic and educational mission alive.  Any amount will be a great help and if you cannot afford to donate any money please forward our message to your friends.  We thank you all for your continued support!

Sincerely,

The RH Conwell Community Education Center Family

public school for the 2015-2016 school year.  However, we need your help to raise $300,000 to keep the RH
Conwell Community Center open for this bridge year!  Our current
funding sources will not be able to support us to the extent that they have for
the last four school years, and our community does not want to send its
children away from town for one year. To
ensure our ability to operate at full capacity next year we need your help
now.  Your donation will go directly to the school so we can remain
open during this bridge year from
private back to a public school. 
Please consider making a
tax-deductible donation to help keep
our civic and educational mission alive.  Any amount will be a great help
and if you cannot afford to donate any money please forward our message to your
friends.  We thank you all for your continued support!
Sincerely,
The RH Conwell Community
Education Center Family

story: Cooper Union, a prestigious art school in New York City has been historically known as a free institution.However, due to financial concerns in 2014 the no tuition policy has been eliminated.My son graduated high school and earned certificate from the National Honor Society and was accepted to 7 Colleges.He selected Cooper Union.Living at home would impair his ability to grow as an individual and make it difficult to focus on his studies, while living in the dorms would be the perfect way to nurture his growth and development as an artist.While he received a scholarship to attend school, I am raising funds for expensive dormitory costs.Dormitory fees total $11,220.00 per year.Please contribute what you can.Without your support we could not make this happen.

story:
I am Claudius Thompson, Executive Director of Hoops Care International, a nonprofit organization in Cape Coast, Ghana; providing opportunities to develop leadership skills, healthy lifestyle, work ethics, commitment, integrity and honesty through basketball.

This campaign is to enable us repair and replace the basketball rims and boards at the Hoops Care Court. This is the only open playground in the community and serves over 1,000 students from more than 30 schools in and around Cape Coast. The court also serves as a training ground for persons with disabilities in Cape Coast, mainly the physically challenged and special needs.

By helping us carry on this facelift of the basketball court, you will be providing grounds for the youth to come and learn where they will be mentor on how to live life on and off the court. The venue is also use to advocate on various issues affecting the community. In the past, basketball camps and tournaments gear towards malaria, HIV/AIDS awareness were hosted. Having the children to come on a daily basis helps them stay away from social vices.

A total of $1699 is needed currently. The funds raised will go mainly in getting new basketball rims for the backboards. Nonetheless, the boards and posts need to be refurbished. The basketball court is located not far from the Atlantic ocean causing the metals to rust faster than those situated further inland, giving the need for anti-rust paint to be apply on all that is metal. Funds raise will also help in painting the lines, backboards and walls surrounding the edifice. There is also the need to repair and fix the lighten system at the park. If our goal is not met, what is raise will still help out in providing anti-rust and floor paint. By helping to accomplish this goal, you stand to gain a branded t-shirt from Hoops Care as an appreciation for your generous gift.

Your contribution will make a great impact. You will be helping in building a community and empowering its members in areas of sports, health and education. Two years ago, Hoops Care received over $2,000 in funding which was implemented in the construction and refurbishment of the present basketball court. The nonprofit is known to deliver from fundraiser. The "Save 1000 Children from Malaria" fundraiser helped in providing mosquito bed nets and the registration of 250 children under the National Health Insurance Scheme wherein they will receive free health care for the next five years. The nonprofit has also been able to train 15 young single mothers in entrepreneurial program to become self employed.


You can also help this project in other ways besides giving. You can assist by passing the word around about our project. Share our project and its story through your social network. Kindly do this by suing the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks for taking the time to know more about this cause.

story:
The Inspiration

Last year Tim Kruse added 100 American Flags to the patriotic display along Greenville's historic Park Street.  Many residents of the street already participate and have a flag placed in their front yard by the Greenville Rotary.  The additional 100 flags placed a flag on average every 40’ on each side of the street.  Tim was inspired to go out on his own and acquire the flags after watching a CBS Sunday Morning episode that featured Larry Eckhardt aka “The Flagman” and his efforts to honor America’s fallen heroes.  This past year, Tim’s flags were used to line a portion of the funeral procession of the late Navy Seal, Chris Kyle.

The Project

This year Tim Kruse is working to extend the flag lined streets to include the sections of Stonewall and Johnson Streets that run between Park Street and Downtown Greenville. This will be an amazing display of patriotism on the sections of road that line the beautiful green space leading in and out of the heart of town. The flags will also be made available to any group or organization for use for future events.  By contributing to the project you are helping to place a name to each flag and a heart to the project that will grow stronger each year.
